7GGjfQ_nfGpCLPiOAQnw9g.review_text: Eight of us girls came in opening weekend and this weekend I brought in my boyz.  All of my friends LOVED Blackbird!  An enjoyable time was had by all, due to the FRIENDLY service, the QUALITY of the drinks,  the stylish DESIGN & good MUSIC & lighting.  We made our way down the Specialty Cocktail menu:  My personal favorite was the Grape Drink (muddled red flame grapes, tequila, peach bitters, agave syrup & sparkling wine.)  I appreciate the agave nectar and not the processed simple syrup that most bars would use for sweetners.  I also tried the Pina Colada, Sidecar & Early Bird which I enjoyed as well.  The Early Bird is very light and refreshing.  If you don't want an alcoholic drink, try a wine soda!  Yummy!  Next time I go, I'll start with the Grape Drink then an Early Bird and finish with a wine soda!  During both of my visits, I appreciated that the music was a mix of genres other than the typical "Techno or Dance" you find at "other" bars.  Also, I liked that there was a nice mix of both friendly male and female bartenders too!  Some of my friends played pool and commented that the pool table was a good one and that it must be new.  There is a photo booth in the back that I will definitely use the next time!  FYI, I didn't notice a sign in the front, so look for lots of windows & large plants on each side of the front door. I look forward to my return!  Thanks Blackbird Peeps!

5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: Blackbird is a classy gay bar.  It's comfortable and shiny inside with a nice lighting situation that works well for conversation of any sort (from intimate to pleasantries).  Have a great Heff on tap and I imagine their other drinks are just as nice.  But really all I need to say is that Blackbird is a classy gay bar.

ELOe1lpSqhyVQpaYbpN5wQ.review_text: This is definitley, my new favorite go-to spot!  Fanstastic drink menu, plenty of open space- comfortable and clean.  Love the location!

ut0TrQXHk_q50jxpldl7xw.review_text: Decent cocktails at a decent price 8-10. Great space and great people

kRW6GXDxkjoGTR3XvropeQ.review_text: Oh hey, just another fruit fly on the wall, chiming in to say you're fly, BB.  Admittedly, I've only been once, but have been wanting to go back.  Why, you ask?  FOR THE PICKLED CARROTS.  I loved mine in my bloody mary (which was good and reasonably priced)... so much so I went to the bar and asked for more.  WHICH THEY BEQUEATHED ME.  (FTR, I think it was a good looking Black Bird who did this, but I can't be sure.)  No, I know, right?  That's amazing.  (The carrot generosity that is, not my slightly racial undertones.)  The only reason I don't ever end up back here is because Lucky 13 is a stone's throw away (the best kind of throw), and their bloodies are (a) better, (b) cheaper, (c) accompanied by free popcorn and a patio.  Not really a competition.  But regardless, still want to come back here for more carrots.  Every time I get a bloody in a new place in the city, I dream they'll serve it with a carrot, just like BB did way back when.  And if my memory serves me correct(ly?), the ladies bathroom is big enough to do cartwheels in.  Hi, hello.  I love spacious bathrooms.  You should too.

xVoPECr9VIdiqZfF_yFT_A.review_text: Best time is happy hour the drinks our cheap and the place if full. The bartender is friendly and the customer our having fun  (It A Live) have fun

gMybOOtuW52AOQFiHrID3Q.review_text: A great neighborhood bar. Keep the tourists away!  Mixed crowd of fashionable gay boys, straight women and people from the neighborhood. Their cocktail selection is better than their wine, so try a stiff, old fashioned drink when you're here.  Also has a great pool table and photo booth in the back.  They only take cash, but there is an ATM in the back as well.

bYw7r6MGyGPRM-EYPM66ow.review_text: The most amazing delicious drinks ever! Highly recommend the "Secret Handshake". Blew my mind. Not the strongest ever, but definitely did the job.  Atmosphere was great. A dark, friendly place to go with friends. Not really great for huge groups if the place is busy, not a ton of seating.  Bartenders were really friendly. Had a GREAT selection of beers along with the house made drink specialties.  Had an amazing time. Would definitely return.

jSOo_HRnOER7bC4KVIlF0Q.review_text: Why hello my new favorite bar-on-the-cusp-of-the-castro/church-and-market-­area.  This space has been transformed into a sleek and stylish new spot that we can only hope the B&T will overlook.  The pool table in the back, old newspaper wallpapering and very trendy hardwood floor/ hanging ceiling things (that's the official term) give the whole place a SoHo vibe.  Staff was nice and the music was a good mix, making this a nuetral spot to meet if you've got friends from different groups meeting up.  I'm happy to see something of this caliber open up in the neighborhood.

r4zP04nQU44ng1zPkH1JZA.review_text: Great drinks, great ambiance, great people and great bites. I would recommend you try the little pot of spicy cheese spread- soooooo good!!!!

txOz8PIJbMlEdl5CLnpsXA.review_text: This place always have the best mixed drinks, that and they're original... a MUST visit bar when you're near Market and Church...   What's keeping this from a 5 star rating? DEBIT CARDS! Hello Blackbird, welcome to 2012...

rOANy7qH-VAYMu_a_N6txA.review_text: Came into the bar tonight expecting pretty poor service as the bar is very crowded on a Friday night. Our bartender was Matt and he made us feel like we were the only ones in the joint- it seemed like every time we ran out of a drink he was there to give us a new one. Even Managed to have friendly conversation while juggling multiple customers. Great bartender, great bar. Will definitely be back.

hu_gRLYyrMSeSLJNRd3b-g.review_text: Blackbird wins the best imitation of a Hell's Kitchen (New York) bar award.  Very cool vibe, and if I were in my mid-20s to mid-30s, it would be perfect.  Didn't try the cocktails, but I did get very quick service from the bartender.  The place is loud, but it's definitely the place to come with a group of friends; snag one of the booths in the back, and drink and chill.  I'll go back during the afternoon to try some cocktails, and might update the review then.    And, if you're waiting for your lame friends, you can literally spend hours reviewing 20th century San Francisco history as attested to by the newspapers pasted to the wall in the back, including long-lost papers such as the Call-Bulletin (my grandpa's favorite).

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: delicious pimm's cup and nice eye candy!

wiCR6Kq2jS2YFoE4lyVoUg.review_text: blackbird is known for their awesome cocktail. and indeed their cocktail is awesome. the social situation in here though is confusing. blackbird is gay and straight. the one guy across the room who was making eye contact with me for while looked very scared when i went to say hi to him. probably straight and being a bit secure about his sexuality.   i went on a weekday once and you could see a gay couple making out at the corner and straight couple getting on it on the pool table. what a scene.  i prefer dropping by on a weekday after a long dinner with friends. they get a little crazy crowded on weekends.

C846EVeECXBwSOhamD5PZg.review_text: fancy dranks are mad good & eye candy behind the bar.

e4yQMYATVfgk6ku0xPQg3A.review_text: Good ambiance, fast service and drinks made the right way. I recommend trying the margaritas they are definetly good.

EfudgndXtFWJc4Qor_4Q2g.review_text: A fun bar. You've got a little bit of everybody inside. Good vibe. The music isn't blaring, so you can actually have a conversation. Bonus star for carrying hangar one vodka. I'll definitely frequent this bar if only it stays this way. You never know . The Badlands "overflow" might make its way over. Sorry for the cheap shot...to each his own.

W82cYXhC2_Rm1IFpGGW8Pg.review_text: Love, love, Looove.  Happy hour is awesome, $3 well drinks and a few bucks off of beers. It's such a great place to meet people, no matter where you live it's always easy to get to church.  Only suggestion is for them to get the credit cards going - but they're on it...

41Z70MtOy9ZyhVtnLemJ_w.review_text: Pretty sweet atmosphere.  A little bit on the pricier side -but hell. I'm a broke student. Tried the bullfighter and the showdown (? I think)... they were pretty darn good. Especially that last one. The decor's pretty sweet. Except... the low tables are crappy. They've got ridges on the surface, which is pretty quite uneven. It's dumb when NOT trying to spill drink. One would've thought they'd fix it... I wanna go back. I recommend it. Chill spot.

z07uft0ylYVBOQkZ7B161Q.review_text: If you like well made drinks, this is a great place. If you like to drink ...... not so much. Delicious drinks, but difficult to get.

jUmnspdMwA8d-8pMeacaMA.review_text: Thank god for this place. Clearly, the owners of this joint get the picture that the Church and Market junction is the place for loung-ish kinds of venues. No, new BOC, we don't want to come into your shiny interior to get put in a trance by your flashy disco lights.   And to the person who wants it to be more gay, I love that I can take my straight friends here without having to hear them whine about going to the Castro once again. Blackbird is simply a place where everyone can go to have fun. I even took my mom there.   Good job Blackbird. Only suggestion: get a cover for that pool table, stat!

Ziz1dBhYulEfv98sPj9NIw.review_text: A true Castro staple, even if it's a bit off the beaten path!  Probably one of the most upscale, swank places in the Castro for sure, with creative mixed drinks that are priced pretty well. My two favorites are their Mint Julep, and their Rosemary's Fix (which I continuously miss-name Rosemary's Baby when I explain to friends and at the bar). Both drinks could be gone as their drink menu seems to change a bit over the year.   They have a good pooltable in the back with booths where you can relax with groups of friends. The clientele is mid-20s up to 40s, mostly well-dressed. It's not only men, and I would say this place (on non-weekend nights) has a pretty good mixed crowd.  It's easily my go to place if I'm looking for a Castro bar without all of the hooplah of a rowdy night.

jzZKHF40NjEXmrSznEAasw.review_text: I had a very bad experience. I ordered a drink and when I paid I got the wrong change back. I know I am 100% sure because I only had $20 bills. I asked the waitress to give me the rest of the change back and she denied. After a couple of sentences she told me that she would give me half of the change from her tips and she left without even looking at me. We finished the drink with my friends and when we left she "ironically" said a "have a good night, guys", that was intended to make fun of the situation.  I know I was right and she only agreed to pay me half of what I know she owned me.  Talking to my friends, they've also told me they've had bad experiences. I thought I needed to share. I will not go there anymore.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: In my book there used to be no such thing as a stumbling block to Lucky 13, the unanimous choice for my roommates and I to get hammered.  But then this place transformed from creepy poophole to kind of awesome bar but don't get me wrong, I'm not completely won over.  I'm not super huge on the crowd.  It was a bit too dressed up and showy for my tastes.  Additionally it seemed like everyone was having a birthday party here but this was an easy thing to get past.  The best part about this place easily is their diverse selection of beer and the great bartenders.  Shaun (probably misspelling your name) is an asset to this venue in terms of his knowledge of beer and ability to recommend something good.  I had Mama's Little Pils on draft and was very pleased with the choice.  Add this to selection of ambers and interesting domestics they have on draft on this place soon becomes a decent spot to come have some beer.  The space is good, it's roomy and there's a pool table that wasn't too tough to get in line for.  The wall paper scheme they have going is kind of awesome too.  Don't misunderstand, you're still my love Lucky 13, but this place isn't bad.

VjrVPH4Gls_cQKurMJx5-w.review_text: Thoughtfully complex drinks, handsome crowd.  Great place to de-stress after work, and hang-out before dinner, but don't come here alone.

wuxh89ylAoLIWL0RdmbIhg.review_text: I suppose that I have been reaping the benefits of this steadily improving bar for a sufficient length of time that a review is due (my first since moving back to SF!)  Four stars, and I mean it. This bar is a much needed breath of swanky air in the Castro. Between the hip and low-key decor and the (much improved since opening) drink menu, come here for a casual night with friends during the week or for a place to see and be seen on a weekend night.  The bad:   It gets crowded, really crowded, on weekend nights. So crowded, in fact, that I've turned around (with much difficulty) and walked back out the door. I suppose there isn't much that can (or should) be done about this, but there it is.   The good: Where to begin?   The bartenders are all generally nice and personable and quite good at making the drinks currently on Blackbird's menu du jour (try everything on the menu once). Since their opening, when a number of the specialty drinks were downright terrible, they have greatly improved the selection; everything has been worth trying recently, in my experience. My current favorite: the Leather Bound Book (seriously, keep this one around. I'm begging you!). The drinks take a bit of time and effort to make, but they are absolutely worth it and the bartenders are no slouches. The specialty drinks will run you from 8-10 bucks, the beer from 4-6.   The atmosphere is relaxed but classy, something the Castro is lacking. Why is it that the gays can't have nice things? Blackbird either doesn't know or doesn't care, because it certainly delivers regardless (to be clear, this is *not* a "gay bar". It just happens to be in the Castro and has a rather mixed-orientation clientele. All are welcome!).  The pool table in the back provides endless entertainment, whether you're playing or watching the tipsy patrons attempt to play.  The owner (manager?) seems to be around the bar most nights (at least the ones I've been there). I haven't had opportunity or reason to speak with him (which is a good thing, right?), but that he's there is comforting and probably goes a long way in maintaining their good standard of service.  Improvements:   Consider keeping the ingredients used in the specialty drinks around post-menu-change. It's really disappointing to find an amazing drink and then have it disappear in a month or so. It may be impractical, but I would think of it as a value-adding treat and thank-you to your repeat customers.   More seating. I don't know how, but I figured I'd throw it in here for posterity.

BG9EcvTb1xrsNNwW9_TV-Q.review_text: Great bar to lounge and hang out with friends.  Drinks are goood.  There's a pool table to get your competitiveness on.  The crowd is always cool.  LOVE!

INi56PgdBBxz0i_V_-_cGg.review_text: Blackbird is the new darling bar of the Castro (even though it has been opened for awhile). They have a very loyal following. The atmosphere is nice and casual; the bar gets super packed on Friday and Saturday nights. Their gourmet cocktails are fantastic even though it sometimes slow down the bar because they take quite a few steps to make. The bartenders are generally friendly and quite efficient. I wouldn't recommend taking a date to the Castro but if you do, I think Blackbird would be your safest bet. Two downsides: the bathrooms need to be expanded and often boasts long lines and the bar needs to start taking credit cards. If Trigger can do it, Blackbird can step up and provide the same service.  By the way, I rang in 2010 here with my friends, and we had a great time!  ~A

CgKb22edkZoIqbOrDFnwtQ.review_text: Great open layout and staff are instantly welcoming if you want to share a glass with a friend or gather a large group. The happy hour drink list is standard and I only wish there was food as well.

vDzJZHf1uF63LoG0DFZn2w.review_text: A great addition to the Castro Renaissance. I think one of the owners is a long time Castro bartender who I think took to reading the years of bitching on yelp from miserable gays like me and decided to do something about.  First of all the design is creative and inviting. The lighting is respectful like its shaded  but you can actually see people and enjoy looking at them.  But what's best is the bar, its so elegant and it contains really great alcohol and drinks. Finally a Castro bar focuses on the drink making and not just that.  They have a great selection of wines.  Wines are notoriously bad at gay bars in my accomplished experience.   However, here they are actually promoted and the selection is admirable and thoughtful written out charmingly on butcher block paper twice hanging in two different ends of the bar.  I now look forward to going to a bar in the Castro to just meet and talk with folks.  Blackbird makes that happen.

e-zrs_l9r17ulzAzByKemQ.review_text: Blackbird has some amazing cocktails.  My favorite is the strawberry cooler.  Strawberries and balsamic...  how can you go wrong?  Blackbird is the spot for good looking guys on a Saturday night.

_1zoBu8_XQ3P_BBChK3gFg.review_text: Blackbird is the sort of bar that every city should have.  Clean, cool-enough looking inside with well thought out cocktails, good beers, and a selection of wine that is better than you'd ordinarily find in a bar.  But don't get the $10 barrel aged cocktails.  There's a reason nobody else makes them.  They tend to be gin and vermouth-based cocktails that spend 6 weeks in a bourbon barrel.  The result is a mess: gin that tastes a little like oak with stale vermouth.

cz76cbJvk-ZLVTofNff0XA.review_text: Gays, strays and stiff drinks. A place to mingle, mix and enjoy some  COCKtails. I had the Earl Grey Black Currant Vodka infused concoction and I may have been a wee bit to big for my britches ordering it. While good, is was intense in flavor and very stong, very Earl Grey-y. I love Earl Grey in tea form w/ some milk and sugar, but once the flavor is intensified and added to alcohol, woo-wee, hang on tight my dears. Oh, and cash only, my drink was $10 so thank goodness I had an extra $1 for tip in my pocket or I may have had to drink quickly and skeddale (for fear of being slighted by the bar staff, you know what I mean).

6Rz0FpkDt0bfAKGr1FFLvA.review_text: I have been to Blackbird a couple of times now, both on a weeknight when it wasn't very crowded and on a Friday night when it was pretty packed, and I have been very happy with my experience on both occasions. I would consider this place a nice blend between divey and classy. The drinks are great: they have the menu of specialty cocktails on a big board on the side, which is amazing considering I am almost never able to find the menu at the bar when I go to most divey places.  They aren't necessarily the cheapest, but I expected just as such from a place like this one. This is also a place that you can go not just with friends but also with a significant other for a cocktail or two. There are plenty of tables where you can sit down and have a nice conversation while still being able to hear one another. Granted it's harder on the busier nights such as on the weekend, but it's still possible. There is also a pool table in the back, which is a nice touch. Overall, a nice place to grab drinks in the Duboce area!

Ng0xtiaMVpRrX_Vdmsay5Q.review_text: Friendly bartenders? Check. Delicious drinks? Check. Good crowd? Check. Same paint color that I want to use in my imaginary second bathroom? Check.  The only downside is that after 7 p.m., it got to be too loud to hear myself think.  But I'm not going to lie, "hearing myself think" often consists of a lot of awkward silences, so it's not that huge of a loss.

ptTgoOEHQ6MlDXn4JYr6pQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite bars in the city. It has that mix of great laid back ambiance, inventive drinks, and a mixed crowd that you strive to find everywhere in sf.   drinks: The have a scroll up on the wall with all their available drinks - most of them invented cocktails. I've tried silk road (decent) , batida (interesting use of coconut milk, tasty, definitely didn't taste the alcohol), and root of all evil (its scotch, so.. yeah. possibly a little weak though). I also tried their blueberry infused vodka which I'm pretty sure they make in-house - yummy with some soda water. They have these little jars with their oak-aged alcohol which they use in some of their cocktails - i want to try next time!  The bartenders are really knowledgeable and friendly - they can make almost anything you want. Also, during happy hour (5-8PM weekdays), they have cheap well drinks!   other: It can get pretty crowded in there, but it's definitely got a friendly vibe. Because its located at church and market it really has that mixed crowd of people venturing away form downtown and also those coming down from castro. Theres several tables against the wall and some tables towards the back. I always think this is a great place to start your night off of drinking because you can either head to the castro or the mission to continue.   writing this review made me want to go there tonight!

GSypxq4q6fAW84xcGlRBWg.review_text: Blackbird is a awesome spot to grab a few drinks and mingle with the buddies.  They have plenty of beers I've never even heard of to try out and they can whip out a mean bloody mary.  I can't wait to go back.

6xH5ZQ80KWAJk81lLRI3HA.review_text: Great neighborhood bar with a variety of beers to select from on tap. Unsure of which one to have? Just ask the bar tender to taste them and you can choose the one to your liking. The setting is very friendly to promote conversation. The pictures alternate. The drinks are priced about right. If you are looking for a great place just to come hang out with friends and have a great conversation with people, this is a great place to come check out.

93Fs7ryPk8maqNhaYE2iag.review_text: This place is great! My fiancé and I were exploring this area of SF last night for the first time and lucky came upon Blackbird. The cocktails were delicious and the ambience/ great vibes were exactly what we were looking for last night!

wu1lVgB7ZVV17MNv5SDrsA.review_text: I remember this place when it used to be the Expansion Bar, which later became the Metro Bar.  Back then, it was basically a dive bar.    Last night, while walking out of Home Restaurant, I noticed it had reopened.  It's definitely not a dive anymore.  It's decor is probably best described as modern take on a juke joint.  The rope light bulbs along the bar, the old newspaper covering the backroom, to the cool use of wooden planks as ceiling fixer with hidden speakers and recessed lights all work really well together.  There's even a bar style door at the entrance. The only slight problem I see is the bench along the far side of the bar as you first walk it.  It doesn't seem practical.  I saw a lot of people having to hold their drinks while sitting there.  This place looks like it has a lot of potential.  And the music, and crowd makes this place a really hip and awesome addition to the Castro.  A great place to go and hang out.  Finally, a lounge where the music compliments the conversation instead of drowning it.

sPqHcRC--tRanPC-g4pNwQ.review_text: This place is FUN. No, it's not the alcohol speaking. Go there for yourself, you'll know what I'm talking 'bout. Blackbird has the perfect lounge setup: a long venue with dim lighting and plenty of tables, chairs, and sofas along the wall. It's crowded but nowhere near suffocating, and if you migrate to the back, you can actually hold a decent conversation without making yourself hoarse. In the back is a pool table for those who like to pass the time hitting balls with sticks, as well as a photobooth ($5) for those who want to take selfies but don't want to be publicly judged for it. The only downside is that it's CASH ONLY. At the bar, you'll find paper menus that contain most of their drink options. However, for the real deal, they have a full menu on the wall to the left side of the bar. (GET THE) $9 NEW ORLEANS COFFEE, offered on draught, which is made with bourbon, Joyride cold brew coffee, chicory tincture (yelp.com/biz_photos/blac…). Superbly smooth with woodiness from the chicory. (GET THE) $10 POACHED PEAR, served up, which is made with pear-infused gin with honey, lemon, and Lambrusco. It tastes like grape juice (thank the Lambrusco, a red grape wine) or a dessert wine, though I would prefer it over a moscato any day ahaha. Menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/blac… and yelp.com/biz_photos/blac… and yelp.com/biz_photos/blac… Blackbird also runs a happy hour, Monday to Friday 5-8 PM. $1-2 off draught beers, $2 Bud/Bud Light/PBR, $5 house White, $6 house Red, $4 well drinks (1 liquor + 1 mixer), and $5 sours. See? Fun! :)

xl7VUg_rOEG0EdtOD_F4Jw.review_text: I had the "my lucky penny" and "grape drink."  Both were killer cocktails!  The ingredients were made fresh at the bar! The mixologist actually crushed the grapes to make grape juice.  I would've gave this place 4 stars for the drinks alone, but the bearded bartender/mixologist complained profoundly about a guy leaving a $1 tip and said he doesn't make vodka tonics. I totally agree with him on that aspect. If you order 3 drinks, and the guy is busting his balls, $1 tip is not right. I just didn't like the awkward moment when he was bitching to us at the bar.  Seemed a little unprofessional.   I would come back for the drinks if I ever ended up again in the area.  Also, if you are not used to gay guys making out, be prepared to see it left and right.

c65gXSyZlP0kCqttoTpHNw.review_text: I've been meaning to write a review about Blackbird for some time now.  Having been there many times (and having always had positive experiences), I opted to plan a birthday party there for several friends last month.  The owner was exceptionally friendly and helpful in planning it, blocked off a section of the bar for us (even though it was a busy Friday night), and even made the effort to come check with us during the event that everyone was happy.  I was very pleasantly surprised by how friendly and helpful he was.     Of course, what people most care about when they go to a bar like this is that the cocktails are well made, the ingredients are of a high quality, and that they are served without serious attitude.  Blackbird passes all these tests and more. Fantastic drinks, friendly bartenders, nice atmosphere, and just all an around nice, mixed crowd.  This has easily become one of my favorite places for cocktails this year.

3HbZDOG3InQCNqKD4hcsxw.review_text: Cash only?  Seriously?  I love how they charge $12 for a cocktail and then inconvenience their customers by not accepting credit cards.  Why would ANY "upscale" bar do that?   Oooohhhhh, that's right.... Blackbird would rather inconvenience their customers by making us use their tacky looking ATM in the back of the bar, where they earn money from each transaction. Good for Blackbird, bad for the customers.   Also, the service was slow, REAL slow, and the bartenders all have a crappy attitude, like they're doing me a favor just by showing up to work.

eIEE-h40qFVtc07030lqLg.review_text: Good spot to meet someone for a drink or beer.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: they did a really nice job redoing the old expansion bar, from the interior to the outside sign, but something just doesn't feel right.

efIJCmF7G2BoSEosqQiP8w.review_text: This was my first time at Blackbird. It's a pretty bar with pool tables in the back. The bar tenders are friendly and accommodating.

S3gNrUh7N9oWoackKlHGMQ.review_text: And the winner for Extreme Makeover: Bar Edition goes to ... Blackbird!   It's nice to see a new Castro bar open with an original design sensibility. I loved the newspaper wall, the gray-painted wooden panels and the neat, low tabletops. It looks nothing like its predecessors, the run-down Expansion or the blah Metro. Plus there was a great mix of folks and some slammin' tunes!

GpDvfCYGPceUTNHiFU3ycg.review_text: Amazing atmosphere! Patrons and bartenders are all super friendly. The drinks are great, and they make fabulous mocktails for us non-drinkers!

t4o8mWvFo5Q7vwT94h1zaw.review_text: Still my favorite bar in the area. Beginners should start with a Slurpee. It's not on the menu, but it tastes like a slurpee and comes with a special straw. Some of the specialty drinks are a little too fancy for my tastes, but I enjoy trying a new concoction every time.  Quality drinks. Chill crowd. Two thumbs up.

bWPDG7YLZEpFBN1qGEQ8MQ.review_text: Easily top 3 inventive cocktail bar in SF.  My go to spot for tasty beverages.  Menu refreshes a few times a year.    Expect it to be PACKED with typical castro crowd on fri and sat.

8JnaTAB1A79PibvgKt4x3A.review_text: I went for my first time with a friend and was VERY impressed.  I had a couple of very good draft beers that you don't normally run accross and the new remodel is awesome.  It was a bit quiet, but I think it was just the night, but it worked out nicely for talking.

ekTo4fDYVk8V5hvpSaPggA.review_text: dope.  really good affordable cocktails served by nice bartenders in a mixed crowd, makes the stretch of cafe du nord, blackbird, lucky 13 a fun night out without much effort

j3c8SGoR1GMrTwnryNEymg.review_text: It's really classy lookin. When I walked in If I didn't notice all the steamy hot gay men I would have mistaken it for a straight bar. It had some nice drinks and a pool table. I agree

AgYjvgJbsqXNr8tVe_Rm-g.review_text: Service=Wicked hot bartender chick  than had an excellent personality and great smile...   Atmoshere= The back half of the bar is wallpapered with old newspapers and colorful artwork.  The lowered false ceiling, red half circle booth seating and wooden stumps for cocktail tables really create a comfortable but stylish place to hang out and play pool or have cocktails.  The celing fans kept the place well ventilated.  I loved the lighting fixtures that hang above the bar. ...raw round hand blown balls that hang randomly from black wire.    Homo factor= 70% gay and 30% straight.... everyone seemed comfortable   Price= $ average  Parking= normal castro parking... if you can take the train you should... besides you shouldn't be drinking and driving :)  Bathrooms= very clean.

mGSw8IP5t1gtmgAYwaEqhg.review_text: Nice bar but relatively expensive, so come here for happy hour and get $2 beers! Cash only though (but they have an ATM in the back).  Cute place with newspapers lining the walls and decent bathroom (always important in any bar).  Tables are kind of awkward because they are the same height as the chair seats... someone forgot that most people have legs.  Overall nice place for conversation, great ambience!

l4TzToSp6vmuAtNuetqJQQ.review_text: Great cocktail fantastic selection of whikeys and bitters, hand crafted old school cocktails! yeah im a fan!

WuC2mL2H121LMnwo6p-dMQ.review_text: Blackbird has become the gold standard for happy hour drinks for me and the boi. In fact, we've taken to dropping in there early on Tuesday evenings for a seat at the bar and front row tickets to watching the bartenders shaking and stirring their hearts out. The boi takes full advantage of the $4 happy hour sours, and I have been slowly making my way through the bar menu and picking the brains of the very knowledgeable and approachable bartenders, who are always happy to concoct the cocktail of my dreams of the moment.  While it's much too crowded and loud for me later in the evenings and on weekend nights, it's downright cozy just as happy hour begins.   Added bonuses are a pool table and a photo booth.

W3R7POS83Wc0jkzUcJXijw.review_text: I love Blackbird.  Caveat: I have never been to Blackbird on a weekend so am only speaking from a weekday, my local neighborhood go-to, happy-hour perspective.  They have a great happy hour ( a great $4 Whisky Sour), service and ambiance is pleasant and laid-back, and you can always find a seat (or, I've never had any issues anyway, and I frequent blackbird about once per work-week).  The scene is comfortable - not overly hipster or pretentious (as many places can be in the Mission/Castro).  It's my neighborhood go-to for a drink after work.

DiAUiaoDKFlifJK0FCkEWg.review_text: I want to move to this neighborhood so I can make this my neighborhood bar.

SgMuZsZtBhBD1Hnp9AMk2Q.review_text: It is my favorite gay bar in San Francisco, hands down. Artisan cocktails, which change seasonally, are expertly poured and moderately priced between $8-10. I really appreciate the thoughtful beer-on-tap menu, which includes such favorites as Black Butte Porter and Moose Drool. The happy hour includes free pretzels, $2 beers on tap, and $4 whiskey sours. It does get crowded and noisy with 30-something professionals on Fridays, so if that bothers you I'd suggest coming on a different weeknight.  Bring cash and drink slowly.

-Sz_xRzyU-N31C2HykdB2A.review_text: This is one of my favorite hang out bars in San Francisco. This is a really classy place that makes incredible drinks although kinda expensive. Never been dissatisfied. I just love to go here, get a drinks, and chill with friends. The whole scene is fun.

s9crrwDOm8pWA4ayhu4dWQ.review_text: Great drinks and artwork!  Wood trim on ceiling is super cool and love the photo booth.  Will be back for sure.

rjE_SpqTmW-mrQOSAmGhdQ.review_text: Great drinks and great atmosphere - and great for people watching/flirting!  This place can get very crowded so arrive early, especially if you're going to have a group.  I've been on a random Wednesday night and it was standing room only.

ectROjAH3zV2xUF1f-bJuw.review_text: I really like this bar. I came in on Friday with a large group of friends and immediately felt comfortable. There is more than adequate seating, reasonably priced drinks, friendly patrons, and gracious bartenders. What more can a girl want, right? Well I guess everything else was a plus. Everything else being, awesome set up, warm inclusive environment (a nicer, more stylish neighborhood bar without much too cool for schooling), great music, my favorite location, a photobooth...there's more, really, you should check it out though for yourself. Most importantly Blackbird just puts you in a great mood. It seemed like everyone there, myself included, just happened to be wearing smiles and this (all of this) is why jumping on the muni after work, heading to Market and Church to get back to Blackbird so I can meet up with a friend for happy hour tonight...this and their 'grape drink'...mmmmm!  PS. At the beginning of this post I said I liked this bar but I confess I was playing coy. Truth is, although things could always change in the future, at this moment I truly feel "Yay! I'm a fan."

C46nrVQQxjVq_up_BJj-UQ.review_text: Great food and drinks! Their Truffle Gnocchi is awesome. I have never been disappointed by a meal here and desert is always a wonderful surprise.

SOZnTwFFFKeSzIrL8Vl-6Q.review_text: Great bar! While the drinks aren't inexpensive, they're creative and worth the splurge if you don't come during happy hour. The bartenders are genuinely friendly and have recommendations for you if you don't know which drink to choose. The place feels cool and funky but also like I'm at home. Like any bar, it's never going to be completely noise free, but it's quiet enough that you can hold an actual conversation.  Sophisticated enough to be cool, laid back enough to come as you are. Blackbird, I love you just the way you are.

FjFQ6jzClDzqMoGKBG9Png.review_text: best drinks ever!  at first when i saw the bartenders preparing the drinks (which at times can be painstakingly slow) i rolled my eyes thinking how pretentious this place must be. But after my first drink, named Leather Bound Book, i must say i was a mega douche for thinking that the slow work of the bartenders was due to anything but sheer brilliance!  ok, i might be overly excited right now for some reason, but i really like all of their drinks. It gets pretty busy at night, so you might be standing around a lot so get there early to grab a seat at the bar, or booths that line the back walls.

Q06xYs_C2X5fuh0AOV-I2A.review_text: It's ok, and some of the beers are very nice.  It was just so loud that it was hard to hear what anyone said.  It's much better if you can get a seat.

V_Y2e30CvavAaA_Y63vhUw.review_text: Nice ambiance, good drinks. Had a good time here.

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: Great happy hour specials ($4 vodka sours! if you don't like whiskey...), delicious drinks, plenty of seating, AWESOME decor... I'm a fan. Cash only, yo.

Wt5OkrAgUU-8YidJj55prA.review_text: This place has a nice lounge/pub feel to it with trendy decor. I went with some friends and ended up leaving after one drink. We just couldn't hear each other. We had to scream like we were in a dance club. We wanted something casual and social, but it just wasn't possible here.  They are also cash only which is usually a huge negative for me (much more willing to pay a reasonable fee to the establishment than a $4-8 fee to the banks).   So while the place isn't bad I don't think we'd ever go back.

nCYcZqc1S2q-8_NvL2Lrww.review_text: Was here for a friend's birthday recently.  Was initially concerned as there was one not incredibly fast person behind the bar.  However, as soon as the crowd was picking up, it seemed like three people magically appeared to help quench our thirst!  Great drinks, fun  mixed crowd.  Cool spot; the renovations did wonders and it is a well designed comfortable bar.  Love the exposed 'beams' that were installed - makes what would otherwise be a warehousey feeling spot very warm. Perfectly situated to grab a bite a Home after.

joctkHttJRwX1y7A3nZYCA.review_text: Disappointing. Nice space, not too noisy to carry a conversation. But the cocktails are less interesting than they sound (we had a Rosa Rita and a vodka-cuke-thyme thing) and they make them a bit weak. I may try it again but first visit was underwhelming.

pi0pohCXw9B6ui2TxIYlyA.review_text: Very knowledgeable bartenders, amazing space and vibe! Love the barrel aged cocktails, but "The Drifter" is one of my favorite cocktails in the city! Will be back again and again and again....

JaCoCBTOm7fz8s1-LRef9g.review_text: Strong drinks, a pool table, and historic newspapers on the wall so I can catch up on the history lessons I missed in high school.  Seriously, this is a nice location, and the drinks are not that expensive.  There are couches lined up against the wall, but you may have to be tenacious in grabbing one during peak hours.  The bartenders have attitude (as they should) and the signature drinks are unique.  Also, bathrooms are relatively clean (for those inquiring).

_pCm_UXreHoX170r-Hj9TQ.review_text: I can see why this place is a hit or miss.   It's all self-served and open seating, so your night here can be a good one or a bad one depending if you even find a place to sit and relax.   We got lucky and managed to get a table a few minutes after entering. It's absolutely beautiful inside.   They have a whole wall of drinks to choose from.  Given that I'm not an alcohol connoisseur, it was overwhelming and I was at lost at to what to drink.   It's all self-serve, so you have to order at the bar and bring the drinks back.  Our group just took turns.  The bloody mary had lots of veggies and was basically a meal in a cup!  Barley wine was interesting.  Lots of the other drinks my friends got were too.  Not your typical drink to say the least.  Just have an open mind when trying their drinks here.   I was worried that I wouldn't be able to get a group photo to commemorate the night but I lucked out again with spotting a waiter cleaning up a table next to us.

l5eydgFED9tDZIjyaubF1w.review_text: Very nice decor, this place has a really down to earth feel with an awesome feel, met great people, bar tenders sexy as well mix bomb drinks!

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: This place gets LOUD so be warned, but other than that this space is awesome.  The decor is simple and yet somehow provides some "chic-ness" to the drinkers and fashionistas surrounding.  The bartenders are trained well when it comes to making a proper drink and shaking that cocktail shaker well.  And I mean WELL.  But where have all the mustaches gone? ...you might ask  if they aren't in the Mission district located on the face of a young up-and-coming hipster they would be located on the patrons/bartenders of this trendy hot-spot.  Blackbird draws a good crowd of people and it seems as if everyone clusters here for some sort of birthday or going away celebration so you know it's near and dear to lot's of people's hearts.  The prices are reasonable and the music is good. Pull up a chair/booth seat if you can find one, and make sure to stop by the photo booth on your way out for a last minute memory-maker.  Bring cash!

1k6dVLySyEQP-YTNkja7qw.review_text: I am not a bar person. I don't like bars. i dont really like to drink, and even when i did, i need more stuff to do. Blackbird is a bar's bar. I went there for a couple minutes last Saturday. We were supposed to be going out dancing, which got downgraded to a random bar with music, and that got downgraded to this new bar in castro. I had no idea it existed. It is in the spot where metro used to be, after metro had moved out of the spot Lookout is in now. So, its pretty close to BOC. The door woman was nice. Inside, it's a bar. There was some very low music playing, something countryish or I don't even know... I couldn't hear it. Even though it was Saturday, there was not even a pretense of going for the music. There was a pool table or 2 I think. It's not pretentious or yucky looking, just middle. I don't know how the drinks were. If you like going to drink with friends, and just stand there and talk to your friends and drink, then just stand there and drink some more, go here. It seems very good for that.  I don't like that, so I wont. But if you do, you should. It's a very bar-ry bar.

8bxzT_IAk3n4i94ZdJ4VBQ.review_text: Hubby and I are not big bar people.  We seldom intentionally go out somewhere just to have a beverage.  Neither of us are big on loud spaces where it's impossible to converse.  Enter Blackbird.  Nice, clean, non-pretentious space with an outstanding liquor and cocktail menu and several staff knowledgable about their product to the core.  My cocktails were delicious and very fairly priced given the handmade to order, fresh ingredient manifesto they operate.   We don't cocktail often, but when we do this establishment will be top of the list.  Big props to the owner for envisioning this vibe.  They hit the groove.

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: Cool vibe and sexy decor. One pool table in the back. Plenty of small tables, not comfortable to stand around so definitely try to get a table. Sour beer yum land.

gDxvsE2SAEm3AzXTTtlEZw.review_text: Blackbird offers an interesting and ever-changing menu of really outstanding cocktails.  Spiritous cocktails are lovingly stirred, not shaken, while citrus-y drinks get the living daylights shaken out of them.  Also don't miss their barrel-aged cocktails.  I've only ever been in the late afternoon, early evening, when the bar is satisfyingly chill and uncrowded.  A big plus: no TVs, which is depressingly uncommon even in cocktail-oriented bars.

HGvuddOZtxxOK5lceB8ZmQ.review_text: I give this three stars because my experiences differ depending on when I go.  Sunday and happy hour Monday through Wednesday get five stars. The crowd is thin enough that you can have actual conversations without yelling. Also, the bartenders are knowledgeable and you can learn *all* sorts of things from them.  Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights are to be avoided. It gets crowded with annoying hipsters, and people staring at their iphones. At those times, the bartenders are overworked and (understandably) not as friendly.

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: Two gorgeous gay boys said I was beautiful while I was having drinks during happy hour on Friday.  Five stars.

Wcapar2TDw-Ai99X0ze-tQ.review_text: BLACKBIRD, BLACKBIRD? How have I only discovered you recently? Listen here, Blackbird is definitely one of the new crown jewels of the CASTRO. The place while small is great and stylishly done compared to other bars around the area. Theres plenty of seating, but not enough for the amount of people that come to the place for their awesome drinks. Photobooth in the back was a great addition, the pool table was a nice touch and there weren't any unsually long waits in the bathroom. Had a very good time sipping some cocktails with my babe here and am definitely looking forward to the next time we return.  Overall, hip and stylish people, friendly bartenders and great ambiance! Liked it so much I might have part of my birthday!

ng3R46T-28L7of9w4Szgrw.review_text: LOVED this place!  The bartenders were wonderful and the cocktails were so creative and enticing.  I can't remember the name of the cocktail I got but it was the one with tequila and bell pepper, it was amazing!  But the thing that will have me driving two hours to come back?  Their infused vodka.  It was amazing!  My husband got the grapefruit and I got the orange on the rocks.  Literally, to die for!  When the bartender pulled the vodka out you could see how it was crammed full of orange rind and grapefruit rind.  I'm not a regular drinker at all, but if I had this at my disposal on a regular basis...I'd have to start going to AA.

8kRkFR0vYD1E0oMm8DsfGg.review_text: If you're looking for a place with a relaxed atmosphere and a mixed crowd to just hang out and enjoy a cocktail or two with friends, this is the place. Blackbird has become somewhat of my "go to" hangout. The staff is friendly and the crowd is great...a nice mix of professionals--gay and lesbian friendly without being a pick-up joint. Whenever I go there, I seriously feel like it's one of the coolest places in the city. Definitely worth checking out.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Blackbird has a sign that just says "Bar". This can be confusing to someone who is familiar with the Bar on Church and tries to give directions to said "Bar". Especially if this person is not on Facebook. This is why;  The Blackbird was the Metro before the Metro became the Lookout and Expansion became Metro which should NEVER be confused with Bar on Church which was The Transfer until Bar on Castro became Bar on Church and Q took over Bar on Castro.   Oh, Blackbird aka "Bar" makes some fancy cocktails that taste good. They also have a nice mixed crowd, a pool table and a great happy hour. Hopefully you can find the place to experience this.

9q5VjLdlp0Z2u7yGKdEJKQ.review_text: Blackbird is the perfect little bar in the Castro. I love the My Clementine cocktail, leather bound book, and the bitter end. All of their cocktails are great. It's a great meet up spot with friends since it's right in the center of the city and near lots of public transportation. It feels safe because you're in the Castro. Acoustics are a little bit loud but there are lots of little tables and places to sit and get cozy with your pals. This is probably one of my fave bars. Good music, nice people, just cute all around.

XrzkP-EPpql8cis-GlQ57A.review_text: Love this place. The handcrafted cocktails show thoughtfulness in their recipes and are well prepared by an excellently trained bar staff. The diversity of the patrons is a hopeful glimpse of what the future will be like everywhere in the world: gay, straight, every ethnicity represented and people getting along. This place makes me proud to be a San Franciscan.

_xpivv6pnLim13KiaHBKqg.review_text: Drinks were great!  I had: Rember The Maine -Solid rye drink with an absinthe rinse, reminds me of many of the drinks at The Alembic.  Root of All Evil -Highly Cinnamon-y drink over ice.  Flavor was like a root beer with a gingerbread man crushed up in it.  I could have done with a little less cinnamon & sweetness.  The Birds & The Bees -Sweet, but not too sweet, honey & rum martini, served with an orchid bloom.  This was the best drink I had.  El Guapo -I wasn't impressed with this drink, but I'm not a huge fan of Mezcal.  I'm guessing I only ordered it because I was loosened up from the first 3 (strong) drinks.  Crowd seemed about 70/30 gay/straight on a late Saturday afternoon, and the place was very roomy & clean  (the exact opposite of Toronado where we were earlier).  Staff was friendly, but on the slow side, so this is why I'm only giving it 4 stars.

Gp4rXRK-p4nWQL1U_slr_Q.review_text: What a pleasant surprise. A flip done well in the 'Stro's lowerside. Was able to check out the place last night for its opening. I must say it looks like Blackbird will become my new go-to watering hole. Many fine and favorite beers on tap. Was able to play some pool on their spanking new table- amazing, forgot what it's like to play with cues that aren't sticky! What a concept...of course over time this will change, so play while their slick and still have their tips. The atmosphere is pleasant and I'll definitely have to check out their specialty cocktails when I go back.

LLgSUEiB0QGwqEJ0oe2keQ.review_text: I really like this place. It's kinda small, but I went on a Wednesday night so didn't have any trouble getting seats. It's a really good looking bar, too. If this bar was a person it would be a crazy attractive male model. Unfortunately not being a male model myself, I had to wait until a couple of cute gay boys were served by both of the bartenders before me (yep two bartenders serving one set of customers). But hey, can't blame them for trying. Anyway when I got served shortly after that the drinks were amazing and the bartender was so fast I literally looked down, saw my drinks and change and wondered whether he had superpowers. Good bar.

K-PtK3gDicUeLXYoJmDKWw.review_text: Great bar with lots of seating, a modern vibe and tasty ass cocktails. I wanted to try everything on the menu.

v1MFfe1n6wd_m9YBWUIQLw.review_text: I love a skilled bartender.  Like seriously.  I wish there were a filter on Yelp for how skilled the bartenders are.  Then I would have found this place sooner.  They also have a reasonably large and varied specialty cocktail list with some weird stuff on there, which I love.  It lost a star simply because the last time I went everything was kind of a miss, but I think it was just somebody's off day.    It'd be nice if they had snacks.  That is all.

uH7Hcg39dXqzhyg6QurKYg.review_text: The mixologists here are good! They have unique craft cocktails with ingredients such as rosemary and basil. Really delicious drinks!  They also serve beer and wine and have a pool table in the back.    Fun place!

CfQIoIaW2X4ScswNHn3RXw.review_text: Probably my favorite bar in SF. Great bloody mary's and original cocktails. Not too crowded during the happy hour and very nice atmosphere. There even is a pool table and a photo booth in the back.  The happy hour has $3 well drinks and a great choice of beers on tap that are pretty cheap.  Cash only (but there is an ATM in the back).

X_8zyKQOInUjnUYjNLFWuQ.review_text: Really excellent cocktails. The space is large enough to accommodate groups but still intimate. Will definitely be back.

RbaIxpAbwl6JrIPgIX4XIw.review_text: I've got mixed feelings about this bar:  -the mixed drinks are good, but expensive and small -the bar is cash only -the crowd is mostly gay and/or hipster-ish -the interior and lighting is right, but seats are taken quickly.  not bad & not great, but convenient if you're in the hood.

6-AA014-IT2FJjcEqJBZYg.review_text: 29-July, Sunday: I was here yesterday for a friend-of-a-friend's farewell party, I enjoyed a Negroni Classico extra dry with Plymouth Gin, a few bitters, and a splash of Campari.. gently stirred, served straight-up in a martini glass, and garnished with a lemon-peel twist.  Heaven on my tongue!  This space can be packed to the brim sometimes, so I definitely enjoyed coming here earlier for a quick drink.. I also appreciate that is no booming music, oh and it's cash only.. but there is a Chase right around the corner and a Wellsfargo ATM close by.

Mcy_SkMnb8HXo7JRVcl02A.review_text: Great cocktails and a nice atmosphere.  They have a later than average happy hour too.

0ktqwLpietVcOVGpAvCPvg.review_text: Finally made it down here last Friday night.  The place was packed, but the layout is well thought out, so it didn't actually feel all that cramped.  The bartenders work fast, so despite the crowd we never waited long for our drinks.    They had real solid cocktail menu.  Huge fan of the Rusty Rob and the Leather Bound Book.  They also had a great greyhound, and a nice selection of beers on tap.  The drinks are also very reasonably priced!

RCmp-pCAkdAiAcMa2BXwDg.review_text: What a gorgeous bar! Good wines and nice atmosphere.  I went here for a friend's art opening so I'm not sure if it's usually that busy.

74Am8W44at2GybFyYcLJAw.review_text: I like Blackbird for all kinds of reasons: It's queer - like, really, super queer. That's awesome. The set-up inside has all kinds of seating and standing options. They have a pool table (I don't watch the hot dapper people of San Francisco take shots, I have no idea what you're talking about). Awesome riding distance from my house.   It's also sometimes difficult being at Blackbird: The awesomeness makes it sometimes very crowded - like, elbow nudging crowded. Their cocktails can be really sweet and a bit pricy. I like serious, old school style where I can taste what's in the drink. They have a touch of that style, too. San Francisco bars are typically really good at this (yet another reason I heart this city hardcore). The crowded makes for hard hearing when socializing. The pool table's nice to look at, but good luck ever getting to it, because, ya know, there's one.   Weekday neighborhood bar?! YES! Thursday-Sunday or sometimes just later at night? OOF. Roll in with a crew or roll in early. And then, let's drink something tasty!

g4iesuIiaK27bkR2LqbMig.review_text: This place has a much different feel than any other bars in the Castro (they don't blast GaGa, it isn't crowded with daddies, etc.) I'm not usually one who enjoys hanging out in a lounge, but I did enjoy meeting my friends here for a drink. I would say it's a great place to start the night if you have friends in town, because there isn't anywhere else in Castro that you can have a conversation without having to talk over loud music.

__05rytNjsye9MBhqB0DMA.review_text: I like this place. Crowded and different type of crowd here. More mature than the usual Castro crowd.  I would say that it is a beer and cocktails bar than wine bar. All the red wines I had here were not that great.   So the next time, I will just stick to beer, as the tap is a plentiful. My friend said that the cocktails were good, but small. So either they were really good that he drank them well or just in small glasses.

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: This place is cute inside and very hip. However, I hate crowds so take my review with that into account, I didn't like how packed this place was. It was almost as worse as Q-bar. I hate establishments that ignore fire code. haha.  Anyway, the drinks are good and the guys who come here are particularly hot. So, I might come back for the eye candy.  (c;

jVYzrVblDFSuL3GHtt8ZSA.review_text: For me, one of my most favourite things to do is to walk up to a bartender and say, "I like gin and citrus." When their eyes sparkle and they start to muddle, I know I'm going to have myself a fantastic cocktail experience. Okay, so maybe I knew that just based on their cocktail program, the bitters on the bar and the "mists" of scotch just waiting to adorn a tall glass.    The space is dark, long and narrow with enough background noise to feel like a bar, but not so much that you have to guess what someone next to you is talking about. And if you station yourself near the door, you're bound to meet a new friend or two as they leave their drinks to step outside for smokes.   In case you're wondering what my drink creation was... it was "The Last Word" and it was deliciously balanced. End stop.   6/30: 30 Day Challenge

zst5ol5eBsx-Uz6wfKDzAA.review_text: I love this bar. Great spot to pop in and have a few drinks in peace. People don't bother you, you can play pool, and if you're lucky, the photo booth is working and you'll have a few pics to remember the night by. Since the drinks are so good, you'll probably need a reminder.

BTzogObU2RFLCU56i8qdlQ.review_text: I have been to Blackbird a number of times and really liked the vibe and the drinks.  Now I love my gays, but it's nice to go to a place right outside of the Castro to be around some (mostly) straights too!  I was most impressed with the hot toddy I recently had...so impressed in fact that I can honestly say it has not been beat in my experience.  Not only was there the right amount of hot water and booze, but they added a whole cinnamon stick, cloves and star anise- beautiful!!  I can't give this place 5 stars yet, but I promise to keep coming back so that I can do so :)

xNwJsMMMQpwRh6vWrucHEQ.review_text: Best cocktail bar in the Castro, not super cheap but worth it (also love the $5 fosters)

M1cSi5GH8VYR_hMbgyPsVw.review_text: Love it. This place is just what the neighborhood ordered. Good beers on tap, good cocktails, and great atmosphere. Only downside - this place is cash only, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. C'mon, it's 2009 and you don't take credit cards?

_cGinomj5qgh04LRjWz53Q.review_text: Excellent music! Very artsy atmosphere! Fun place to play a round of pool and have some shots!

NRrNQ5xHn_7Fu4ctlpKLbQ.review_text: I came here with Mointhe415 on a Sunday evening for a quick beer. We were going to meet at Lucky13 but this place looked very inviting. I asked for an Anchor and she had the Bloody Mary.  This is a great bar with a wonderful vibe. The bartender was a really nice guy and made us feel very welcome. I know that next time I'm in this part of town I'll be back. I do feel that I was over dressed though and will keep that in mind next time I'm thinking of dropping in but I'm not going to make this a destination location. I did by default order an Anchor and was saddened to see a bottle in front of me a second later. I have to deduct a star for any bar that doesn't have anchor on tap, I mean really. The Chipotle Bloody Mary was freaking incredible. I'll be back for the Bloody.  An extra star for the amazing bloody and minus one star for no anchor on tap.

e77JyltArqckcdBl13bVbA.review_text: beautiful room, nice crowd, situation on the border of the Castro and middle Market.  nice lineup of cocktails but sadly a very uninteresting beer selection.  unfortunately, i love beer.  if you're cocktail-oriented, put this place on your list.  if you love beer ... it may not be for you.

51Yfy5Xv27dHi74E3XJ-oQ.review_text: So glad I got to visit here at least once on my trip back to SF. The night was a particularly busy one, but nonetheless, the service was still great, drinks were delicious (Dickens!). This place still served as a great classy spot to hit up before we went and got Kla$$y at the club.  I love that they always have new specialty drinks at the bar. The ingredients can be a bit overwhelming and hard to read in the dim lighting, but you're almost always guaranteed to have something unique and very delicious. Friendly bartenders who are as eccentric as the drinks they make.   Overall, another great night at Blackbird.

Y7oDwFLLv6m6dxm2wu5txg.review_text: This is a fantastic little gem! Excellent staff, phenomenal cocktails, interesting and diverse crowd, pleasant atmosphere with the music at the exact right volume to carry on conversations, and just a few feet from Muni. My new favorite bar!

r86hWmVTTSM6If0gSUuBrw.review_text: We fell in LOVE with Blackbird last night. Were gonna hit our neighborhood spots Martuni's or Zeitgeist, but decided to walk a few blocks and finally check out Blackbird.  A female bartender made our drinks, and she was very eager to answer any questions about the many fascinating ingredients used in their signature cocktails. I had the Blackbird Cobbler (Tawny Port, Frangelico, OJ, Apple Butter, with an orange zest) which I proceeded to make love to. It was devilishly delicious and SO complex...the layers just kept going and going! Next I had the Bitter End, which was so beautiful we had to take a photo. The egg white froth was perfect - what a sexy looking drink. And the flavor - whoa...once again, great layers, refreshing on the front and slightly bitter and tannic on the end. So so pleasant. My companion had the Northern Star which was really well balanced and layered, and something else with overproof Bourbon that he described as a "man's drink" - quite liquor driven but delicious. Atmosphere was great, not too hipster-y, but filled with 20-30 somethings drinking micro brew beers and well-made cocktails. And there's a pool table in the back if you wanna do more than just drink.  Only cons were we wished the lights were lower - it could be even sexier than it already is, and one of the bartenders (maybe a barback?) was absolutely hammered drunk and being kind of obnoxious...really unprofessional. Luckily his female coworker made up for it. New menu comes out in April - can't wait to go back and try the new round!!

wq_Twp10CYCk_kfewrJtSA.review_text: Creative cocktails without all the pretense.

sbUNjP6yhulqKWOaxPIkcw.review_text: I originally wrote a rather scathing review.  In my defense, I did have a horrible experience my first visit.  Since then, I have been back on a number of occasions.  I have had a a rather good time each visit.  Cute crowd.  The thing I like most about this place are their mixologists.  They create drinks that I thought I liked and now love.  I had a Sidecar tonight.  I've had many (and I mean many) Sidecars previously and none have tasted quite as good/sweet/tasty as tonight's.  Thanks Blackbird for changing my point of view.  Cheers!

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: A wonderful gourmet bar. The drinks are like recipes and cost a little extra, BUT they also have a great affordable happy hour for normal drinks. The crowd is mixed and gets PACKED so go early unless you like crowds. It is the place to be right now, but not pretentious.  The only thing is it takes FOREVER to get a crink when they are packed because the special drinks take a long time to make and they always seem under staffed.  So go early and grab a seat by the window and treat yourself to a special drink; they all rotate and I suggest being adventurous.  Another great thing about this bar is that now the Pilsner is often empty if you feel like going there and sitting outside :)

URvZ0BkUDZABI6wgCAo5dA.review_text: Blackbird has the absolute best cocktail program in the city and only a select few are aware of it. This place nearly single-handedly turned me around on mezcal, whiskeys, and bourbons by putting them in innovative drinks that flatter these liquors I would not have otherwise appreciated. There's a photobooth, pool tables, excellent bartenders, barrel aged cocktails, and truly unique and innovative market-driven drinks.  The interior reminds me of the ghost levels from Super Nintendo's Mario's World, and it's cash only.

pf025iXiomfPKTDj1RhDNA.review_text: Blackbird is a great spot! Classy, fun, great drinks, wonderful people. I reserved the back booth areas for an engagement celebration and it was perfect. The staff were super friendly and helpful and the space was great. Everyone had a great time imbibing delicious cocktails and mingling with all of the friendly people. Thanks so much and we will definitely see you again!

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: Great cocktails, good neighborhood vibe, good looking crowd, and probably the best place ever... if you're a hot, gay professional dude in your mid-30s. Very friendly and very nice bar with a photobooth!

opzaBv9fKpyuvnB1LKwZKw.review_text: Dear Blackbird,  (in this order of experience):  Love Sarah M.  Love the $1 pool tables.  Love the happy hours. & drinks.  Love the people there.  Coming back soon, great times.  Xxo, From LA

Gzqmzxtc6t5IfrqXdMRR4g.review_text: This part of the city really needed a nice cocktail bar like Blackbird, which pulls off a quality bar without an ounce of pretension.  Blackbird has a relaxed but stylish interior, with a pleasant and skilled staff, and high quality liquor and beer.  What more do you need?  I was a fan of the Bull Fighter cocktail, which uses peppercorn and Cynar, the artichoke liqueur, to add some complexity to a drink that might be otherwise too sweet.   They could maybe use a couple more dry (and non-gin) drinks on the menu, but that is my only quibble.

Y8KfIHrsTcYkrnnWz787PA.review_text: Tried this place after seeing a Thrillist article about their Game of Thrones inspired drinks. Cool atmosphere and decent drinks, but some of the worst service I've had in a long time. After sitting at the bar ignored for 10 min, I had to shout repeatedly to a bar tender to order a drink. Way too many amazing bars in San Francisco; no reason to come here.

Dd6ElS2Cng3Qag_h4IQC-Q.review_text: Loved the modern saloon feel, the chill vibe, and the unique cocktail menu...all good!

4YgPGKtt06JuIYTQlTr58Q.review_text: Located on the outskirts of the Castro, this is a top notch bar. They are serious about cocktails, unlike the other more superficial bars in the area.   It has a lively atmosphere and doesn't get too crowded. The drink to order here is The Purple Cup, a refreshing concoction of creme de cacao and blackberry flavored paired with your choice of gin, vodka, or rum (I believe)...

4HHdkdlcErzWL8fw-glEjg.review_text: This is a great spot with a diverse crowd (for the Castro anyway). Nice cocktails. Generally very good bartenders. The seating is a bit weird because the table height is too low except in the initial entry area. Decent neighborhood bar overall and they always have changing art, which I love.

NDODNoud0WAT6212kg6SDw.review_text: I am only adding to the good reviews of this place but I like to give credit when deserved! We stumbled in here on a rainy evening after dinner and it was exactly what the doctor ordered...   - Creatively delicious mixed drinks, TONS of beer/wine/whiskey options  - Well laid out space - plenty of room for groups and minglers - tables, seats, bars, upright tables...   - Friendly and hepful service - even at a crowded bar full of customers, the bartender was more than willing to provide his advice for drinks  - Diverse crowd - being in the Castro, we assumed it might be dominated by gay men, but surprisingly this place had a wide swath of people!   All in all, this is now officially one of my fav bars in the area. Somewhat similar to Churchill but you could easily hit both in one night since they're close!

TEMM4rXJeNMi5WUAu9EdUg.review_text: Fantastic cocktails. Great decor & design. Comfortable space.

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: I'm PREEETY sure this used to be the scuzzy bar where I got my wallet stolen while watching the Tigers lose the World Series in 2006. Can't remember the name.  All the really pretty, inventive decor at Blackbird couldn't keep me from recognizing the overall layout... From being drawn to where I'd been sitting at the bar, with my rally cap on (stupid rally cap -- didn't work)...  But the makeover here is pretty remarkable, still. It was just THAT traumatic of an evening for me, back in 2006, that they couldn't pull a fast one over on me. I do have to say I'm impressed, though -- very cool place.   To look at. Not to drink in.   Crowded with obnoxious people, and my fancy cocktail was just so-so. And so, so expensive.   I COULD have ordered a PBR -- in a can, of course -- but why on earth would you do that, in a bar like this? That's just so retardedly hip, I can't condone it.   Come on, people. PBR in a can is for scuzzy bars where I run the risk of getting my wallet stolen. Or for my mom's house.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: Blackbird has another new menu up and it's their best one to date.  The Shakedown is really good, their applejack cask aged cocktail is also pretty awesome, but the standout here is (for a first, a tequila mix) the Bull Fighter. The jist of it is tequila, citrus, and a syrah reduction with black pepper. It's as good a drink as I've had just about anywhere.  Someone give them some kind of award.

ouQ6J_vkCEQRqQK6fIgUxA.review_text: I think a Mai Tai is a classic drink. Every bartender should know how to make one. If you can't make it, let me know. A Mai Tai does not come with a float of bitters and a salad of mint.

r89AjC0FYSepgMbvCQe0Kg.review_text: The remodel is amazing!  The place looks absolutely fantastic.  They are still working on their specialty cocktails, but I've had a blast there every time I've been since the place has re-opened.

B6Zy_vAB46nP_I_jNqdlng.review_text: This place is awesome. I came out with the boys for a few drinks last night, and don't have enough awesome things to say about Blackbird. Cute bartender, fun music, friendly atmosphere, and the drinks were to die for.   I'm a Manhattan connoisseur and last night I was served the best Manhattan I've ever had, hands-down. My friends tried many different specialty cocktails from the menu, each as tasty and interesting as the last. The thing about these cocktails is that they're not just good drinks - they're strong, they taste good, and they have texture to the flavor - it's not just two or three things thrown together in a glass, it's a tapestry of liquor and juice and YUM.   Highly recommend this place!

K4Jt5Chsx4GzZeHRrxHH0A.review_text: This bar has really good atmosphere. The cocktails are great too!

djah8rhitVV67FlhlUur5w.review_text: I was quite impressed by this bar after visiting it. First, although the place is loud (very "live" acoustics) you don't have to compete with music blasting, so it's a good sit down and talk bar as opposed to a dance club.  The interior is tasteful and modern, but the main reason I'm giving this place 5 stars is because the cocktail I was served ("bols and sand" I think it was called) was absolutely delicious and very reasonably priced at $8.

ucfCpo-qkQWE-pXp2873Uw.review_text: This place was HOT.  Hot, like.. I had to step outside cause I was sweating so much from the temperature inside! Hot, like.. hot guys everywhere.  Seriously well dressed and good looking crowd. Hot, like.. super crowded!  this place is popular!  I don't know if I am hot enough to come back here but if they let me in once, maybe they will again. :P

tlY0QMQDyfjQAEwHnzvFnw.review_text: A very cool bar that I definitely will be going back to.  The décor and vibe were great - a perfect spot for socializing.  Unlike most of the other places in the area, some thought actually went into the design and they did a great job.  I think I found a new favorite!

wI795B7EQTjkSL1eiYpMhw.review_text: My grandfather introduced me to Manhattans when I was just a wee granddaughter. When it was appropriate for me to drink my own (and not take a sip of his when my mother wasn't looking), we would sit together on his back porch, drink Manhattans, and shoot the bull.   He passed away earlier this month and, in memorium, I felt the need to drink a Manhattan. Based on location/time constraints, Yelp indicated that this would be the best Manhattan I could acquire on the night that I needed one the most. It was a good 'un. Not as good as Grampa's, but I think he would have approved with the care which the bartender took and the results that care yielded. Though he probably would not have been so crazy about all the noisy young people everywhere.

JWmCMPpvIoV--e-AMa-GDA.review_text: Great drink menu, friendly bartenders, cool layout, attractive crowd. Mostly gay but diverse enough to be welcoming to all.

9X3e0RRE3e_AkhGcd1eorA.review_text: Excellent bar! Finally something to fill the gap between utter dive (not that there's anything wrong with a dive) and the new trend of the cheesy LA-esque, velvet rope poser bars that are popping up everywhere.   Blackbird is incredible!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: I may not believe in true love or jesus, but I do believe in a stiff drink with the girls after a long and trying workday. When my patience has been tested and my faith in humanity is all but lost, a good glass of malbec or a Macallan 25 is a quick passageway to salvation.  No, I may not beleive in Santa Clause, but I am a firm beleiver in Grey Goose and Belvedere.  I also believe in bar hopping and public transit.   Enter Blackbird. Blackbird is smack in between Lucky 13 and The Residence, just down the block from Du Nord and The Mint, and a stone's throw from the muni underground, J Church, F train, and 22 Fillmore. Blackbird is also discreet, minimalistic, and well-appointed, with seating a-plenty and super friendly bar staff. Did I mention that above all else, I believe in hot men and happy hour specials? Well, that too. And there are plenty of both at Blackbird. The Speakeasy Tallulah Blonde is just $2 and the house wines are $5 during happy hour, 5-8 p.m. daily.   I also believe in day drinking. Blackbird opens at 12 on weekends and 3 on weekdays. I never have to be sober again. Score! My belief in hot men is strengthened when the hot men in question can't get me in trouble. Since the crowd is largely gay at Blackbird, I am safe AND I have eye candy. Double score! Blackbird is a true neighborhood bar, smack in the middle of Market Street. Down to earth, easy to swallow, and no attitude whatsoever. This is something I can get behind.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Blackbird is a classy, laid-back bar that is nice for socializing in small groups. The drink menu is impressive, with a wide variety of drinks and some hard-to-find beers. Some of the seating is a bit awkward and uncomfortable due to low and uneven heights, leaving a large portion of the bar undesirable, in my opinion. If you manage to snag a table near the front, however, it's definitely worth checking out.

BPpRsy-rk4IjJirmmqIz1g.review_text: Things I love: well made cocktails, sassy gay men.   Put generous helpings of both of those within stumbling distance of public transit, at reasonably not break-your-wallet prices, and you've made a fan of me!  Seriously though, what a great bar! There is nothing middling on the menu whatsoever -- only cool things. Cool beers, cool cocktails -- and a cool crowd to go with. Sure, it gets crowded -- but hey, that's why god gave us elbows. Another cocktail, please!

RQCv9rxE1fgb9enHyjKTRg.review_text: Yay for this quaint place for having Big Daddy IPA & a photobooth!

AOFDB60pjiXby08lx5HHYQ.review_text: The staff here are very friendly. I really like tequila drinks and a few of the workers  recommended the Sangre Dulce as a popular drink.. So my friend and I both ordered that. However, it just didn't quite fit ours pallet. I didn't want to be rude, but I had to ask the bartender to make another drink. He was very nice about it. So we switched it out to the hourglass. It was still bad, but not as bad as the first drink, but I didn't want to bother switching drinks again, since that would be too excessive.   I think I need to come back here again and try another drink. I feel like this place just doesn't make good tequila drinks, because everyone else liked their drinks. The ambiance here is good, plenty of tables and seats. Not too crowded either.

Ow_oHwqaBBRuUAiNrL8rRw.review_text: went after work on a Friday. There was plenty of room when we arrived. so took a seat to people watch. I usually stay away from mixed drinks, but I ordered a " Sunset Swizzle' vodak,grapefruit,pachaurd , mint on crushed ice in a nice tall glass.  It was yummy. The bar was nice and roomy and light, NOT a dark bar.  The client mostly white male gay. But who cares.  The bartenders where welcoming and nice ' Sean" was our bartender and cute! They let you bring in food from next door " Home" or at least we saw that they did... will go back good vibe , and good stiff drinks I was tipsy after two " Sunset Swizzles"......... Nice to have a new place to go after work............

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: I want to make this place my new watering hole. Wait, that sounds weird. I like this place. A lot. I was sold the second I saw Brother Thelonious on tap (yelp.com/biz_photos/blac…), but the Batida cocktail (Cachaca [sort of a Brazilian rum], coconut milk, condensed milk, topped with nutmeg) was so refreshing and tasty, it sealed the deal (yelp.com/biz_photos/blac…). I'm not a fan of cloying cocktails (reason #43587 why I love my Scotch neat and my whisky on the rocks), and the ones I tried here were just as described. They also cater to the non-alcoholic drinkers (weirdos) with mocktails. Also tasty to order: +In-Laws (Rye, Amaro, lemon, topped with ginger beer) +Thai Tamarindo (Tamarind-infused rum, ginger lime, mint, Thai bitters, topped with ginger beer). Guess I like ginger beer. For around $10 a cocktail, good company, and friendly bartenders, I'm definitely coming back.

FjSwrlcU3ZSvcohOxUCtyg.review_text: Good drinks, way too loud. Not a place to have a small conversation. Bar staff was pretty friendly.

xW1VyqqsoASlUCMa7qjpXA.review_text: I spy with my little eye... hipsters and h-mos and yuppies - oh my!  My number one gay brought me to Blackbird for an after-work cocktail on our way to the Cafe re-launch event and I'm sold.  It's filled with people from all of the surrounding neighborhoods, and I love a mixed crowd.  Bar staff was talkative, attentive and made sure that our pretzel cup was never empty. And they weren't shy with their whiskey either.  Now, if only they served some nom-my nibbles I'd REALLY be hook-line-and-sinkered.

UYsCuSD8FUeb09ibbvGmIQ.review_text: Never not leave a tip...the bartender threw a lemon at me after I tipped his fellow bartender and not him. After asking why he threw a lemon at me he told me I was immature and to grow up. I personally just wanted to clear the air...he then took my beer and ID, claimed I was underage and had a bounce kick me out.   The bouncer was nice so I won't hate the whole bar, but that bartender was immature and if that's how he treats customers, I'd reprimand him if I was the owner.

yIAFMLc1F2dRhXmry_rAHQ.review_text: Before I turned 21 this year, I had numerous friends telling me that I would really like this bar.  Boy were they right!  This has become my go to place for a (not so quick) drink if I am strolling in the area. The bartenders are pretty damn friendly. If you have the chance to be served by Sean, ask him to make 'his' Sazerac. It will blow you away!

5iqbNBvz9OXpAeWBuxZU_Q.review_text: Mixed crowd, mixed drinks, not bad.  Blackbird is a happening spot on the San Francisco scene.  The bartenders are true artists making the most interesting concoctions I've ever seen.  One drink included raw egg whites, others eye droppers of spice.  You can order a regular mixed drink like a vodka/soda, gin/tonic... but the truly adventurous and those in the know will order off the chalk board menu.  Drink up, enjoy!  Expect a small wait on weekends.  Great atmosphere.
