Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: Good happy hour and cool decor. I liked that my pilsner urquell came in this big cool pilsner urquell mug. Not that it really matters but sometimes it's the simple things.  Sadly the cocktails aren't cheaper during happy hour so I'll have to sample them some time after 7pm.

Suw8tiW7EHWpt7HhuB7SDw.review_text: Love thy neighbor.  Or at least, have a drink with them.  And when your neighbor is Blackbird, a mixed gay-straight crowd just trying to have a good time and not ruffle anyone's feathers with a few attractive blokes slinging behind the bar, you love thy neighbor. Maybe a little too much some times.   This isn't a one way street either, they do you right. Friendly, even when busy, and making that cocktail perfect. Really. They have dumped and remade drinks for fear something was floating in it (even though it was a shred of a mint leaf, likely) and gave no grief when they misheard the order and made the wrong drink. They corrected it without batting an eye.  Cocktail not your thing? Variety of solid beers and wines as well as bevvies for your sober friends.  Rotating cocktail menu (including a couple cask/barrel-aged options) keeps me coming back. Bring friends. Bring dates. Bring a neighbor. And show some love.

LTWUnGE5dCVGFsKuwuWV9A.review_text: Blackbird is, without a doubt, one of my favorite bars in San Francisco.   Unfortunately, it seems to be everyone else's favorite bar in San Francisco, given the crush of people here on a weekend night.   I'll give you a quick rundown, though it's hard to have specifics since the drink menu changes seasonally (which should itself be a big plus).   - Seriously delicious cocktails, crafted with care, at relatively reasonable prices ($8-12).  - Fun crowd. I'd say it used to be pretty mixed, but has gotten gayer since Churchill opened up. Once it hits a certain critical mass of gayness, the straight guys feel uncomfortable and the straight ladies follow them. So yeah, pretty gay, at least on Fridays and Saturdays.  - Decor is cool.  - Great bartenders with off-menu drinks. I regularly order a rye old fashioned, and they do a bang-up job of it.  - Sometimes the bartenders have a bit of attitude, to be honest.  - CASH ONLY. Sadly.  - Very busy on Fridays and Saturdays, though clears out around midnight as people leave for dance-type places. Come early to get a table, or come late to avoid the crowds.   Love Blackbird.

ewBjH1lie3SIhMnjxXOZYA.review_text: What a cool bar. I grabbed a few cocktail here with some friends. Great atmosphere!! Will be back! Give them a try!!

ugk0g6vyv2XavpoTaJSy6A.review_text: Came here because our regular joint Cafe Flore was packed and not ready to handle us. Whatevs, because Blackbird rocks.   First of all, there are windows. And light! And it's really clean!  Pool table in the back. A lot of bar seating. A lot of little wooden tables for small groups along the wall. The bar is pretty and the decor creates a nice ambiance.  We all got drinks off of the cocktail menu. I loved my Pimm's Cup (Pimm's, vodka, cucumber, strawberry, ginger ale). It was very refreshing and just the right strength for a Saturday afternoon.   The My Clementine was very elegant and not too sweet.  I forget the names of the other ones we got... the coconutty one with fresh nutmeg is really creamy and sweet. The one with pineapple and espresso liqueur is unique and worth a try if you like novelty drinks.  Blackbird is such a gem and I'm very happy we found it.   My one gripe is the shaky wooden tables. The uneven surfaces are very precarious, causing drinks to teeter and sometimes splash.

UiiqFVbUjcfOiga1ceO4NA.review_text: Amazing cocktails!  The bartenders there are what a classic bartender should be.  They know their craft and seem like they enjoy being thrown curveballs.  Tell them what kind of liquor you like and be nice, they might make you an amazing custom made drink, or try one out on you.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: Daddy likes. It's a little swanky for a place that insists it's still just a neighborhood bar, but they have a GREAT wine selection and very friendly folks 'tending. I was a little aghast to see they actually painted the beautiful wood on the bar that's been there since way back when it was the Expansion, but I suppose that's better than having removed it. It can get a little douchey in here, but weekend afternoons are still delightful for chatting and clinking.

NSi5rwdMkepP8Q2Hp-8SaQ.review_text: bar tenders know how to make a good Manhattan. Great job with the interior - modern but not pretentious.  Great mix of patrons - i've consistently had a great time here

lsfsIunhr4HtHj9NG48TQw.review_text: Okay, I've only been to this bar twice and I like it already.   I love the crowd at this bar, I honestly thought I was in a different city. None of the people looked familiar, and believe me you see the same faces in every bar in SF. I like the ambience, love the lighting, ample seats and decent drinks. This bar introduces a whole new "middle end" scene, and is a great hang out on the weekends.   On the downside, it does get super crowded, but hey that's a part of the fun, right?

VCYtRcED5pBCZBwhEUI8Nw.review_text: Blackbird is one of the best cocktail bars I've been to. If you want a carefully crafted cocktail, or you just want to get wasted, they have something for you.  Their happy hour just increased a little, but you can still get $4 well drinks and $6 old fashioned's from 5-8pm every weekday. Their happy hour goes until 8. That is awesome. Blackbird wants you to get drunk after you leave work, apparently. So, thanks Blackbird.  If you're not going for happy, I would recommend asking your bartender what you would like. This is one of those places where they'll make you something better than what you were planning on ordering. They even have cocktails on drought. Bartenders are super nice too.  They have pool tables in the back and rotate art on the walls. There's mixed style seating throughout the place for whatever type of group you're in.   Don't forget: cash only. Oh, SF.

k3VaHk6DIMart7pLFJdWjQ.review_text: Last night was my first time at Blackbird.  What a nice place.  Friendly crowd, easy gois atmosphere and good drinks.  Definitely not your typical gay bar.

hwCZpVXZn8sFGGTwN-bYMg.review_text: what an adorable neighborhood joint. I came here to meet an old grad school buddy for a few happy hour drinks, to my delight they had a pimms cup on their cocktail menu (cucumber garnish and all!) I had been staying in the mission and working in SOMA so i was quite surprised at how safe my backpack with every apple product known to man was left unattended on our chairs. the folks next to us were chatty and friendly. A bit crowded when you first walk in, but make your way to the back and theres def room to stretch. I will be honest, coming from SOMA it was a real bitch to get out here...even getting OFF the MUNI proved to be difficult. I hate that train. DEATH TO THE MUNI. LONG LIVE BLACKBIRD!

LpRlZ58I3TGK71A7Urvf4A.review_text: After a tiring day at the office, i was both hungry and thirsty.  I made the late rush hour trek across the bridge in to SF.  After a decent meal with a friend, i was one for one.  To solve my thirst needs, we headed to Blackbird.  A dark and warm environment greets as you walk in the door.  There is a clash of moder, industrial and old that works very well.  The staff is friendly, the bar is well stocked, price is fair, though not necessarily cheap  and there are plenty of seats for a bar of this size.  However, Blackbird's popularity make it a crowded environment on busier nights.  And as some reviewers have previously wrote, it can get prohibitively crowded.  I've left on previous nights having been unsuccessful in reaching the bar.  But not this night.  Jameson and ginger ale in hand, we found a corner table away from the noise.  The acoustics at Blackbird are terrible.  Even on slower nights, the small crowd reverberates off the wall as if a crowd three times its size.  Places like this need to recognize what they want to be.  They are a bar, where one can tolerate a moderate amount of noise but ultimately chose this over a club for more relaxing reasons.  Nevertheless, after my second beverage (3rd of the night) i was much relaxed and briefly confused my Monday for a Thursday; the night you recognize you have work the next day but increasingly care less with each drink.  Thank you Blackbird.

q862ZzjLE_MmcX-P7nCEYw.review_text: On my whirlwind trip to San Fran I was trying to take in the many fantastic neighborhoods the city has to offer. I figured my trip would not be complete with out a night in the Castro. I choose the Blackbird after a bit of research and I really wasn't disappointed.   The drinks were a great blend of classic and modern and I went through a few interspersed with an Anchor Steam or ten. The bar itself has a great fit out with a speakeasy steps into 2010 type feel. Old newspaper clippings adorned the walls and the pool table didn't make the place look tacky at all.   The venue is long and somewhat narrow and was pretty crowded at the front. A very cool crowd who seemed happy to be there with a drink in hand. The bar staff were friendly and pretty efficient and there were even a few smiles on their faces.   We met some cool fashion kids here and ended up partying back at their store into the early hours. I couldn't have asked for a better night in the Castro.

U3EVbzZFTWCHbm91MRijLA.review_text: Great happy hour.  Always super crowded- fairly diverse crowd, a little to busy/noisy for my tastes.  Serious competitions for a table... as soon as one opened up people were diving for it.  But $3 for a greyhound made with odwalla grapefruit juice!  Not super strong happy hour drinks, but cheap enough to make it worth while.  The cocktail list was strong, it looked interesting- $8 a pop for chipoltle bloody mary or other delicious sounding drinks.  I'd be down to check it out again, preferably when it's a little less busy.

ojur8znWZhIDlfQmdPTj8g.review_text: Get one of the specialty drinks. Great for a mixed crowd.

5_RMkNVWvGM8dp0DBDKqxg.review_text: Yum! I loved this place! Great scene, fabulous drinks, awesome scene... I was entertained for hours by the people watching alone! The ambiance is pretty chill - quite hipster, if you will. Great music. Drinks were tasty and creative - delicious. Would definitely come back here... wish they took credit card though!

NYPLXaW-ErP19GrZqW3rVQ.review_text: Great drinks, great service, great atmosphere (if you don't like the typical club scene), and usually a good crowd.

YR0CcWbSasHEVoXzjCTREQ.review_text: Blackbird makes some killer cocktails for the adventurous, and combines them with a cool environment and great people-watching.  I recommend the Early Bird, which is a little less exotic than many of the other menu items, but still enjoyable.

4KJchXXUZzl5JzVaeP8bjQ.review_text: quite simply, blackbird is a great bar.  cocktail menu is interesting, inventive and tasty.  decor/atmosphere is among the best in SF.  staff is very friendly.  a welcome addition to the greater castro area and to SF

MFZAJCjeogRcavL7pvU6yQ.review_text: Blackbird was on my "to do" list, and it did it - in moderation. Of course, there was an immense amount of pressure to sample one of their many cocktails, and I chose a bitters-heavy version of an orange crush. Not disappointed in the Grantia, but I'll never order it again...maybe my senses are not refined enough (highly unlikely), but the combination of flavors was a little too heavy for my liking.  Their BEER selection was on point - I experienced the Coney Island Albino Python White Lager and was totally floored....how I never located/experienced this lovely beer back on the East coast, I'm unsure, but it's my new favorite.   The staff was friendly and patient and the crowd, a late-20's early-30's bunch, all seemed to be enjoying their time. Next go around I'll make it a point to to grab a round of pool at the table in the back.

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: This is a nice bar with great cocktails and a long draft beer list.   It has a rustic decor with uneven tables, so be careful not to knock over your drink on the ridges. The back of the bar houses a pool table, photo booth and ATM. The bartenders were super friendly.  Other reviewers have complained about the noise but it didn't bother me at all.  Don't forget to bring some green since it's cash only.

j5huUZ0E3_s8-Dht2zvJcg.review_text: I'd like to tell you a little secret, but you have to promise that you won't tell anyone else okay? Promise?... Alright here it is....  I'm in love with Blackbird.  There, I said it. It's finally off my chest. I am as free as a bird and that bird happens to be black.  Whenever I want to have a relaxed happy hour or late night drink with a friend, we head to Blackbird first. The bartenders are all amazing, make some of the best cocktails in SF, and know. their. sh*t. And let's be honest, what's not to love here?  Going on a first date and need a good place to get to know someone? Blackbird.  Trying to avoid the typical haunts of the Castro for a more upscale drinking experience? Blackbird.  Need to enjoy an ever changing art collection? Blackbird.  Hungry for a little bowl of pretzels with your cocktail? BLACKBIRD, DUH.  It's rare that you come across a bar with so much character, but this place honestly gets me like no other. Enjoy your drink, but try not to tell too many people okay? I need to have my love affair in peace.  Cheers.

z8HWS6ULdX7keowoc6GQyg.review_text: I have mixed feelings about this place. I was here on new years and I had a great time because I was surrounded by people I love; however, the bartender had me angry from my first order.  in the top 5 pet peeves--asking for a tip.  I will hit the bar probably every 20 minutes; no I am not going to tip every single time, but I will tip you every couple of visits. However I hate when bar tenders feel entitled to a tip. The first drink I had was not great at all, and as I was walking to my table to set the drink down the bartender says kind of rudely..."DON'T FORGET TO TIP THE BARTENDER LADIES". umm, excuse me? you get $1 and can shove it because the drink you made was garbage. But then I went to another bartender who made me a long island THAT WAS AMAZING! & I wish I still had the dollar i gave the other bartender so i could give this bartender more. There is only one stall in the ladies room, 1 stall and 2 urinals in the dudes. Overall this wouldn't be my first choice of places to go, but if everyone was adamant about coming here I would not fight the crowd. Oh, and they also have a pool table. So I guess, other than than one bartender who makes sucky drinks its a decent bar.  Also, there is no DJ or anything like that, but there is music playing in the background and this place does have a nice ambiance.

2XbQIi87ySz7KSOI4RgCuA.review_text: I visited for the first time on Saturday night (actually, Sunday morning) around 12:30.  It was still busy enough that we had to stand, but not so busy that it was annoying.  We were still able to get a spot at the bar to order and easily stand and have our drinks and talk.  I didn't research what they had in depth, but I did notice they had about 10 beers on tap.  My friend and I both had the Limonata ($8).  It was basically a vodka/lemon type drink in a tall glass on the rocks, but it also had some vanilla, which was a nice twist.  Very refreshing.  It looks like they have a lot of creative specialty cocktails, so I'll be back to try some of those.  This would be a good location to try before dinner in the Castro or a show at Cafe du Nord.  It's a mix of gay and straight, so everyone would feel comfortable here.

VlYnsiwt0fPsqrAF1_D7hg.review_text: I really like this place. They have some great cocktails and a good happy hour - pretzels baby!  The decor makes it appear like the left side of the bar is a different place than the right side of the bar.  And finally, to get the photobooth working you insert the money under the seat - now that deserves a +1 useful.

khFA0eLpu7H08JOWtiVF8w.review_text: I'm updating this to neutral because the owner/manager contacted me with apologies and an assurance that the bartender in question has been suspended based on my review and some others. I don't have any way to verify this information besides going back - so perhaps if and when I do, I'll update my review again.

4q0f_CS-qpezOalKTLku5A.review_text: the couches were pretty nice i must say. it kinda makes you feel like a rock star when you sit in that area. FYI, pretty good grape soda for those non-alkies.

7d-I36ZiaO8lm2P7xBDpiA.review_text: Probably my new favorite bar in the Castro. It's far from what you'd expect in the Castro. None pretentious and very low key. Could get pretty packed and loud but it's worth it. The photobooth in the back is a very nice touch too

y3_O4sMF2v6vuTZM_FfqGw.review_text: Chill, yet upscale.  Not overly-loud.    Very good castro bar.    Wish they had more seats, though, and wish they took credit cards.

IKBJGhVo9deZtSY3054GWA.review_text: As most have said before me, this place is really great!! Casual but truly loud....so be prepared....but it's not horrible at all.  The bartenders are really great and fast....attentive too. I had a farmers daughter - loved it....yum and one of the barrel fermented drinks...really great. Awesome drinks mixology is superb.  Cash only.

x7vEuKtf4SyPi8-I2Nb3IQ.review_text: Blackbird was recommended to me by a friend who lives in San Francisco.  They have a great draft beer selection. I also tried one of their speciality drinks, the Blackbird Negroni.  The bartender was patient enough to explain the ingredients. It was an amazingly good drink, that also knocked me on my ass a bit.  The atmosphere is very comfortable as well.  There was a decent crowd for a Monday evening in late August.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Cute modern rustic country design.  Stop in to just check that out.  Great vibe whether it's pretty empty or full.  Lots of wines by the glass and cheap bottles (like $24).  Cool how they list all their wines, beers, and cocktails on big ol pieces of butcher paper.  They also have a pool table kind of hidden from view.  Super nice staff.  Fave new place in the Castro!

Jxh7OQD02BjuO2i-F6YZ5w.review_text: Great bar with a mixed crowd, a good vibe and some of the best gin-based cocktails in the city. Try the "Early Bird" when you're there. Also, I'd advise you to go during the week, since it can get ridiculously packed on weekends.

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: Possibly one of my favorite SF cocktail bars yet. Perfect for a casual night out. The ambiance is dark and moody, with sexual art and grungy walls. Absolutely obsessed with their drink menu. I can't remember the name of my drink, but I told the bartender I typically drank dry gin martinis and he stirred up something cool and refreshing, with a berry in it. Just tangy enough (I hate sweet), totally matched my taste buds.   I want to bring all my visitors here, I think it perfectly captures the understated vibe of SF.

MniM4s3_274LU2isiu8n0Q.review_text: What night did we come out? Monday  How was the line? No line  What did we have? 3 Brother Thelonius Belgian Style Abbey  How was the crowd? Very Good Looking  How was the scene? Very Social  What's the demographic? More men than women  What's the ambience? GQ/Polished/Trendy  What kind of music was playing at Blackbird? Mix  What's the noise level? Loud  Will we hang out at Blackbird again? Yes

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: When i wanna get a lil fancier than my dives.  Final Word when im drinking pinky up.  Black Butte Porter when im rockin the flannel.  (they have an amazing list of specialty cocktails and beers, im just a creature of habit)  True mixologists.

g33nz0olhXKe9TgwUh7zMQ.review_text: this place ROCKS, fun people, VERY friendly staff, door and behind the bar, WAY OUT THERE interior design, someone has a fantastic and creative talented design mind when pulling this place together....LOVE IT...can't wait to go back. It's my new fave hang out in "Castro East!"....

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: Apparently, I "forgot" to write my review of Blackbird.  True, my head was abuzz with fine FINE cocktails, the joy of running into several friends, and the pleasure of charming bartenders.  True, I thought to myself at the time that even though it was very busy on a weekday night, it was still a wel-kept secret from those outside the neighborhood.  True, I have been known to hold onto favorites places for fear of them getting over-reviewed and over-run.  But this time I really forgot. I mean, "forgot".  P.S. It's awesome, go there!

p5k2sgXGdaXTXQM2LMmDNA.review_text: There is a pool table, photo booth, and a nice atmosphere.  The cocktails are strong and good, just like how I like it.  It's cash only though, which sucks just a little bit.  I'd come back here to start the night.

_i3uTqtUfyVZDryKzUGGiw.review_text: A previous reviewer said it reminded him of a Hell's Kitchen bar but it's more Williamsburg-ey.

zgV0ZroIF956gw4cul8MHA.review_text: Met my cuz here while I was visiting town. Dark atmosphere with a full stock of every premium alcohol from around to world. Not a dive but a classy place. CASH ONLY. I sat up at the bar while waiting for him and was greeted promptly by the bartender.  I ordered a yummy oatmeal stout even though their choices of well named speciality cocktails looked divine! Upon his arrival he ordered a drink called The Inlaws and it looked very good.  After a few minutes of visiting the place filled up! This place is located at a stop where all Muni lines go. Very convenient walk up maybe a block and your there! It's gets VERY loud in here around 10pm and we were there on a Thursday night. They have plenty of back and front area seating but if you sit near the back end up at the bar, be prepared to have drinks quizzing between your conversation :)  I like this place a lot. If I lived in the area I would be one of their locals.

P3usQcIegPCl-cdH4IDirg.review_text: I'd heard about Blackbird after I moved away from the city, but wasn't quite certain whether or not I'd really enjoy it as much as my friends suggested they did. You know what I'm saying; a good bar is like a style. Some people love one, some people hate it. You never know until you try it on.  So since I was in the area, and a friend was meeting up some of his homies here to grab a cocktail, we thought we'd tag along and see for ourselves. It's an unassuming little place from the outside, as is the fashion in San Francisco... inside, they did a wonderful job. It's stylish and hip without being too intentional; doesn't do the "LA" thing and try too hard. Wood finishes and natural tones... it works.  We ordered two drinks from the specialty menu, at random, and both were delicious. Not only that, they were reasonably priced. We had a nice time, enjoyed a chill crowd, had a drink, and left to meet another friend at another venue. Truthfully, when I move back to San Francisco, this would be my new go-to place on a slow night. I'd love to shoot pool, have a drink, hang out, mellow... it's a good vibe.  I'm a believer.

WzTapC3mZGEcX7Umvy7KtQ.review_text: If your looking to a relaxing night with a good crowd of people lookno further than Blackbird. They have amazing drink menu that never seems to disappointment me and it isn't too pricey. It can get fairly crowded so if you scored yourself a seat or a stool better not get up as they are a hot commodity here. Of your in the neighborhood check it out I promise it will not disappoint.

Z1ZzJnDUp3ciTIRiOQfMxg.review_text: Got in the door before it got too crowded.  The bar has a great volume level even though there are many hard surfaces.    I dont' usually go for the mixed drinks but the rosemary fix sounded amazing.  It includes gin, a rosemary infusion and lemons.  This drink is yummy and so dangerous.  It does not taste like there is an alcohol in it.  That could be a problem if you had to many of them.

Ghx1YCJSYmRq_P3mXrcChg.review_text: Sort of like a gay version of Bloodhound, but without the antlers.  This is my kinda place, finally. it has, dare i say, an SF vibe. Not some copy-cat-LA-valley-pornstar vibe. Bartender had a thoughtful conversation with me about the best way to construct a margarita. And he delivered a lovely well-tuned drink. Nice mix of nerdy cute guys, out-of-place derelicts ("whoa, where'd my bar go?"), hipsters, and gay intelligentsia.  i'm there.

AlBoilRiKVTW9B0qr6wt6w.review_text: I really enjoy the laid back atmosphere at Blackbird. Along with a great selection of beers, including some rather fine craft ales, and some very interesting and potent cocktails, this makes for a good place to start and end a night, and fill the time in between too if you're so inclined.  Friendly bar staff, good amounts of seating and never too crowded, it's the ideal place to head when you're done with the Fri/Sat night crush elsewhere in the city.

2XA0lvN91lKuDANrg7wfNw.review_text: Love, love, love this place!!  This was one of the first spots I went to when I moved up to the city and I immediately fell in love.  Everything about the place: the ambiance, the crowd, the drinks.  The drink menu changes seasonally which I find amazing.  They have a pool table in the back and a fun little photo booth.  It does get quite crowded on the weekends - this is clearly the spot if you're looking for a gay bar that's not so "Castro."

ri_9w2ySTQrl5eXG4Vtebw.review_text: First the good... love this place and love the cocktails.  The Slurpee is an always-awesome classic.  Same goes for the Early Bird.   The new Winter menu is across-the-board great.  Place is usually a bit intense in terms of crowd on weekend nights, but that's to be expected when drinks are that good.  In terms of the bad: could really live without one particularly pretentious bartender.  Dude with the shoulder-length hair... please, please chill out!  He's always giving off vibes like he resents all his customers.  Had a friend accidentally spill a drink that he had just made (sucks but it happens!) and he not only charged for it (acceptable, but a nice bartender would just be friendly and just make another) but also acted sooo put out by it.  Made a HUGE production of cleaning up the small spill on the bar.  Look, my friend already felt bad about spilling the drink... no need to make it an even bigger deal by announcing to everyone within earshot that you were cleaning up a "huge puddle."  Problem is that this wasn't an isolated incident... every time I encounter this guy he's spazzing out and acting like we should be grateful for the honor of paying him $10 for a drink.  I love this place but I'd love it even more if the folks behind the bar were nicer.

3tJcTVPckkv7ZOrn1EcqPg.review_text: Gotta say - this place is spot on.  Randomly went in with a friend who I was meeting at Church and Market, and was glad we did.  While it definitely has that "brand new" smell, they've done a great job with it, and the vibe and decor are suitably mellow and eclectic.  They have an awesome selection of beers and wines, and the crowd was full and energetic without being overwhelming (this was on a Friday night).  Highly Recommended.  By the way; about 2 hours into our visit it was mentioned to me that the bar "might be" a "gay bar".  Okay - it's near the Castro, so that's just going to be part of the crowd.  If you can't deal, don't go.  That being said, the overall vibe is definitely not that of a "gay bar" at all  - the place is just a stylish, hip spot.  Enjoy.

XbC9JB6cSpcAmEPJVR6tkw.review_text: When my friend invited me to join her and her friends at Blackbird for drinks last Friday night, I wasn't quite sure what and where she was talking about. But she did mention drinks so what the heck! While it took a little while to find this place (look for the bird wearing a top hat) as well as parking (look for anything), we finally made our way into the bar.   It was relatively crowded, but not overly so - there was still room to move around without bumping and grinding into your fellow patrons. The place was well lit and clean. In terms of the customers, there was a good mix of the typical San Francisco demographics. The drink menu was written on butcher paper and taped up behind the bar. The noise level was decent - and I had no trouble hearing my friends. After taking in the sights and sounds for a moment, I headed off to order drinks.   On the plus side, the bartenders was very friendly. The wait at the bar wasn't too long. I was surprised to find they had Sudwerks beer on tap since that's more of a Davis/Sacramento thing. The dirty martini and the Manhattan I ordered was mixed relatively well. No complaints from my friends - other than they didn't serve Grey Goose.   On the down side, I was surprised that a place that wasn't trying to be a dive bar didn't take plastic. Given the prices for drinks weren't on the cheap side, you'd think they'd let you swipe. Let's face it, we all end up drinking more than we intend to but we usually only bring enough cash to pay for what we intended to drink.   One interesting feature of this bar is the newspaper "wallpaper" they have up. While it looks good aesthetically, native San Franciscans (like yours truly) might find the headlines an interesting read. Some of them bring back memories of local events from years past.   Anyway, the drinks were fine and a good time was had by all so I would definitely go back.

bBcqekQCyObJ-GWezUzXGA.review_text: Edit: 02/03/2012  I won't post Shawn Vergara's (Blackbird Proprietor) email publicly, but I do want to say that my "one star" has moved to a "three star" because of it.  This bartender has been suspended "for being overly aggressive" (Shawn's words) and will remain on probation when he returns. He was probably having a bad day, but that's no excuse for the behavior we experienced that night. I do hope his behavior changes; I know his behavior doesn't represent everyone working at Blackbird.  I do believe this was an isolated case. I also believe that Shawn is truly concerned about our experience at Blackbird, and that he has acted to ensure that your experience continues to be good.  I'll give Blackbird another try, and the drinks--at least three more tries!  ----- A respected bar turned sour tonight as a group of people were physically assaulted and kicked out by the bouncer at 1:40 AM on a Sunday morning.  Sounds typical, since most have had a lot to drink by that time. But there's no excuse for treating people this way. I understand how bartenders and bouncers had a hard time all night and simply want to go home. But not at the expense of people they just served.  I witnessed an innocent woman being forced out by some "bouncer," pushed backwards through the doors with both hands at 1:45 AM. That kind of treatment after spending a lot of cash (they don't take CC's) on drinks and tips for these owners and employees. Only to be treated like crap at a time they felt like closing.  I also witnessed a few people with iPhones recording things from the sidewalk, and then the bouncer stepped away from one argument (woman pushed out) to starting another by physically grabbing phones. These are customers, not criminals. All they wanted was last call politely. Not with violence and rudeness.  I won't ever return to Blackbird. Plenty of other bars around the city to try. If this is the way they treat people at the end of the night, what's more in the meantime? There's no way I'll return to this offensive place. No thanks.

Vg95DIeQoYgAQPr1td1Tjg.review_text: Very charming atmosphere, boasts revolving signature cocktails. The acoustics are terrible, though, and it gets incredibly loud once it starts filling up. I didn't have any of the specialty drinks, but my cocktail was decent enough, if on the small side. I'd go back.

PwBriZjb_u69RTujuaZPPA.review_text: Loved this bar! Seems like the perfect spot to catch up with friends, meet some new interesting people (I saw a man wearing real life Google glasses here...can you tell I'm not from SF?), or sip on a few delicious cocktails.   On a Saturday night the bar was full, but there were still plenty of tables and places to hang out. The music wasn't too loud and the bartenders were nice. All around, a great spot in the area!

LOc_d0RtBEPU9LxQqQztjw.review_text: Just went here for the first time. Loved the atmosphere and the special drink the bartender made for me called "The Farmer's Daughter". I told him I want egg whites and gin and to have his way with my drink. It was amazing. They need to add this drink to the menu.

WFRIHL7BzK_ZarGFPHf5_A.review_text: the best joint for a stiff cocktail and friendly faces! the bartenders are  always on game.when i want to grab a drink with friends this is always our go to.  we love this gray bar!!!!!!!

eKUa5AEwD6IRUrpKAxdhNA.review_text: The 3 words that come to mind every time I think of Blackbird: Mixology Hipster Heaven. The ambiance is chill and welcoming. The crowd is mixed (from straight to gay to hipster to workaholics) and I love it. There is plenty of space to just hang out with friends. They hang artwork from local artists to sell and change them out regularly.   This bar gets very crowded on weekends and especially during happy hour when everyone is just getting off work. Happy hour deals are AMAZING.  Their drink menu changes every season, so come by often and try as many drinks as you can because before you know it, they're gone.  Their drinks are delicious and strong (my two favorite things when it comes to drinks lol).  They only accept CASH, so come with your pockets filled.

2t77kh3QWk9as0FUltI1Cw.review_text: I love love love this place whenever I'm in the Castro this is usually the place I hit up.  They change their drink list ever so often but it's never a miss.  Always love their specialty cocktails, I should come back soon...

4TwCpBgmE9X4PkG-VSxl0g.review_text: I love Blackbird and come here almost every time I am in SF. I love the innovative cocktail list, which is reasonably priced (last time I was there I spent a total of $14 for two drinks, a martini and a rum cocktail). I've always found it to have a good vibe with an eclectic mix of people and never too crowded.

oKrct4Hc8hZNMYXecitLCw.review_text: I was here for a happy hour event on Thursday. The warm wood paneling and windows add to the street.  I loved the decor of the bar. I loved the long row couch that lines the wall in front of the bar. The offer a great selection on tap and an eclectic full bar.    I like the amount of people at this event . The bar wasn't too rushed. One could move and not spill a drink.  I imagine the pool table can be moved and that space would be the dance floor.    The proximity to Church street station MUNI is an added bonus.  I can see myself back here.

vVipQgmX6TcSOAtkPSmGEA.review_text: Blackbird is one of the few good bars in the castro.  The scene is not too old, not too young, a little gay (maybe a lot gay on weekends), and a little straight.  The decor is sophisticated and hip (a rarity for the castro).  The drinks are good, especially the citrus cocktails.

2Sf58ceaNru-RFabRtUvvA.review_text: I really writing this review so I can close out my mental Blackbird category (see the review I just wrote previously to understand).  This is a pretty nice bar, and although it can get crowded on a saturday night, that's no reason to avoid.   note to self: don't drink champagne before dinner anymore, so you can better enjoy the bar after dinner.  I really like the sign with the 'plague doctor' blackbird - very striking visual design there!  I'll be back!

egJ0KB6iuj9_2HsnOfVgLw.review_text: Super chill place with a fantastic happy hour. Gets a little packed and loud with an after work crowd, but still plenty of seating and bar space.   The best part is around 8pm they bring a "Lets Be Frank" hot dog stand inside the bar. Didn't get to try it but the smell was overpowering and incredible. Will have to indulge next time.

QjMsxTxmwSzHllJx94hP4g.review_text: awesome place to kick it with your buddies for some unique drinks. there's a pool table, and some nice couches to relax on. plus you can actually hold a conversation here.

SVJksntGTGQRMJ26O8AlvQ.review_text: The Blackbird is an excellent neighborhood bar.  My buddy ordered the Nice Melon, that was an excellent drink.  I had some concoction with apple vodka, it was really good.  The place is of a good size.  It has huge bar area to the left and seating on the right.  There is a pool table with additional seating in the back.  The decor is nice and classy.  It is dark inside, and there are tiny candles at every table.    NOTE:  I guess this place does take reservations, so I do recommend that you call them up and secure a table.  I saw people coming in and looking for a place to sit.  I thought it was weird to so many tables "reserved" but no one sitting.  Luckily for me, my buddy and I found a place to sit near the window.    CASH ONLY.    Cheers

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: I love Blackbird because its a cool place without the pretentiousness. People are clean and cool and seem to be good company. The decor is warm and dim, but comfortable. An overall great place for a drink in the neighborhood.

e2sJeAXWdiGgQfIJfEQZ7w.review_text: This is a great bar! Right off the bat the bouncer was friendly and welcoming. The overall ambiance was casual, but by no means too casual, if you catch my drift. In 3 words, I would say it's an more like an upscale dive bar.   In terms of their drinks, their beer selection was very impressive, and their cocktails were unique yet classic. Their prices are somewhat on the steep side as an out-of-towner, but probably pretty standard for the area. Coming from the Tucson bar scene, I was very impressed with Blackbird and will be sure to make another visit next time I'm in town.

gLke-4oih1t7urvoQAENcQ.review_text: Definitely my favorite bar in the Castro since you can actually hear people talk. Now that Churchill has opened up, the Friday  night lines seems to have disappeared. Still wall-to-wall with dudes and the occasional lady, but at least tables open up and you aren't always getting belly bumped. Empties out around midnight since it's usually the first stop on a night out for most of the people.  Cocktails are a little pricey, but always tasty.  Sidewinder was ginger beer and mezcal mostly, didn't really taste the other misc. stuff. The spring of basil atop was nommy once you mash it into the ice. Initial impression is that the drink is all ice, but steep alcohol pours, so the ice kinda works out.   The back area has cool newspaper headlines plastering the walls and the whole place has a vaguely classy feel to it.

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: I met up with a friend last night for post-work drinks. I have to say that the skill of the bartenders lives up to the hype.  I'll preface my review by saying that I don't like bars and I don't drink regularly (maybe a glass of wine with a special dinner or the occasional beer). This, however, is the type of bar I like--low key and not overly snooty/hipster/fratty/divey.   I asked the bartender to make me a mocktail ($4) with ginger in it. He seemed genuinely excited that I was letting him be creative and do his thing and the end product was AMAZING! Seriously, one of the best drinks I've ever had. My second mocktail (this time with mint) was equally refreshing. I can't emphasize enough how well-mixed the drinks are here!   One star deducted because it was a bit loud but I'll definitely be back here again.

NLgTfZz_ITzmV6KiO-mGIg.review_text: It is really dark in here. Not spooky dark though. More like a sultry let-me-hold-your-hand-for-a-second dark, if you know what I mean. I came here on a Saturday night with a friend and it was packed. If you're one of those lucky underaged people that can walk into 21+ bars without having your ID checked, this place isn't for you. There's a bouncer that checks ID and meh, he wasn't super friendly. I like bouncers with a little spunk.  The crowd in here is a mix; the ratio of males to females is about 4-1. My favorite thing about this bar/lounge is the pool table in the back. Only $1/game! There's also a photobooth located in the back area. I didn't get a chance to try their signature cocktails (which is what this place is really known for) because I didn't stay for too long. I did, however, ordered a bottled beer. I believe most bottled beers are $5-8, depending on what you order.

Peqt13tHOx_b7xBhitxzNg.review_text: All this time living practically next door and I just hit this place for the first time?  Blasphemy!  If you're hungry go across the street, grab a burrito and bring it back.  They only have jars of tasty pastes made of things like cheese, olives, onions or hummus they serve with crackers.  It's good, but not enough volume to shut down a serious grumble.  The bartenders are super rad.  Adam and Marcus served my friend and I on a lovely Tuesday happy hour afternoon.  They made it very happy.  Two city bartenders that were not dismissive, actually sort of laughed at my jokes, and they weren't even trying to perv on us.  Thank you for that.    They have a photo booth.  Cash Only.  The bathroom is not a toilet behind a curtain!  It's a newly remodeled, spacious and clean bathroom!  OUTRAGEOUSLY EXCITING!    (Females:  Please stop playing on your phone on the toilet. # 1.  Gross. # 2 Gross.  # 3  There are still 7 females outside waiting for you, we did not disappear when you locked the door.  # 4 Stop being really gross.)    The atmospheric design is pretty unique.  They created the illusion of levels with long wood panels that appear aged.  You would think it could make the place seem smaller, but it added some really cool dimensions.  I am a beer-over-cocktails-anyday kinda girl, but I stepped out on account of the tasty sounding combo of the Kapre-Inha.  It turned out to be the best tastebud vacation I've had in months!  Not sugary, not bitter, just perfect.  If Blackbird rocks my socks, it oughta rock yours, too.

BdWtanx8M38CzsUOHVYiow.review_text: I love this place, probably one of my favorite bars in SF. It's a little pricey but  great cocktail combinations. I love the crowd, a good mix of people (urban, hipsters, professionals, gay, straight, black, white, ugly, sexy, and everything else.) I usually make this my first stop on a Friday night where I can grab a seat near the back with my friends to chat it up before being ready to hit the dance floor somewhere else.

Dg47n815J8xE5y7CVAKjPg.review_text: I am of the strong opinion that San Francisco's gayborhood needs more class. Compared to others of similar repute, too many of the Castro's bars are ho-hum, if not downright dingy...this place is a breath of fresh air.  Blackbird is visually refined, yet comfortable. It brings the style in spades, but doesn't do it in a minmod steel-and-strobe lights way. The plank lumber drop ceiling over slate tables compliments dangling oversize light bulbs hanging over the bar; the bathrooms and pool table in the back hold their own.  Once you're in and have taken in the surround, the drinks are reasonable and the clientele is friendly. WIN! Castro bar of the year '09!

AQdZwJvSJF-LYl0tzRe_0g.review_text: They kept the gorgeous woodwork, one of the pool tables and the friendly drink prices!   The exterior got a face lift; while the interior got hip new booths for seating, modular tables and a fancy ceiling.   The seasonal drink menu looks sexy, though I didn't try anything. My drinks were made well and actually served out of glass, as opposed to plastic.  I'll definitely be back. A lot.

gOPm2yoe38_OM6x4NIwLEw.review_text: Good cocktails, if a bit crowded.

hl3qnjnYZZTi345i_z8xNA.review_text: Hmmm, I am torn on this review. I have heard rave reviews about this place since it opened. While it is a welcome addition to the Castro, it feels more SOMA-ish to me. Kind of like Wish on Folsom.  The decor is cool, lots of mixed seating options, a strategically placed (thank you!) pool table at the back, long bar and cool dropped ceiling. But the vibe felt off to me, almost confused? And whoa, I have never been in a noisier bar. What is going on with the accoustics in there? The bartenders were attentive and friendly. I like the big scroll drink menus :) I will more than likely find myself in there again, but I found it just A-ok...

2iSBJHVMNsolJ3AH1g_D7A.review_text: And a jay- song was on. AND A JAY-Z SONG WAS ONNNNNN  Oh, Miley.  Anyways. This bar is very to the point, so I'll be to the point.  Staff: Friendly as can be, and super cute in a non-modeleque kind of way, but cute nonetheless. Drinks: Tasty and priced correctly. Yes, correctly. People: Imagine all your friends in one place. Yep, they're there. Location: 20 feet from Church Street Station and about 15 bus stops. Couldn't be better.  Blackbird is where business happens.

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: Walking down this long and narrow bar, you will find yourself rewarded by a pool table and restrooms in the back. It's a nice table too, not your standard green felt. The decor is nice as well, very contemporary, but integrating wooden panel ceilings and wooden stumps as coffee tables. The bad thing is that those textured stumps are not the best thing to put your drinks down on. The menu is posted big and high on the wall next to the bar so you are clear about their offerings, though maybe they can whip up what you want too. There's a bunch of house cocktails and some wines. There is a good number of beers on tap, but all pretty standard fare and they do not rotate. There is one abbey ale that I haven't tried, the Brother Thelonious. I liked it fine. Prices are decent.

J80sAel_esh_MM4m1a4LYQ.review_text: Busy, dark, but I liked it.  They have a good beer selection, excellent cocktails, and a random pool table in the back that you can fight with people over.  HAHA, well, I didn't fight, I just took.  But that's fine.  It has a great mix of gender and though very loud I could usually hear what my date was saying.  The atmosphere was fine for either a fine cocktail and witty banter, lots of drinking and loud conversation, or making out.  I might have done all of that.  Thumbs up.  I'd come back.

WaWjxg7N9-59Nt-2lJu5dA.review_text: Absolutely awesome, my favorites place in town

q1t5SRqWxp6TMaXu6e18xA.review_text: Upscale hipster bar near the Castro district. Always my favorite to go to when i'm pre-gaming before hitting the club in the Castro.   Allows visa card - $15 min  If you love a chill vibe, with the 80's classic songs, check this place out.   Did i mention they have pools too?

htQ5FVBS6mnSGp95MsdcnA.review_text: when you go to as many bars as i do, it's easy to get disenchanted with prohibition-era decor and cocktails with ingredients i can't pronounce. what makes Blackbird stand out is the kindness of the bartenders, because i was that annoying girl who walked up to them and asked "what's good here?" i'd just gotten off work and couldn't make a decision to save my life. enter, sean, a man with a beard and a plan.   he made a great drink, engaged in banter, and left me laughing. it didn't hurt that hall and oates were playing in the background.  BB has it all: location, pool table, good drinks, and a better soundtrack.

lZseeVtrjgmqKw9tCeAIDA.review_text: Great drinks and nice ambience but the chick bartender on Tuesday happy hours is really slow at making drinks...try to get the guy bartender on Tuesdays to make your drink instead. Their $6 margaritas are great but the Game of Thrones named/inspired drinks are cheesy to say the least...in the winter though, they've got bomb hot toddies!

BNeod_-HfBh1_KhQczJMBA.review_text: I'm rating Blackbird strictly on their cocktails (the hipster/gay scene isn't my scene in particular but it's in the Castro...so, I expected the same). We didn't wait long for the bartenders to notice us even though I would view the place as crowded. I ordered Pimm's Cup and my fiance the Bullfight. Mine was okay, though there was an excess of ice. The Bullfighter was okay as well, but it really did not require a salted rim.  (*That's what she said*)

jMzlsjUnNZzwBZqovVorFw.review_text: Blackbird was eh.   I'm kind of a cocktail snob, so I was super excited to see, on their giant butcher-paper drink menu, that the bar uses Laird's Applejack in one of their signature cocktails. Laird's can be tough to find (or, at least, it was in Boston. I'm a newbie to SF, so maybe that's not the case here?).  My favorite drink in the world, a "vintage" cocktail called the Jack Rose, is also made with Applejack, so I asked the bartender for one.   She didn't know how to make it. Which is absolutely fine. I don't expect that every bartender know how to make relatively obscure cocktails. But she was totally bitchy about it, and acted like it was either something I'd made up in college, or some chain restaurant cocktail that doesn't exist in "real" bars.   So that sucked and made me feel stupid.   I could have just told her how to make it, but I ended up ordering whatever cocktail it was that had the Laird's in it, and it was pretty good. Very autumnal. So, three stars for the drink. No stars for the bartender's shitty attitude.

_HmVfjZizikfli0zzBd2vg.review_text: Attitude and warmth are everything in this business even if you are the cool bar right now.

X3EkIJdiBg-NaOwFM_0eqw.review_text: I love the cocktails here, and the energy is great. The only one thing they need to work on is making the drinks a bit faster. Yes, they're mix-ologist, but they should still speed it up.

D4JHDISAtHlnaHf4jtvj8A.review_text: I've been here twice now and haven't been totally impressed. The price of the drinks don't really compare to their quality I feel like. The second time I went, my drink was a bit watered down. It can also take a while to get a drink if you come on a busy night. However, I still would come back because I like the atmosphere of this place. It's a place that feels real comfortable. This place is a cash only though. There is an ATM inside and also a photobooth. Overall, it's an alright place and I can understand why people like it too.

AhnR5wtdu-31uPmnv0_Leg.review_text: I'm getting increasingly tired of the bartenders' attitude. What happened? This place is losing its neighborhood touch.

gn5vfWQa2hvAJM_E955mvA.review_text: I still got mad love for you, boo.

bP198nhgu4I_FvELyv1YrQ.review_text: The manager apologized for the Kelly Clarkson incident. I am impressed.

_RJmgk7psQZdnXv1h5eGnQ.review_text: The thing is... I really want to like Blackbird.  I think they do a good job with their menu and keep their drink options "fresh."  But in SF... the whole mixologist thing is EVERYWHERE, so what makes it stand out is the "rest" of the experience... and see, this is where I am always disappointed.  The bartenders are not the best when it comes to customer service... I almost always feel like I am "bothering" them when I order a drink.  Heaven forbid that I ask for a recommendation...  And don't every ask "what do you think of..." as that will almost always give you the most useless answer of "it's good"...  It is sad when a business gets lazy with its customer service just because it has a good location that makes it easy for people...  so make the trek. Go elsewhere. Pay the same price, if not better, and feel "welcome" rather than feeling like you are reliving the "It's very expensive!" you really shouldn't be shopping here "Pretty Woman" experience.

LKpd28drREu-cHwflED0TQ.review_text: Good beer menu, unique cocktail menu, good happy hour, dim, dark and classy joint. Pool table in the back.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Stopped by Blackbird on Saturday night around 8:30pm for a few pre-dinner cocktails and the place was packed! The bartenders did a great job of slinging drinks, smiling the entire time. I love the overall vibe of the bar - lots of room to sit, a pool table in the back, mixed crowd of straight, gay, not quite sure.  Specialty drinks will run you 8 bucks, a pretty good deal considering the quality ingredients and amount of time that goes into making each cocktail. Can't afford an $8 drink? PBR is only $2.50. Plus I hear they have a great happy hour. One major drawback - cash only. Plan accordingly!

V8dMN5_hlJtQAtHk8W0zvA.review_text: Decent atmosphere but can get somewhat noisy, then again, it's a bar.  Offers some pricy drinks considering that almost most bars around the area offer discounted drinks or 2for1 specials during happy hours. I usually stick to Coronas and they're never part of any specials or happy hours at any place.  Almost $6-8(including tip) for a Corona is not acceptable. So I guess I have to downgrade to domestic beer if I want to stick to a budget.  I have been to this place a few times during Happy Hours and saw no signs advertising their Happy Hours or their specials, I didn't notice any signs but a big blackboard menu listing well & fancy drinks, although some of them very tasty; I've ordered a few of them.  I would go to this place maybe a few times a year.  With $12 I can have 4 beers at Toad Hall, Badlands, or Midnight Sun and see just as many cute guys, besides, I do need the variety or would get bored if I always frequented the same place.  I only found out last night that they do offer Happy Hour Specials, only by asking, otherwise it's promoted and most people don't know about it.  Here's some quote:  "We do offer well cocktails with 1 liquor and 1 mixer=soda or fresh squeezed juice for $3.  We also offer for  Sours $4 made from scratch.  Tap Beers range from $3-4.50 depending on what you order.  House White $4 or Red $5.  Bud/Bud L $2."  I think you should definitely try this place for yourself and I think you'll like it.

CDZWiihsmtiP-cgBRSSljA.review_text: Hot Toddy with rye: 4-5 stars, especially on a chilly night.  Upscale décor and well-dressed clientele : 5 stars.  Almost getting donkey punched by a pool cue while sitting normally around the booth in the back: 2 stars.  Slightly overzealous dude trying to horn (as in horny) in to our party and a female in our group: 3 stars, expected behavior.  All in all, 4 stars, but I bet this is a 5 star place when it's slightly less busy. (we went on a Thursday night with a group of friends)

wfHb6cGSSweF6XZYXw1XQA.review_text: I am so happy to see a cocktail bar in the hood that is middle of the road.  Not Elixr. Not Cafe Du Nord.  Not Lucky 13.  Not a crappy dive bar.   Nice enough, but my friend made a comment that the crowd was a bit fag-haggy, which is fine and fun, but I like bars that are a bit more mixed crowd and I think this place is still so new it might still be defining itself.   My friend specifically wanted to go to happy hour, for happy hour prices, but the bartender charged full on non happy hour prices to her, which kind of makes me feel like they're not that on-point.

X26y9qVbuAf1DELM8QnaCA.review_text: A real favorite soured by a bad bartender.  This place is great and makes fantastic drinks, but stay away from Diane the bartender. She'll steal your money.   She shortchanged me and my friends on more than one occasion. I called her out on it and literally made her count my change, and sure enough, it was short. She pockets your cash, assuming you're some dumb drunk who isn't going to count their change. Call me cheap, but I do. I asked to speak to a manager about it, and another employee told me there was no manager - "they're all managers together." Which sounded like he was just covering his friend's behind.  Anyway, this place used to be a fave, but not anymore. Good ambiance and great cocktails, but watch your wallet!

Njr-4deTIXPvXfKHaXn_0A.review_text: I obviously need to go to Blackbird more often 'cuz apparently this is where all the civilized ppl hang out. While ordering my drink at the bar, I turned around to ask my friend a question and was instead met by a mini sea of patient, well-behaved patrons, which all made me pause. Uhh.. this is kinda weird. I'm used to ppl shoving their way up front, drunkenly spouting off about god knows what or being just plain obnoxious. Hmm, I could get used to this chill scene...  To make matters better, the bartender chick w/ specs was super friendly and took care of everyone who posted up at the bar. She even made me an off the menu drink that was pretty damn delicious. I also ordered up the La Flama Blanca (Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, Pineapple Juice, Cinnamon Syrup, Del MaGuey Vida Mezcal, Boston Chamomile Bittahs, all topped w/ fresh ground nutmeg) which was like a Red Hots themed cocktail. When it came time to snag one last drink, I finished off the night w/ a most delicious Bitter End (Rum, Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice, Lemon Juice, Maple Syrup, Swizzle Bitters & Egg White w/ a mint leaf garnish). Drinks are obviously their strength here.  Decor is modern & stylish, while still rockin' the down-to-earth vibe. The crowd also couldn't have been nicer... maybe that's just the fag hag in me talking, but hittin' up this gay bar was definitely fun.  TIPS: +Bring cash, cuz this is a cash-only bar. ATM is in the back in case you forget. +Be prepared for a short wait. I was surprised to find there was a bit of a line when I got there.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: delicious bar bites (smoked trout, olives, bourbon onion), solid drinks, and always a great mix if people. happy hours are a great deal for the area (especially the $5 sours, 5-6 vino). tricky with a group larger than 4 unless you get there at 5 p.m. but not impossible.

ARovTKw6IO9jfX9bw4OLXQ.review_text: Bit more expensive than I'd like to pay for drinks but well worth it. These bartenders are real bartenders, nothing like those half baked ones that make crap for drinks in clubs. Only place I want to go when I enter the Castro.

ymPziCT9HyrXKB6CD9lgxA.review_text: Set in the cool neck of the woods that is Castro, Blackbird is a cool bar that harbours a hipster and trendy ambience.   They serve great cocktails, have comfy couches and a pool table. The lighting is more than dim, quite dark actually but I like it. Blackbird is a place where you can catch up with mates or take a date for drinks although some might find the music a bit loud.  We had a good time and I'd definitely go back on my next visit to San Fran.

wWl7S1cDffZ2BoapjR6k5Q.review_text: Great local hangout, excellent craft cocktails, pool table.  More relaxed than the typical Castro bars down the street. Cash Only!

Lehu9ZVrCD1NovG0lQ6YhQ.review_text: This place is what I've been told is the perfecf gay/straight fusion bar.  I don't know about that but excellent drinks, nice atmosphere, I'm a fan!

WL8rVzLO-LaN7EaqDHnglQ.review_text: This place was SUCH a relief from the Lucky 13, which I hated. Fast and friendly service, strong drinks, cute decor.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: this bar is great. the decor captures that rustic reclaimed restoration hardware vibe. drink selections are plentiful and there's plenty of room to sit, stand, or lounge.  plus to the pool table in the back, though i didn't play.

_O7NFOcGXo3tA1gx1dxlEw.review_text: Love love love this place! It's fast becoming my go-to bar for after work drinks with friends. Super convenient location, cheap drinks (i.e. 2-3$ beers), happy hour til 8 every night, pool table, clean and nice decor but totally unpretentious... what more can you ask for?

b2cc1tFAlmWhy4Ceeq05KQ.review_text: A bar that serves thoughtful, artisan cocktails... in the Castro?   Yes, it's true! You CAN get a good drink in the Castro! Something more than well liquor slung with some nondescript mixer with a lime thrown in.   Blackbird's specialty cocktail menu is short a simple, and I hope that's the way it stays. We visited last night (a very busy Tuesday!) and sampled almost one of everything on the menu. All of them were good, but the aged bourbon drinks were a tad strong.   Everything was carefully crafted, tested and consistent.  And the prices are very, very reasonable. $8 for most cocktails, $10 for the aged bourbon ones. Mixed drinks are a reasonable size, but not as substantial as you might expect. (Think "sipping drinks" that you should imbibe slowly and as thoughtfully as they were created.)   Beer ran from $5 on up. This may sound expensive, but considering the quality of the drinks, it's really not. If you're looking to get toasted on cheap liquor, head somewhere else.   Along side Cantina, this may be my new favorite "fancy cocktail" bar in San Francisco!  Also note: Clean bathrooms, an eclectic mix of seemingly nice people, a charming and tastefully decorated space with plenty of places to sit, stand, lean and hang out. The crowd leans a little more toward hipster than I like, but it's still fairly mixed and friendly.   Be aware: They have electronic cash registers, but are cash only. There's an ATM in the back.

bb4iEXxiYRcnzXmUvbLRjg.review_text: *fancy fun drinks with a fun atmosphere* #oldfashionedcherry  I enjoyed this place for the drink it had. They had a unique twist on an old fashioned with a muddled cherry as opposed to a sugar cube. It was tasty, lively atmosphere with a nice pool table in the back with good seating all around. Will be sure to check out some other drinks when I'm in the area.   CASH ONLY!

J8ZjumpRAFqatUlxtX2L-w.review_text: I've been here a couple of times and the last time was on a Monday evening and I really enjoyed myself. It was quiet enough to enjoy a conversation with friends. The place gets pretty packed towards the end of the week however. Tried a Brazilian cocktail called a Batida and it was so delicious! It reminded me of a spiked eggnog yummy.. I noticed they change their drink menu which is a plus since I'm always on the hunt for new beers to try.

xM54EZxtxKehUN_YaWC7Rw.review_text: Awful cocktails. (Mojito was loaded with ice and bitter) Expensive cocktails.  Slow service (bar was nearly empty and tender tripping over himself) Couches are NOT comfy. They are stiff, the chairs are just as bad, the tables are rough and drinks tip...  CASH only.... no thank you.

5SU5vf9RzzN4hk3jEASFgg.review_text: Great service.  Good selection of draft beer- local and regional, and plenty of specialty cocktails. Ambiance is perfect and it never seems to get too crowded. Only problem- no credit cards are accepted although I hear they're changing that soon.

EDF0_BA4cZ-WCsU4R2AcJw.review_text: Great space. The drinks are really good. And, you cannot beat the $3 well drinks until 8pm.   I will for sure go back to this spot.

5iy8Dp1LYACWqjWXCaQI4Q.review_text: Atmosphere and service were great. The menu has very few gluten-free items; if you want gluten-free I would suggest calling ahead to see if the chef can accommodate you. I did not ask for a gluten-free menu because I thought the chicken and salad would be GF, but the salad had pre-mixed homemade croutons (menu didn't specify).

d1Rnf6a0qqP-C_2764FG1Q.review_text: Relaxed atmosphere, and some delicious cocktails. Last Word is my favorite so far. The bartenders are friendly. It can get crowded during the weekend, so go early to get a seat, or go on a weekday. Cash only, so be prepared.

SdjDKPsfCUIIwY_mZHZLog.review_text: Even though it's one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city, Blackbird has two personalities. During the day and happy hour, it's brightly lit, clean and open, and and quiet. It's a cocktail sanctuary where you go to sip on your favorite libation and relax. At night, the lights are dimmed and the atmosphere becomes boisterous. Dozens of people congregate around sipping their drinks, and it can feel crowded.  Nonetheless, the cocktails are consistent, inventive, and delicious. Bartenders are knowledgeable and polite. They can get busy later at night but they're very responsive in general.   During happy hour, there are drink specials such as $6 old-fashioneds and $6 margaritas, $6 du jour cocktails (which they had a choice of two the day I came in), and $4 wells. Beers are equally cheap.   So depending on what mood you're in, go in the early afternoon for a more chill experience or late at night for a livelier scene. There's a pool table in the back to take the edge off too. And enjoy your cocktail.

PauNerg-kHRpoqLwB6F5CQ.review_text: Good place with made-from-scratch cocktails. Prices are clearly posted, though not the happy hour specials, which bring them from steep down to excellent - $3 wells, $2-4 beer, etc.. Seating and pool table were nice. It does get pretty crowded and noisy though.

WjHUSPZM7qW7BW7MdMiXEA.review_text: Blackbird is one of the best bars in SF right now. Its relatively new ('09 is when it became the blackbird post a remodel and new ownership), and ever since its stock has risen while the Castro has gone kind of toe up in reputation among the younger crowd who wants to avoid badlands-esque joints.  First off, is Market and Church really the Castro? Blackbird goes beyond the typical Castro vibe. Its a neighborhood bar that is just that: a real bar, with real locals, and real drinks (although some are a bit too sugary for my taste). I think deep down we all wish that this 'neighborhood' was our actual lives... because the real bar is really awesome, the real locals are really hot, and the real drinks are really good.  The place feels like a dive bar that somehow caught on and became trendy and hip. The crowd is stylish and put together, but also laid back enough to have that after--venturecapitalist--work vibe.  Pool tables in the back are a nice touch. I love the walls plastered with SF history through newspapers, and the brown butcher drink menu done on paper rolls pulled down off the walls. Another great touch is the actual mild mix of straight guys and the dash of females that find themselves frequenting the spot of the summer. Other positives include a decently regulated door, a huge drink menu, fresh ingredients, friendly bartenders, and the occasional latenight tamale lady.   Don't know where to go tonight? Go check out Blackbird before everyone else in SF realizes how legit it is. Or they start charging cover. Or someone adds a dancefloor. Or they get rid of the pool tables for a Rupaul competition stage.   ...not that I don't like Rupaul competition stages...

XfUqQfe3fLQtujm7Yd36mw.review_text: Bartenders are super nice and their happy hour is great! (5-8 M-F) And for the fireball lovers they make their own fireball which was really good I might add.

64o6vJrByaGTStMvvU45JQ.review_text: Nuance. That is what makes the cocktails here spectacular. Every drink is a series of hints. A hint of cinnamon, a hint of rye, a hint of camomile, a hint of cacao. They manage to do this even though their drinks are basically 100% booze. Color me impressed.

jETefWw8QKwRvcg9mL4tkQ.review_text: Awesome happy hour!    Greyhounds with fresh grapefruit cool bar staff, and a chipotle bloody mary that rocks.

P2fXcmsU_vrs4zB2IfsHnQ.review_text: Chill little bar/lounge where you can hang with your crew and unwind. Tasty drinks. Pool table in the back. Sit back and have fun! By the way, when we went here, it was busy on a Monday!

VoMLcF-TPgNRMoNwmasqGw.review_text: Blackbird was amazing. The kind of bar you can always rely on to be decent.  More of a sophisticated gay crowd than a typical night in Castro.  Vintage decor, sweet bartenders, great crowd.

ZtYQRuOI9WTE8DSwb2eTWA.review_text: Great place to have an adult beverage....Great Bartenders, seasonal drink menu,   cool atmosphere....and just removed enough from the castro..  Nice crowd and no bridge and tunnel fork for the most part.

GQeNxreVlyp0ol-disR3SA.review_text: I stumbled upon Blackbird last night with two friends after working out across the street. We had unbelievably good drinks and the bartenders were super talented. The atmosphere is great and my friends and I happened to be sitting next to the owner, Sean and his sister Tiffany. We had great conversation, they were definitely the type of people you want to succeed. It made me like this place even more. I would highly recommend blackbird and I will definitely be going back with friends soon!

0GUD0q7aKzgSeNBeBDm6Pw.review_text: Great place. Great atmosphere, cool furniture/lighting, good drinks and not super expensive. Very attractive men too which is always a plus.

ETftGvDC7MVbN9pkPPSV2g.review_text: This is my favorite bar in the Castro, by leaps and bounds. The interior is nicely decoroated and has a much classier look than any of the other neighboorhood bars. The drinks are great, and the crowd is typically a lot of fun as well. Not to be missed!

disS5oye86976awyFa4Tsw.review_text: Nice cocktails and cool atmosphere, although it gets crazy busy. Try moving towards the back though and there's usually space. People gather near the door for some reason I'll never understand (just like on Muni!) so it looks like there's no room. I've been a few times and have enjoyed everything except the sauvignon blanc. But it's always a gamble with wine by the glass. Mmmm, sidecars.

o-3_mhYYUchimV_9bVdIoA.review_text: Walked by one afternoon, had the Rye N. Gosling, and also the Smoked Trout Jar Bar.  The drink was delicious with wonderful rye notes, slightly too sweet but completely fine.  I'm not sure where Blackbird gets their Bar Jars, but they're decently good and served with a few pieces of crunchy flatbread.  Pretty good for bar food.

uEAJf9YXnZJofVawOjEsCg.review_text: As someone who prefers to drink at restaurant and hotel bars,  I have to say Blackbird is my favorite social spot in SF, and not just because it's a most welcome haven in greater Castro where one can get an actual cocktail (and not just a mixed drink).  The second time I came in, there were gaggles of people at the  bar, but Brent not only remembered my drink of choice (at the time it was a Blood and Sand), but what type of scotch I take.  Since then I've started roosting there 2-3 times a week, often before flying south for dinner in the Mission.  What makes this bar unique is that it's a natural habitat for two very different species: those who want to grab a bottle of Miller High Life and shoot pool with their buddies, as well as those who prefer to discuss French symbolist poetry over a Death in the Afternoon.  In a town where birds of a feather tend to flock together, this is a refreshing change of scene.  A few things you should know about the aviary before you alight upon a stool:  - The crow bar is not a gay establishment.  Sure there's a fair share of coxcombs preening in the window on any given night, but it's not exactly La cage aux folles either.  The crowd is always mixed, and it's actually not a bad place to meet people.  - Right now the bar is CASH ONLY but there is an ATM available.  - The discerning ornithologist should know that if you don't ask for spirits by brand, they are going to pour WELL liquor, even in their specialty cocktails (and it's not the kind of place that has Bluecoat and Bulleit in their well, either).   I made that mistake my first time in the bar, then quoth this raven "Nevermore!"  - Take a gander at the menu, and you'll notice that just about everything is on the sweet side.   Even their version of the Negroni (generally a bitter drink) borders on cloying.  This is not to fault the bartenders in any way, since the clientele seem to like their drinks that way.  However, if you prefer your cocktails on the dry side, just ask.  You won't ruffle anyone's feathers.  And nothing says you have to order from the menu.  Most of the bartenders are happy to wing it if you tell them what you like.  - When it's busy, don't even think about ordering anything "up" unless you plan to perch at the long shelf adjacent to the front door.  Otherwise you will end up wearing most of your $10 Paloma cocktail.   - After a long day of work, TIffany is a regular Florence Nightingale, both for her barside manner and her uncanny ability to concoct potent elixirs to ease your every ill.  A welcome addition to the neighborhood, and a strong 4 and a half stars.  A little more variety on the menu (add one or two clean, balanced cocktails) and a better wine list (although, seriously... who comes for the wine?) would make it five.

OGo9eIwvAWYRzZoqZye2dQ.review_text: Yummy drinks, cute boys, good music, and super nice owner!!!

sS-5KDEwZu-uOZ65sx8WIw.review_text: Nice ambiance and selection of drinks. If you are looking for an interesting specialty drink, this is the place to go. Some of their drinks are really elaborate. My favorite.....the leather bound book. Deeeeelish!

FABFyv4yMCxVDbpzjG3jxg.review_text: First time at this week and a half old bar and I was wowed! Aside from the fact that it was a pool table, it's perfect for me.  Location: The best of locations, right on Church and Market and accessible to anyone and everyone using any means of transportation. And most importantly, walking distance for me.  Space: Beautiful, hip decor. I like the fact that they hide the pool table, because, seriously, pool tables at bars are unsightly. There's newspaper wallpaper, exposed lightbulbs, a beautiful bar, and red accents all throughout to illuminate the otherwise dark bar. I love the seating styles and the front of the bar, from the outside, looks pretty nice.  Ambiance: A good, diverse crowd. Everyone was friendly enough. There were a good amount of homos, lesbos, people of color, white folk, men, women, young, old (I'm not kidding) and specially, beautiful people--almost as if it were planned. I don't remember the music though...  Service: Great service! Specially Nancy, she was great. Attentive, fair with prices, took suggestions gracefully and knew her stuff. She made some great suggestions that worked out splendidly.  Food/Drink: Great drinks! Sure, specially because I know exactly how I live my cocktails and the bartenders followed my instructions quite diligently and put some great insight and suggestions of their own. We had a Manhattan, a Cosmopolitan and a Vesper. They have Lillet Blanc and actually use Cointreau for the cosmos! You can't ask for much more. And most importantly, it's cheap!  Overall: After a tragic experience at my favorite bar, Amber, this is probably heading to be my new favorite bar. Great service, great ambience, beautiful and well thought-out space and, most importantly, great drinks.

Ic6Y8b-kqo3XBj0nAwXDgA.review_text: Pretty cool/chill lounge.  I like their selection of beers and i was able to find parking easily. They also have a great cocktail menu. If i lived closer, this would def be one of my local chill spots to grab a drink!

-crp7RL0bHTXrxh1oH4XPw.review_text: Short 'n' sweet:  - Delicious drinks, and hilarious menu nomenclature - Friendly bartenders - Nice ambiance, without being pretentious - Good mix of gay and straight.  Attractive males a plus. - $9-13 for a nice cocktail -- which ain't cheap, but also isn't excessive for a well-made and well-presented drink in SF - Great garnishes -- smoked, brandied cherries; candied coconut; and a small victory garden's worth on their bloodies

Z7lXhse73rB_j525E8sj9Q.review_text: Out of the ashes of the old dive bar The Expansion, briefly reincarnated as The Metro, comes another new spot in the Castro's refreshening nightlife: Blackbird. The decor is deliberately rustic chic, which could easily have looked like a stodgy bar my Grandfather would have gone to without the elegant touches that makes this probably the best decor of any Castro gay bar (even beating Trigger in some respects).   I went once on a Monday evening, when it was pretty busy (on a Monday, no less!), and again on a Friday when it was jam packed. As other reviewers have mentioned, if you push past the knot of people in the front, there's a bit more space farther inside. It's a nice place to meet friends and visit, but also surprisingly easy to mingle despite the long bench and rows of chairs. Another excellent addition to the Castro.

HHxE5KTyi49QcaaOKvPw1g.review_text: This place is a beautifully lit sit-down bar with a relaxed attitude.  It is a good place to start a bar crawl or maybe meet someone you've been talking to online for the first-time.  It's the bar of firsts, if you well.  This is definitely one of my favorite bars in San Francisco.  Their mixed drinks are spectacular.  The bartenders won't rush and just throw your drink together because there are other people waiting.  They make sure that every drink is made perfectly - It's definitely quality over anything else.   This bar is always worth my time and my money.  Did someone say "Blackbird at 5?"  I am there!   Cheers :)

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: After dinner at Catch, we decided to grab a drink at Blackbird. 7x7 frequently runs advertisements and short reviews about the place- so we figured why not.  I love the interior of Blackbird. There's just something about the way it feels that appeals to me. Upscale bar meets speakeasy meets dive. It's a great mesh of feelings.  I don't dig that the place is cash only. I mean, really? Who carries cash these days? They do have an ATM machine in the back- which charges $2.50 for withdrawal.   Boyfriend ordered whiskey & coke- and I asked the bartender to surprise me with a tequilia-based drink. (I love me my tequila!) I'm not a huge fan of sweet, and told him so. I think he took that and ran with it- because the only thing I really ended up tasting in my drink was bitters. I had about two sips before I decided to give up on it.  The crowd is eclectic- but primarily gays and hipsters. I dug being out of my comfort zone and we met some great people at the table next to us.  I don't dig the height level of the tables- our knees were knocking in to them the whole time. It's kinda awkward seating.

b-xqG4qNFBmRA6KNvcM-aQ.review_text: Hands down the best bar in the Castro. If you're looking for a place that has great drinks, a beautiful interior, and isn't divey and full of creepers, then this is the place for you. Blackbird is my go-to place when I want to sit around and chat with friends, have people visiting from out of town, or if I'm going out to the bars and want to start off the evening in a dignified way.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: Did you know Blackbird has been around for 5 years?!? I didn't either until last weekend, when I received a special invite to attend a private anniversary party here. Have walked by numerous times, wondering what it was like inside, this was the perfect excuse to find out!  Barrel-aged cocktails were the focus last Sunday eve. Some were so special, they had been aged for years instead of months! Boy does that add some extra flavor to your drink. Not sure if I am a mature enough drinker to handle the oak and medicine-like flavors, but it's fun learning to appreciate. If you are a Negroni or Fernet fan, Blackbird's versions will hit the spot!  Not quite ready to dive into fancy cocktails that are a bit younger (like, straight from the tap), the Pilsner is quite good. And it's served in a giant mug. Can't go wrong with giant mugs ;)   A little chickadee (not a Blackbird but something like it), told me that these guys are going to make some updates to the joint later this year, perhaps incorporating bar bites into the menu... That would be fab! After a few good drinks, food must follow. Sing me a song when it's ready!

jm2FJcpGQffQj6zlDy5onA.review_text: My favorite g-bar in the city. Reminds me a lot of places in the East Village NYC, both in design, the overall vibe and the way people dress.
