The layout is definitely suboptimal - a lot of wasted space from the bar, backward toward the pool table area. Probably not something they can help, though.   Drinks are surprisingly well priced & taste good, though they have trouble making a couple non-traditional drinks (a french 75??).

MXsm4IfTA4tD0P8yhJiC9w.review_text: This review is in response to the ass hat bartender who recently made me rethink whether or not I want to continue living in this city or not. I came in around 8 on a weekday evening and ordered the only "cocktail" I drink; a tequila gimlet.  I'm not into the recent cocktail scene and keep my drink orders simple and minimal.  Anyway, the first bartender made my drink (which I order with a splash of soda) and it was great.  When I ordered my next drink the dickish bartender I spoke of earlier says to me "you mean a margarita" lol....I explained what I wanted again, this time telling him some bartenders use a bit of agave, but no, a tequila gimlet is NOT A MARGARITA. We exchanged words and he finally made me a drink that was not a gimlet but I drank anyways because I didn't want to deal with any more attitude.  This has actually happened to me a couple of other times, and I have recently clarified with bartenders elsewhere. I think the recent cocktail scene has confused people a bit. Cut it with the attitude....I don't bring it and a bartender certainly shouldn't. I gave the place 3 stars because I used to like it and the first bartender made a drink any bartender should know how to make and had no problem with me nicely telling her how to make it since this is a common problem I'm having....otherwise it would be 1. By the way, the only places that aren't confused by me ordering a tequila gimlet are bars that have old school bartenders and patrons that don't need a menu to order a drink!

MWuVbyBgP4vD24Rc7UH5xw.review_text: A really great new spot to see and be seen. If you go during the day it is very chill, but if you go on the weekend nights be prepared for a crowd, a very well dressed good looking crowd. The specialty drink menu is awesome there are some really yummy and posh little drinks on the menu. I LOVE the way they have all the garnishes fresh and actually zest the lemon or the twist right when they make the drink. It is a higher level for sure and makes a difference..  someone said it takes too long, but I appreciate the level of service even if you have to wait a little longer.   It is not a dance club ... more of a meet spot before the dance club..    If you want something extra special - make sure to look for TK, she is the STAR bartender and will make you something unforgettable!  Some people classify this as a gay bar and it's location near The Castro does mean there is a predominantly gay clientèle, but it really is actually quite a mix of gay/straight looking stylish and having fun.  I think my fave drink was the 1845, i think... i forgot, but you will recognize it from the menu.. so YUM...

3PsbKUWWqXTHcDFRxpU8-Q.review_text: I came in here once after a wedding and walked right back out -- I was clearly way too drunk for such a nice-looking place, and my friends and I tottered our way back up the street to Lime.  We should have stayed at Blackbird!   I was here in the evening the other day,  and I loved the ambiance here, especially the old newspaper on the walls.      I agree with what other people have said about the shaky small tables that have the uneven surfaces -- seems funny to put ridged tables where people want to set down their tiny, preciously mixed drinks.  The low tables and chairs also made me feel like I was at an elementary school parent-teacher conference, but it made it easy to have a good relaxing conversation with my drinking companions.    I guess I just am not sure about $6.50 for a  Dogfish IPA; seems a bit on the high side for a bar. I go out in the neighborhood all the time and feel like I don't pay more than $5 for a microbrew.  Maybe I do. And, as soon as I typed that, I realized that I'm personifying the cheap dyke stereotype, and that maybe it's okay for Blackbird not to be as cheap as, say, the Mix or the Lexington!

wjYtZFVzs2sIfwbUYb9EIA.review_text: I've always had good experiences here.  The bartenders work fast to deliver the requested drink(s).  Drinks can be a little pricey, but it's a better experience overall.  The bar is cool, the crowd is good looking, and they usually play cool music too.  It seems to be a gay bar, but straights can come here too and feel comfortable b/c there's usually a fair amount of women here.  They have a pool table in back, but I don't use it.  It's really not the place to play pool.

zE1yVFofeHQnxpGFonM6BA.review_text: Black Bird, you're cool, hip, tasty, friendly and cozy, we like you... but if you're closed on xmas night, put that on your website or on yelp! so that we dont have to end up in Lucky 13 (which is alright but nothing like BB)

JvNMi2Oh6o6SfcIsq73KNA.review_text: Lots of dudes. Dudes that like to stare, ogle, drool and snicker.   Pool table is a nice touch especially if you wanna bend over and offer your ass to the crowd. The photo booth is also useful to take a picture of your trophy or disgrace.   I'm giving it 4 starts because they offer tannat and malbec by the glass. Only place in the U.S. that I've ever seen that even offers tannat. The wine prices weren't outrageous so I can't really complain.

088SkMN7Hjn2vK2MEUfc3Q.review_text: I'd like this place more if it wasn't so damned crowded all the times.  I usually pass by this place when I'm wandering around the neighborhood at night.  The crowd is usually so big that I end up passing it by for Lucky 13 just down the street.  There's certainly a lot to like about this place though,  it's a great spot to play pool on a Sunday afternoon.  Friendly wait staff, cool interior, and great cocktails.

vi1Ta_3XtGTqkl4p83ZbEQ.review_text: 2nd time here and I officially love this place.  Cool environment, good music, decent crowd (not too Marina-ish, not too Mission hipster-ish).  Good strong drinks.  Only flaw was that the bartender was kinda an a-hole, but that's not going to deter me from coming back.  Oh, and bonus points for the pool table!

cie1b9elyL3Xd-aXLvi6DA.review_text: this bar was very cool. pretty fancy looking crowd and a welcomed change from my norm. drink selections were numerous and equally thirst satisfying. the fellas sitting next to us formed a critique line and assessed the shoes of all the women who walked through the door. entertainment to say the least.  be forewarned that  you should do about a 100 sit ups before coming into this part of town.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: I got nothing but LOVE for this place!  The whole bar has a great vibe and a good mix of people.  It's totally chill and very comfy.  I also love the fact that we showed up on a Sunday and still found the place popping!  =)

nPpPW1aWYSMGC62LHI7BUw.review_text: Lookin' good. With a happy hour till 8pm it's worth a look see.  I am a fan.

ZW1ILKt5sqk6yAS5C0YTqw.review_text: Super chill and hip ambiance. Relaxing music and yummy drinks. The mezcal sour was delicious. Only con is that the wait time is a bit long - but totally worth it!!!

sN6XqrVCINH-_fBbLiPleg.review_text: Who is the genius who decided to put uneven table surfaces in a cocktail bar? I've seen multiple people spill their drinks on these ridiculous tables just this week. The crowd here is painfully mainstream and reflective of the "new San Francisco." The cocktails are delicious.

m-q18lAVSe6rKVLCpmebSQ.review_text: What a great new addition to the neighborhood!   It looks kind of swanky, but it's filled with a friendly mix of locals. It features crafty cocktails and high-end beers, yet you can still grab a $3 can of Tecate. It's gay-friendly, but not a gay bar. It's straight-friendly but not a straight bar. It's stylish, but not intimidating. It's poppin' at night, but is perfect for happy hour...  Blackbird's got it juuuuuuuuuust right.  (21st Amendment Watermelon Wheat, FTW!)

ykV0Wn0SGQM9WD1do2lQww.review_text: Great place to get some delicious drinks and there is always a decent sized crowd.   I came here about a month ago with my boyfriend and I have just started trying different bars in San Francisco because I just turned 21. Out of all the places I tried I must say this is definitely one of the top places so far on my list. The drinks were delicious and unique. My drink had a bit of gin and cardamom which I thought was an odd mixture but turned out to be just great. Everyone was friendly and the place had a decent sized crowd, not too many people and not too little. I will definitely be coming back to this place. My only complaint is that they only accept cash which for me is extremely annoying.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Blackbird is definitely a cool bar but I'm surprised that it has 4.5 stars. 4.5 is hard to achieve!  I came in here with my brother and some other guys. A lot of the guys in the bar seemed to be gay which is fun and totally makes sense for the Castro. I loved the cool, cartoony artwork on the walls so much that I asked the bartender if they were for sale. They were but for well over $1000!  My brother picked out his favorite kind of alcohol (it's something I can't remember the name of, fruit flavored and yummy!) and the bartender created a delicious concoction with it. I later had a good well beer (great selection!).  The bar has a pretty classy interior with nice furniture to sit on. I'm not usually in this area but might drop back in sometime!

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: Sometimes you just need a stiff one...  ...you know, drinks...?   Blackbird is the place to go when you just want to chill, without being surrounded by pretentious douchebags. The bartenders are cool as ish and they are true mixologists, working away behind the bar in a scientific, focused fury.  The butcher-paper menu offers intriguing specialities with ingredients you won't find in your average bar. Normally I like to stick to my same drink, but I had to experiment here.  I really liked the cucumber-infused Pimms Cup. And the light and citrusy Early Bird satisfied my newfound fondness of St. Germain. My only gripe is that my Dark & Stormy should've been a well drink at their happy hour price - but here it was $8.   - Pool tables in the back.  - Narrow but spacious with a good amount of seating. - Not overly crowded, although I was here on a Monday night so I can't attest to the weekends. - Cash only.

tdW4c0jbSqSs94nMBGlJyA.review_text: Drinks are good here, selection of both beer and whiskey looks decent, and they have a nice little pool table in the back. The interior is nice, and it looks like a place I'd go to spend lots of money on alki. But it's cash-only, which severely limited me (2 rounds of drinks with 2 other friends); drinks are around $6-7 for beers and $9-10 for liquor, so remember to bring enough cash.

Htci6zJ3E_j6xyrbm5GgNA.review_text: What a great new neighborhood bar. The newspaper wall is AMAZING, excellent job on the renovation. Good wine, beer and cocktail list and kudos on the prices!!!!   I'm coming back tonight with friends!   This place puts all other bars to shame!

3g_J9N-qVsnDAoClvqXMmg.review_text: one of my new favorite bars of 2009!  good atmosphere, convenient neighborhood, and mixed crowd (aka no douchebags yet).  glad to see that the guys from the old Transfer are running this place.  the interior looks warm and comfortable.  i especially like the big metal table in front.    music's usually fine - sounds like someone's ipod - but good selection.  good selection of beers.

Jt_GERujHtgp65YYN2c9gg.review_text: We stumbled past this place while trying to remember where Lucky 13 was. Probably not fair to compare those two places (apples, meet oranges), but we're glad we found Blackbird.  Nice decor, friendly crowd and bartenders, interesting beer selection, music at just the right volume.  Could have done without the hipsters playing quarters (hipsters play quarters?) on the metal table, and the bathroom door could benefit from a lock. Maybe both of those are fixable.  Very happy to have found this place by accident.

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: Blackbird is an upscale neighborhood bar that's very popular on the weekends.  Though not so popular that you can't find room to sit/stand and have a drink comfortably.  The crowd kind of ebbs and flows as people bar hop in the Castro or get a bite to eat.  It's a Castro crowd, but being so close to Church St it's more a mix of hipster gay, hip gay, mission hipster, Noe single gal.  The cocktails are pretty good but hit or miss.  I found all the sour cocktails to be very pleasant.  Farmer's Daughter - very nice, sour lemon, not too sweet, refreshing  Ghost Ship - also very nice, green tea flavor, not too sweet  The Temptress - universally panned by the entire group of 6, taste was reminiscent of cough syrup, finished as a shot divided among two people as no one wanted to drink it but didn't want it to go to waste either  The Chieftain - overwhelming taste of smoke, like drinking a camp fire, not balanced out by other flavors  Where There's Smoke There's Fire - a light smoky flavor, not as intense as The Chieftain, followed by medium heat, interesting but not terribly satisfying  Given that I disliked many of the cocktails on the current menu, I'll probably wait for it to change before revisiting.

9BoeV_94ndKP7acWujXrTA.review_text: We wanted to grab a couple of drinks so we headed to Blackbird! The place was really crowded, had low lighting, pool table in the back, bar on the right side, seats and tables on the left side. The atmosphere was very chill.  I ordered the Blackbird Cobbler = "Graham's 10 Year Tawny Port, Graham's Frangelico, orange juice, and apple butter finished with orange zest served over crushed ice." It was sweet and tasty :). The bartenders don't slack off in making drinks.

7wUczg1-5F3JxkZoRxisqw.review_text: Really like this place and now I'm just a couple blocks away!   Great drinks, good vibes, nice bartenders. The downside is that it often takes awhile to get drinks since they have so many ingredients. They have a small but respectable beer list when I'm not feeling the liquor and great drinks when I am. I'm a sucker for perfectly clear cubed ice and unique bitters in my bourbon.  Cash only!

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: Nice to come back after so long away from Blackbird! Since I first came by in January, it's definitely gotten more crowded (though you can still push your way through the crowd and if you're paying attention, snag a table even at 10pm on a Saturday). The crowd is an interesting mixture of Mission/hipster and Castro. Still love the dark setting, old fashioned lightbulbs hanging by the wire over the bar, dark wood paneling, artistically cut/broken up wood board partial ceiling, and I really really like the tables that are essentially slabs of concrete that someone went to town at with a sledgehammer. The bartender was definitely a little abrupt - I said "I like something light and refreshi-" and he immediately said "Early Bird." I asked if they take card and he just said "Cash only" and stared at me. No chit chat, no smiles. In the end I really did like my drink, but he could've been a little friendlier. Shout-out to the cool dude checking IDs at the front - very chill, friendly, and I loved these awesome tattoos he had on his knees: one was the face of a lion/tiger, the other a dragon. Really unique and quite bad-ass. Cocktail menu: yelp.com/biz_photos/blac… * The Sumo Wrestler - 3.5 stars (Evan Williams Bourbon, Nigori Sake, Yuzu. $9) I watched the bartender make this and he adds  some sort of jam/marmalade to it! Really interesting. The flavor was very good, but bourbon always comes out too strong to me as a base. But for a bourbon drink this was quite good. * Early Bird - 4 stars (Vodka, St. Germain, Lemon, Soda. $8) Light and refreshing, nice tart taste, just what I asked for. Nice!

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: A 'lil on the pricey side but good bar to have a pretty relaxed evening -- usually a seat to grab if you hang around long enough.

ZkI1fU3sko0sY4yiVyDGsA.review_text: they have a decent happy hour and beautiful decor. they pasted old newspapers on the wall from WWII and the quake of '89. they also have a pool table and photo booth. this place does get really crowded during the evening time, so come early!

3A7H_v1ndcl26OZg9aWwWg.review_text: Very chill place with a mature, diverse crowd and excellent service. Great bartenders who take their craft seriously. I tip my hat to Chris who made two fantastic cocktails called Prospect Park and The Orchid. The only downside is that they are cash only but they do have an ATM in the bar.

XSCTp69qsTtQ-LYrS2bMOQ.review_text: Good cocktails, diverse crowd, and nice space... Too bad about the music

RsmzkgQ6S9ghtKb2DGX0Mw.review_text: A great place to catch up and get your drink on. Order the Early Bird, it's off the menu. Its lemony goodness that leads only to good decisions. It's a cash only place.

Dj77pkw_EZJvR-F4RIf_BQ.review_text: Excellent cocktails just a little pricey (hence the 4 star review.)  Great place for socializing, getting drunk (duh), playing pool and to take pictures in the little photo booth!  I really enjoyed the look and feel of this place. The ideas for the special cocktail menu on the board were great as well. But quality is what you pay for right? Come here and support your local gay bar.

A51KqJ7ZtwIZ8Q1bymiMaA.review_text: Damn.  I could drink their Pimm's Cup all day, errrday.

WU23fGTl7q6e_Lm0P7HitQ.review_text: i love this place!  the cocktails are tasty and interesting.  the bartenders are really nice and know their stuff.  whether you need a place to chill post-work or a good starter place for a long night on the weekend, this is the place to do that. it can get a teensy bit crowded on the weekends, but i rarely mind that since everybody's pretty chill there.

eZQC4Ng7NMKkOvBAdenbrw.review_text: I got to try Blackbird with my French Group recently and I had the best time.  The drinks are delicious and the atmosphere is nice.  I really enjoyed the cocktails their bar masters whipped up for us.  Cons: The bar was rather slow at getting the drinks out and it was VERY crowded.  Also, they were out of some of the food I wanted to order which I thought was odd at 7 PM on a Tuesday.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: This is a very cool bar - very chill, nice crowd. People seemed happy! I like the decor - modern and cozy at the same time. Lively, but not to loud to chat. And the ever-changing speciality drink menu is killer. I had the blackberry cobbler drink. Didn't have any blackberry in it, but the flavor was spot on. Really yummy!  Edit: Owner corrected me. It was a blackbird cobbler, not blackberry. Whoops!

V35nuFCTRIZdru0-WV1MFA.review_text: The pours have gotten better, but they really need sound reduction materials on their ceiling (like Chow has.)    I get some custom mix lemon drink that they have on their mixology list.  It was TERRIBLE.  It tasted like lemonade when lemonade is being vomited up.  (Lemonade + bile in one combined bitter flavor.)

Zw5mpE2onKKBRyW-mtNEVg.review_text: After 3ish years of living a block from Lucky 13, it's nice to have a new option.  Not that I don't love Lucky 13 for what it is, but Blackbird is EXACTLY what our neighborhood needs!    Reasonably priced expansive drink menu.  Nice, attentive bartenders.  Okay there's no popcorn but I sampled the pretzels and turns out they do the trick just fine.

2WAsZFmvYvhSUV20b-QwXw.review_text: Relaxed atmosphere, great cocktails, and friendly staff!  I couldn't have asked for a better place to drop in and have a great drink!  I wish we had something like this back home.

SpjonElsH5yuMJPgh9WaJw.review_text: Relaxed and fun-- bartenders were really friendly and nice. Had the Pim's cup as I am a sucker for anything cucumber flavored; seems to be the new trend taking over. Pool table and photo booth are available for any buzzed shenanigans as you feel inspired. Not sure if it would have the same charm if it were packed, but definitely mellow on a nice lazy Tuesday afternoon. Worth a return visit.

rl1sFgAD6Q7yiD6e3sjfQQ.review_text: BLACKBIRD ROCKS!   This is my first review on Yelp. I am doing it because I LOVE Blackbird and I had such a fantastic experience there. It's really refreshing to see a new Castro bar with such an amazing style. The interior design of the bar is modern and industrial -- I love the ambient lighting, the newspaper wallpaper, and the gray washed wood panels. The place looks really upscale but it's not intimidating. The crowd is friendly and mixed, not sleazy at all. There are gays, straights, and everyone seems to be having a good time. The bartenders were extremely nice and talented. I was surprised to find out the special cocktails were $8 and under. I had the Aviation and it was super tasty.  It is by far my favorite bar in San Francisco. There is no way it gets less than 5 stars. I'd recommend Blackbird to anyone that is visiting or a local looking to have a great evening out.

zH2SvkifEIWT9it4ZR_g6w.review_text: Went on a Tuesday night and there was a perfect amount of people to make it a great scene. Everyone is super friendly, specially the bartender Paul who recommended the Drifter and it was really really good.   Great ambiance and decor.   Only bummer is that is cash only so be prepared. There is a ATM in the back.

aK6jKRjd3MtwtAWIu5Fu9A.review_text: Loved this bar! I don't go out in this hood very often but I found this place to be a breath of fresh air. Busy but not too crowded, a nice mix of people, chill atmosphere where you can actually hear your friends talk. Good vibe overall.  If I lived closer, I'd be back regularly!

ZyCwpzTOGgi-Wbvxg7_svw.review_text: It's a really nice laid back bar that's a little away from all the Castro craziness. They had a bunch of interesting drinks and I had the hot toddy which felt like a warm cozy tea. The bartenders were very friendly and paid a lot of attention to the drink they were making and did not rush anything. I also tried the Manhattan which was a bit too strong for my taste, but for people who love strong drinks, it should be right up their alley.They also have quiet a few non alcoholic options - mocktails/sodas. Also, check out the pool table in the back. The only annoying part was it's cash only, so be ready for that.

xhMcbcg1aTS86f7AW56NyQ.review_text: I was at Blackbird on a Saturday night. There were twice as many people there as the occupancy limit.  No credit cards accepted. No lock on the bathroom door.   I'll pass.

1PcHHr_gyoPvlVmPL5xlag.review_text: This has become my bar of choice. Perhaps it's the mixed crowd. Perhaps it's the ambiance. Perhaps it's because Tiffany and Nancy make AMAZING drinks and treat me really really well. In fact all the bartenders are really great. It can get incredibly packed at times and deafeningly loud but I'd rather deal with that than go to any other bar in the Castro. At least I'd be in great company. They're good people here.

kKhE9CsizWb7PEEg301s9w.review_text: This is what i call the straight gay bar. Technically in the Castro, it's still pretty straight. It took until my 6th or 7th time going here to realize they had a cocktail menu, which, while nice, none of the drinks are really my cup of tea.  I like it because i can come here and have a few beers, play pool in the back (i love the fact that there's a change machine right next to the ATM), and hang out for a couple hours. It seems like a lot of people use this as a starter bar, because around 12:30 it starts to clear out and you're not fighting for a spot at the bar and you can find a seat more easily.  Anytime someone suggests meeting at a bar in the Castro, this is the one i prefer.

KU1jpjtvoIlzmKz5MZdZDw.review_text: Great place to go for happy hour with friends!  Great vibe, fun music, delicious cocktails. The bartenders were considerate and helpful. The bar is a little on the dark side after the sun goes down, but it's all good - that's what creates that interesting vibe!   Also it's 10 steps from the muni stop!

qVpl3pChUXCcXiUO-xX2mw.review_text: Consistently my favorite bar in the city.  $2 beers on tap during happy hour and amazing cocktails, which are a combination of fresh ingredients, well-chosen spirits.  What I love about this place is that their posted cocktail menu changes from time to time and it shows they're constantly trying to introduce new flavors to their customers.  My current drink of choice is the my clementine.  You won't have too much of a problem finding a seat on the weekdays, but a fair warning: weekends can get fairly packed with the Castro crowd (yours truly included).  A good mix of people show up here and there's always lots of eye candy.

Od1zEOj08vsRqVMoCNsFpA.review_text: This bar is amazing. I thank my lucky stars that I live on the same block so now I have a great place to get my drink on.

PaP0vVEKl1_gNHBp_8tqVw.review_text: If you want a beautifully mixed cocktail prepared with some great ingredients, this is your place! Delicious and very well attended! Come and enjoy something yummy!

pehdkxwE_uW-Bdf2ZxWsug.review_text: Love this place if you're planning on avoiding belligerent hot tranny and trashy messes.   The crowd here is great, goes from gay, to hipster and straight.   Their drinks and bartenders are both up to part. Barista that helped me last time recomended this great beer I really enjoyed...   Ambiance is hip and cool while being elegant and classy featuring plenty of seating and even pool tales!  This is a great place if you're on a date or simply looking to have a drink with a group of friends, chilling in the back red couch sipping on your cocktail.  Great place to hit on those rainy weekdays!

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: I'd like to start this review like Jake W. did , in theory I want to love this bar. The drink menu is awesome, those specialties dare I say look beautiful. Did I try any of them?NO. And you know why because when you wait close to 20 minute just to order, with really rude and equally miffed patrons with their elbows crammed into your spinal cord when you finally get waited on 1) I personally felt like an asshole asking a severely overwhelmed bartender to make me some intense specialty cocktail 2) that drink probably would tack on another 5-9 minutes to the equation. I know cause while waiting I took great interest in watching various drinks being made with care, and with no bullshit , they looked AMAZING. I hate words like mixology and foodies , but the people who work here are totally talented I could see. And I blame them not for this hellhole . I should have known starting with a line at the door, for a bar, on Market Street, a cartwheel away from Lucky 13? REALLY? The space is realllllly dimly lit. Maybe too dimly lit I have horrible eyesight and I'm aged. Some chick was screaming multiple times about doing meth /being on meth /offering people meth. I was not aware meth is the new social drug but apparently I'm wrong . I'm so out of touch at 32. You can't hear anything when you are trying to talk. The whole thing is just a NO, I won't be back. BUT shouts out to the bartender, brunette guy , tattoos , beard, not sure if you are team Penis or team Vagina but it was an absolute honor to salivate over your hotness for 25 minutes. When you furiously shook things to create alcoholic magic it touched me in an absolutely sacred place. I will dream about you ...forever. But goodbye Blackbird, fare thee well, peace in the middle east y'all

w1lHu6I_xLDKHMXc4Cv5ig.review_text: Really great cocktails and a good vibe.  This little place in the Castro has a pool table in the back, and to be honest, it's a little to bright in this area.  Other than that, I really like this spot.  It's been packed the few times I've been here, but the cocktails are worth it!

M7a-eJMUJGYeMkOlLMniMw.review_text: I'm always in search of perfect Manhattan.  I three top favs and Blackbird has it's Market Street Manhattan which is better than cashmere on winter night.  It's warm, smooth and tastes like a bit of heaven.  I feel very comfortable there a good mix of folks, not a pick up scene, just fun and friendly.    a good people watching place.

kHTpRKU5ulUdDy1Lg-RNHg.review_text: Blackbird is a nice bar/lounge in the Castro area to get deliciously strong drinks. They have a fully stocked bar with many specialty cocktails on the menu that will please a variety of palates--from sweeter citrusy drinks to more spirited cocktails. I ordered a drink with tequila in it and definitely got me in a nice, happy state veryyy quickly. Cheers for sure~  I came here for a friend's birthday and we managed to squeeze our group of 10+ people along the small tables in the back, despite not having a reservation. Even though the interior echoed really loudly, my friends and I enjoyed the atmosphere and would come back again for drinks in the area. I need to try the photobooth and/or play a game of pool next time!  In addition, the bathrooms are single rooms and actually kept pretty clean. This is always worth noting in bars. ;)

-IrubD2dfyl0CoQ_Y334yA.review_text: Glad to discover a new "good" bar in the Castro, and centrally located at that, within a short walk from the hub at the Church St. transit station.  Came here after a day of exploring the Academy of Sciences with friends from out of town and immediately felt good about my decision to go here (as exemplary of cool SF).  It's a nice bar, meaning well conceived design, with a bent of urbanity, but still very comfortable and friendly bar staff.  Does gay make everything better?  This could be case study number 1,000 concluding: yes!  Their bar snacks come from clean, monitored glass wear, empties are cleared promptly, the specialty drinks cross a gambit of classics re-envisioned (try the Blackbird special, like my fave, the French 75, but with a hint of elderflower), to the tried and true (a Bloody Mary with chipotle and a salad of accoutrements), and a decent wine selection to boot.  I felt like I was drinking a cool aunt's house, if she lived in a Dwell photoshoot, knew how to make contemporary comfortable, and had lots of well groomed friends around.  This place shoots to the top of my list when thirsty and looking to be seen.

_1WGIXCcDUSpfKNgwpgFVg.review_text: I was so stoked to walk into this place and find that it wasn't the crusty bar it used to be, It was all new and queer friendly and had amazing drinks!!!! A lil on the pricey side for bevies but, i would go here for happyhour  for sure!

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: i ventured away from my standard whiskeys, and indulged in martinis with the girls.  the bartenders know their stuff, and do up their mix drinks proper.   i love the old newspapers wall papered on the walls.

Z4Fkz0ET2vqvjr-Cijo9Tg.review_text: Do you love handmade drinks that are all sorts of yummy? Like, melt-in-your-mouth tastiness that is tested and perfected for your taste bud pleasures? Then, if you've not done so yet, you should check out Blackbird. There drinks are always top notch quality, and you'll enjoy sampling each and every one. They even have the drink menus change, so you can always try something new.   It could easily be a 5-star place, but there are only a few problems that I've always run into.   Now, everyone knows that when something is good, everyone will eventually find out about it and overwhelm it. Unfortunately, that's the case with this bar. The first is that this place is crazy busy all the time. 9 times out of 10, you'll find yourself waiting in line to get in. Sometimes it can be pretty fast, but you should be prepared to wait about 5 of 10 minutes. Once you get inside, you'll see that the place is packed and that you'll be waiting in line again for your drink. If you find something on the menu that sounds yummy, there's a definite chance that the wait will be worth it. Just be sure to watch those around you. You'll most likely run into people who will maybe jump in front of you. Just keep those elbows ready to push them back. :)  The second issue is that, every now-and-then, I run into a rude bartender. It seems that they have a bad day, or just don't completely understand good customer service. They either help everyone else around you without even glancing at you, or they help you but with a bad attitude.  I'd suggest visiting them, and perhaps trying it out a little early in the night to avoid the crazy mob scene.

Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ.review_text: They have a lifesize scroll of delightful cocktails. What's not to love?! ***a definite must get*** -Blackbird Toddy ($8) Rye, Earl Gray, Vanilla Bean, Molasses, Lemon, & Clove Other cool things: *happy hour from 5-8pm ($3 well & sours) *cool photo booth *awesome pool table *lovely red leather couches *open, airy, and artsy feel *ATM in the back *clean bathrooms *friendly bartenders Bottom line: Fun place to hang out with friends over delightful cocktails. yelp.com/biz_photos/Cs5D… Tips: ***CASH ONLY***

9OXGWy6UWCxZFCAlezlg3A.review_text: I'm not one to give a bar five stars but when you have happy hour till 8, an amazing beer (bottle and draft) selection and you serve Pimm's Cup and Bloody Marys you're gonna get it.   Beautiful decor. One TV to watch the games. One pool table. Plenty of room to socialize. Enjoy!

4ABOACN6e0SyOYN6oSsUZA.review_text: I really wanted to like this place, I had been excited to try it for months and even turned down watching niners vs raiders at tacolicious for a boring meal here. The servers were pushy it felt like and not friendly. I ordered a salad and was very disappointed! My boyfriend got the hotpot and was not impressed.   Im surprised the menu is similar to kitchen story bc I loved the food there (service was prob the same there also).  We didn't have a great time here, dont think id be back!

Us_9GNwgcfdCHN4bqgwxTg.review_text: It's pretty inside. The drinks are unique and provide material for conversation so that your time with your friends, or your date, or whoever, is slightly less awkward than it could be, but still somewhat awkward. You start at a long crowded bar and then you move to uncomfortable but attractive bench seating that leaves you hunched over . . . are those tables tree stumps? Is this a gay bar or a bunch of breeders who love a good cocktail? It's 1 a.m., Saturday night, time to go home.

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: Great place to chill with friends.  The bartenders take their time crafting amazing cocktails (great if you're looking for something special; not so much when you just want a simple vodka soda and the line moves at a snail's place).  The beer selection is pretty good as well.    Prefer to come either for happy hour or earlier in the evenings as later on, it gets jam-packed and you're literally shoving your way inside.  But in any case, it's an easygoing, laidback, diverse crowd.  Definitely one of the better places in the hood.

xylwQ6GudYdeyZDkz5CNkw.review_text: Delicious, inventive cocktails, but couldn't believe how packed it was on a Thursday night!! I can understand jostling and standing on a Friday or Saturday, but a three person deep line on a Thursday? Other than that, it seems like a classy joint and the prices are slightly less than you'd assume from the atmosphere.

aP9ItssHKgjX2UaddWfRrA.review_text: My new favorite bar.  Best bloody mary's in the city. Step back, Zietgeist.  Pool table. Great drinks. I'm hooked

PllRc-cr3BvFTajvca_3CA.review_text: So it's no secret I'm a big drinker. All the booze, all the time. And I like that Blackbird supports that. No judging, no sneers, just good ol' fashioned liquor served with a smile.   Blackbird makes my top 5 favorite bars in SF. Chipotle or Bourbon Bloody Mary, duh. It brings all my dead brain cells to the yard.   Their happy hour is a 3 hour fun fest from 5 to 8 every weekday where you can pop in after work, calm your nerves and enjoy the good feelin' vibes. There is always a nice mix of people and this place is a hop, skip and a jump from the muni station.   You're sensational. Blackbird. Keep up the awesome work.

KClJ6FCnUaISMpu5VVaY_Q.review_text: hip Gay/Straight bar, cool drinks, beautiful crowd, lousy service  Love the scene and the drinks once they're actually served.  I usually go mid-week and it's busy but not too crowded.  The bar service is PAINFULLY slow and inattentive however I keep coming back for the great crowd and cool aesthetics.

WjCz9whSc4mP8e5MNI8CVA.review_text: Deducting one star because cash only.  Lucky enough to get seats at the bar. Regina was a friendly and informative bartender. Fun to watch her make creative drinks. WE really enjoyed our drinks and the atmosphere. Agree with Tiffany that Blackbird captures the understated vibe of SF.

Wlb-k9jXifJHotEhiAcRRg.review_text: I emailed the owner to see if I could reserve a small space within the bar that I could use for a surprise birthday party.  The owner was incredibly generous and gracious in allowing us to hold the party there.  We were able to set up with balloons and provide a cake earlier in the day (which they stored until later that evening).  During the party, the staff was very attentive and helpful.  I had only been to Blackbird once before and the group I was with had never been before but we will all likely become frequenters of Blackbird due to the exceptional staff, atmosphere, and blended crowd.

plusOK-BrTWdz2-OPyzXOA.review_text: I love this bar!!!! This place is great!!! Love the ambiance, drinks, photo booth etc. Great crowd throughout the week though a little crowded on Sat. The drinks are awesome especially the Early Bird drink with elderflower. I strongly recommend this place if you are looking for a laid back bar without all the attitude that you tend to find at other bars.

iJnkBIRcRVbLBgtd2IWXOg.review_text: What a great place to get a drink. The crowd is mixed and the drinks are tasty. Lots of fun.

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: Such a great, cozy and friendly bar. We celebrated a friend's birthday here up at the front table and the overall vibe was exactly what we all wanted: an eclectic, SF-locals crowd, bustling energy and... the bar? Such LOVELY (and talented) bartenders. All so nice and they actually make eye contact during busy times, just to give that you extra confidence knowing they'll get to you when they can (I really like bars that do that- and it is a team effort). I order the orchard here and it's just delicious. Thanks Blackbird - you're the bees knees.

vy-DcE2Zbj9ljNCLY-hN_A.review_text: It's a loud bar ( music waaaay turned up) This is not a place to have a conversation or a date. The tables are also uncomfortable to sit at because they are low and have a cool yet non functional surface that doesn't even make your drink sit properly and leaves a mark on your arm. On the flip side the drinks are fabulous. Cash only bar. Good service. Try to hang near the bar. It's less loud and easier to grab a drink.

77Mw1khD6YE-9NNCNRcDVQ.review_text: Come on...Im not even gay and this place gets 5 stars from me.   The crowds seem cool...no rowdiness in sight.  I love the staff here.  Friendly and attentive, especially for how busy this place gets.  The decor and San Franciscan feel is just right.  I like the music volume because I can actually hold a conversation there without losing my voice.  I wish there was a Blackbird in the South bay.  Good times.

5cy9j1inSJyPVqHTQ4CxgQ.review_text: I love this place....  Such an awesome upgrade from Metro or whatever it was before.  I love the cheesy plastic tree tables.  They will keep you on your toes!  I wish this place took credit cards because I never have cash :(...  Rad.

x9_Hh1Y6DvoibgUBIvjO4g.review_text: This bar was packed on Saturday night. It was hot and stuffy inside, however, I liked the crowd. I will be sure to try this place again...when I am not wearing a sweater and sweating like a mad man.

baSDvZweZk6qLY_kHPvYzQ.review_text: They have wonderful mixed drinks! Some of the best I've had! I tried the Poached Pear and Pimms Cup. Both delicious!!!!! Those and many more for $8 each!!!! Poached pear is more tart due to the red wine. & Pimms cup is there to satisfy your sweet tooth! Just watching the bartender crush the strawberry will make you salivate! With alcohol that tastes like candy better pace yourself or have a barf bag ready in the car!!!

cLCgfdddwOytglbRh5ulrA.review_text: Best bar in SF... Mixed crowd which is a huge plus... and Nancy the bartender is not only a hot little item..she is the SH%$.... So nice and took time to introduce herself... Making of a TRUE mixologist!    As for one of the reviews below... Just because its not in your GAY neighborhood and isn't GAY enough for you doesn't mean its a bad bar.... If you have issues with labels take it up with a therapist and stay off Yelp.

xT3GqwqDXm5xNaPhXQksjA.review_text: i've noticed during the times that i go here... every bartender would give you a different type of glass but with the same drink. HMMMMM... am i the only one who notices the difference? :P

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: Great ingredients don't make themselves into great cocktails.  The bartenders here don't have the level of skill that the high prices demand.  The drinks are ok but don't hold up to standards of modern mixology.  Also, the tables here have a naturally uneven surfaces... that is just silly, I want to set down my drink without it spilling all over, silly.

2t_dWhdm_ZDiseqtfv-p0w.review_text: So I write this review in disappointment.  I had been here one evening while waiting on some friends before dinner. The cocktail I had was excellent and service was friendly and polite. However I am writing this review as I feel like I have been ignored several times during a busy night. I've done everything in the bar etiquette book in hopes of ordering a drink without being an annoyance to the bartender. I was right on the bar between two seated patrons.  I waited a solid 30 minutes without even a look while the area in front of  him was getting served like crazy.  I had already tried earlier in the night with the same bartender but I was behind someone for about 15 minutes before he gave up so I gave up too.  Yet strangely my friend who was dressed slightly nicer than me walked up and was able to order our drinks with no issues.  He didn't wave money or yell the guy just noticed him.   The bottom line was I liked this bar at one time but this second adventure put a bad taste in my mouth enough to write this review.  I was disappointed because I really wanted to try his drinks and enjoy them because I liked the care he put into everyone.  But it's just hard to enjoy anything when one feels ignored.  As a follow up I was written to and received a very sincere apology regarding my experience.  I am always impressed by this and look forward to giving Blackbird another try.

E7WMICjynmjYzuLHBGbYQg.review_text: Decent cocktails and everything is hand made, classic old style cocktail menu with a modern twist. Packed on Saturday with a hipster crowd, the bartenders though act like they are making you a big favor and it's really slow so probably my second choice.

UC9i2YIaD9qwVXJ1obAmZw.review_text: One of the better places at Castro. Great cocktails. Wish the space was bigger though ...

75L05wQf1yXs3ypoQO-iRw.review_text: Best bar in the city hands down!! Every drink is made with unadulterated passion!

LA1XsiFjyxkgeGcpkrSYxw.review_text: cool decor with elements of beach house, modern, and old school bar.  A group of us went during Friday happy hour. The environment was fun and buzzing with lots of people.    They have good HH prices and hours.  The cocktails were very tasty and fresh.  However, the time-consuming cocktail making & the large amount of people coming in made getting drinks after 6 a long process.  Get there early if you can.

szhitaiKPsjC15bveyXRzA.review_text: This place would get an extra star if they took credit cards -- it would not be bad if the drinks were inexpensive but at $10 and up a drink it's hard to buy a round for your friends.   Otherwise it's a cool atmosphere nice mixed crowd but not too many locals.   The cocktails are solid -- great beer selection and nice toons playing.

EWEcxo7NVPpTqzFbNny70g.review_text: Love this place.  Great space, great crowd.  A welcomed addition and alternative in the Castro.

8FfjI-7L7lXYYL19mwV9IQ.review_text: In a word, FINALLY. This is the modern, hip-but-not-tacky, friendly, neighborhood bar many of us in this neighborhood have been waiting for.   I've been more than once now and the experience was consistently fun, relaxed, and happily just down the street from where I live. For a new bar, Blackbird offers very reasonable prices and decent pours from bartenders dedicated to making sure you have a nice time. Extra kudos for ample seating, decent music, and lighting that hits you and the decor in all the right places.   Not just a hit, a home run. Hope they'll take card soon so I can do some real drinking there.

yXtStKz2c9LVLPd1_LgjsA.review_text: Been here a couple times and they have amazing tasty drinks!  I would suggest coming here on a Thursday night instead of Friday since its not overly crowded.  Unless you don't mind bumping up to a few handsome men.  My favorite drink there so far is The Drifter which has white rye, aperol, maple syrup, lemon and egg white.  I'm not even sure what half those things are but together, its damn tasty.  The bartender was shaking the mixer like a Moroccan dancer.  So fun!

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: $5 yummy sours during happy hour (til 8pm!), I'm so down. And their actual cocktail menu is like UHHH HOW DO I CHOOSE?!?! Everything is so yummy. And strong.  The place is really nice, with lots of seating and we were even able to snag some lounge space in the back on a Wednesday night. Great chill start to the night. Yes, my weekends start on Wednesdays.

sERgsnGaro7FIfgBfJxuVw.review_text: I really do like the thought of this bar. The Castro really needs more places like this to mix things up a bit. It's interior is very cool and modern, the clientele is pretty, the bartenders are great (a few from the Transfer, which used to be my ultimate fav before it was taken over by the gross BOC), there's a photo booth and pool table which are both necessary bar things, in my opinion...yet there's something about this place that makes me never want to go there.   I can hardly ever hear the music it's so low, the table between the benches is too big so you can never hear the people sitting in the chairs across from you, it's a little pricey for happy hour, although I realize it's hard to compete with Castro insanity prices, and even though I enjoy the cool, sometimes the people there are just too cool for me.  It's possible this place just might not be the bar for me because I go to bars to 1. talk to my friends, 2. listen to music, and 3. relax. It's also possible I need a hearing aid and shouldn't go here expecting it to fulfill my dive-y needs. Blackbird to me is like Indian food, I really love it once in a while but unlike a cheeseburger, I just can't have it every day.

93US8kZMnVSVziX2Oe7y1g.review_text: Now this is my kind of bar. I wish it could be a bit more gay, but there's nothing I can do to control that.  Part of me wants to give this place low ratings, so it'll keep the douche bags (that go to Trigger) away, but that would be too selfish.  Friendly staff, cheap drinks, cold pint glasses for beer and delicious cocktails.   Now if they could only start taking credit cards!

x2-TP8fd4G0OqkgDyKt3IA.review_text: Great atmosphere, awesome bartenders and deelicious cocktails!!  Secret Handshake - Germain-Robin Brandy, Averna, Orange-Pomegranate Reduction. Does the job, but still a little strong for my taste preference.   Tiger Tail - Brugal Anejo Rum, Apricot Liqueur, Pineapple, Lime, Agave, Tiki Bitters, Ginger Beer. My favorite cocktail of the night, perfect amount of sweetness with the perfect kick of alcohol.

4Po_4vgdBFk2GPeKfJqVww.review_text: I was supposed to meet a friend at the Residence around the corner.  When I walked in at 6:30 it was EMPTY and it smelled like feet that had been playing soccer sockless and then had been walking in a compost pail...ie: like sweaty death.  Blech!  So, I tiptoe'd out luckily to find Blackbird.  Great space.  NOT STINKY...a very good trait for a bar.  I like their beer selection on tap...not the typical stuff...the bartender recommended the Napa Smith Pale and it was yummm.  I'm also a sucker for any bar with a menu on a chalkboard and a gay softball team celebrating!  Good times!

OcUC2eFhJJK9mG6K4abmXA.review_text: Very nice spot with ample seating, which is so necessary for a good bar. The bartender was really nice and remembered what I was drinking, which was totally impressive since it was a pretty packed Saturday night. This could be because I was one of like eight women in the entire bar, but it could also be because she's awesome like that.  CASH ONLY, though, so be prepared to empty your wallet on some tasty cocktails.

__8GaZVjxvWHm1Hip5dH8w.review_text: The drinks here are bomb!  Their specialty cocktails are some of the best drinks I've had.  The bartenders are also consistent with them which is a plus.  This is a great place to bring a date and chat it up with some good drinks.  It does get pretty crazy from what I saw the few times I've been, so expect to stand at peak hours.  If I want drinks, I usually think of this place.  Too bad I do not live in SF, but if there's a chance, I'd come here.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Why haven't I been here before? It's a cute little bar with potent, delicious cocktails. Not just tasty, but also interesting...I definitely want to come back and try more. So far, The Tourniquet, was the one we tried last night and it was very very good....my friend- the cocktail expert, said it was the best drink she'd had in a long time!

pYnOLcg4-cgQjSLUiaSg4Q.review_text: I've found my new favorite bar in the Castro. I went for the first time the other day and I absolutely loved it : ) They seemed to have a good collection of beer on tap and in bottles.  I wish I could have tried something from their cocktail menu but I was on a beer kick.   The atmosphere was very modern with great music and good looking people. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was pretty loud and a little crowded but I don't mind, I still love the bar. Will definitely be coming here again soon!

Frxn4KN4hw2m4fL3Ud0OPw.review_text: I've been to this bar twice and have enjoyed my time here. It's been super packed...almost unbearable, but what bar in the Castro is not on a weekend night?   The drinks were good and the staff was friendly. I like the little photo booth in the back. The decor is interesting. It reminds me of something from Chicago or New York - almost like a loft feel.   Definitely worth checking out!  Enjoy!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: A sign of a good bar when it's happy hour but they are at capacity at 5.45pm on a Friday. And it's not like they are giving away drinks or anything. Blackbird is just honest to goodness a great bar with a relaxed yet refined experience with mighty tasty drinks to boot!   But back to that whole capacity thing. I had the day off and made it to the bar around 4ish but did the rest of the folks make a beeline straight from work to the Castro, knocking aside anyone who stood in their way of getting after work libations?   I wouldn't be the surprised because the bartenders take their time to make the delicious cocktails. "My Clementine" was a delicious citrus concoction with a subtle hint of honey that masks quite a bit of clementine vodka. Beer drinkers have no fear for they have a fantastic list of brews on tap ranging from Alaskan Amber to the ever delicious Brother Thelonius. Beers during happy hour run you between $3-5.   Much to love about Blackbird. I love the place, the people, and I definitely love the drinks. Must stop in if you're in the neighborhood. Unless of course if they are at capacity.

0CqAmHUSWPEQdrnCbDiaVA.review_text: Went here with a couple of friends last night.  They have an interesting list of specialty drinks.  It should be noted first and foremost that the place is cash only.    The ambiance is relaxed and classy.  They have a pool table in the back, a long cushioned bench, short tables, chairs, and standing room.  Like most bars, it's pretty loud inside, which can make it hard to hear if you're sitting across the table from someone.    I guess the only other thing to note is that, since it's in the Castro, it should be no surprise that it is a predominantly gay bar.  My friends said the number of girls there last night was abnormal for the place.  In any case, probably worth noting if you're looking or not looking for that kind of scene.

BYQNUm_Mzomjz7vC9AmmJA.review_text: Went on a Wednesday night thinking it would not be to crowded. It was. But, it was great and in the end we got a bank of seats along the wall. Seriously well crafted drinks in a good range of prices. I had a drink not on the menu after asking the bar tender for a recommendation based on my alcohol choice. He came back at me with the best bourbon drink in the city, hands down. And, no attitude, despite the fact that he was slammed. It's one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city and I can't wait to go back.

56I-v3n1u94MysqbPmhyNA.review_text: I'm really enjoying BB. It's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Castro to give you a down home neighborhood feel with a terrific drink menu, and great beers on tap. One of my favorite new places for happy hour, and a super diverse crowed for Castro. It's a refreshing addition to the neighborhood for sure! A great local hang out spot. It's crowed and often, but it's a small place so it's not too hard to fill up, but worth it.

WYCv0Q-QIKCSIo8IqOLOfw.review_text: We had a large party and they were awesome enough to accomodate our party as well as let us bring food into the bar! WOW.. You won me over right there. The next one.. Their drinks are simply amazing! OMFG.. Their Poached Peach was awesome, but it's PIMM'S CUP FTMFW! Strawberries and cucumbers?? 'nuff said! I need a few glasses of Pimm's Cup right NOW!

OCkcU3Kaf0C56ezeuDsrJQ.review_text: Among the best cocktails I've had. The bartenders are friendly and the atmosphere is great. Tip well!

yLvf0yd6gapMjWdNFVg6Gw.review_text: I loved the ambiance of this place, but their drink menu has some really peculiar options.  Namely, the pressure drop... My friend accurately described it as, "It tastes like a band-aid!"  No way, I thought to myself... So I adventurously took a sip, and sure enough... it really did taste like a band-aid!  I will say the uber cool, and incredibly tense bartender who originally made this for us was great about swapping it out for the Rosemary fix which was so much better.  The Apple Cart was ok, but reminded me that I probably shouldn't be so adventurous with alcohol if I don' t know half the ingredients.  So the next drink , he made a great libation out of rum for me... no idea what was in it, but it was really tasty!  So A for ambiance, B- for drink menu, A for super intense but talented bartender, and A+ for being a group of cute girls in a gay bar where you don't get harassed by Creepy McCreepsters!

Si1pFVlEYocwJIEbhuj9yw.review_text: This is my new favorite bar in SF. The space is beautiful, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the drinks are unique and the patrons are a perfect blend of personalities and styles. There's a pool table in the back but to my surprise, on a Friday night no one was playing. I can't wait to bring my friends here! Don't forget to bring cash, no credit cards accepted.

PODRIoHyAiybFWUMWaTYyQ.review_text: Good drinks, but a distracted bartender who kept servicing other customers before us despite waiting right in her line of vision.    This basically sums up my experience here.  Nice atmosphere and everything, but I really disliked my bartender, paid us no attention at all.  It wouldn't be that bad, except that drinks orders take up to 15mins per customer.  Ended up waiting here 30 mins before she even started taking our orders.  I only got to try one drink as the service here really discourages me from coming back for more.

8nWeL26IEhG3x_SGywhJgQ.review_text: great, exciting drink menu! lots of thought, fun, and love put into it. its hipster swank. I'm into it. I loves me bars, the only thing is : bring cash! no cards...they have an ATM, just giving the heads' up.

I-0Be1dHEacp293TeRUDpw.review_text: Nice bar, great drinks, good looking folks, but terribly loud.   Great place to have a good cocktail and "chat" with friends you see often. If you're planning on meeting someone you haven't seen in a while or someone you have lots of catching up to do, save Blackbird for another time.

tr7pF3HZd3as4XZcWyXzFQ.review_text: I have been back to Blackbird many times and the experience has generally been very good since my first visit. Not all the cocktails are a hit but they get an "A" for at least being inventive. However I was there last Friday and it was busy as usual but I was ignored by the bartenders as they proceeded to serve people from a certain ethnicity first. After twenty minutes of waiting I just left the bar in frustration. I probably will not be back.

zH_MaYBOFARFfGC_7DTa_A.review_text: Best bunch of bartenders in all SF. My friend and I are regulars there because of the awesome service and friendly attitude Marcus, Sean K., and Sean R (among others) give us. Will always be my favorite bar because of them. Keep up the awesome work!

dXhOCYxobqN7E56c4LM1Aw.review_text: Yelp describes 3 stars as "A-OK," but my reaction to Blackbird is really more of the 2-star "meh."  My Bullfighter was okay, but really with the salted rim? This drink isn't a margarita with a need to offset a tart flavor, so the salt really threw me for the wrong kind of loop.  Bartenders were nice and quick, though, and despite winning the ice jackpot, my fianceé's Pimm's Cup was decent-tasting.  I'd go back, but no rush.

pCPTv0e8nfBM1lQF8ZrLZg.review_text: Absolutely loved this place, came here after dinner with my fiancé and had a great time! The drinks are amazing, good vibe, nice people and awesome decor. I don't rate too many bars but this one so far has been my favorite out of all of the ones we have tried in SF.

uNIyxmljF0IVuVEifJNQ6g.review_text: After a tough day at the office, sometimes you just need a stuff cocktail with a buddy to take the edge off.  I pinged a pal and we decided to meet up at Blackbird's by his apartment for some happy hour.  They've got a bunch of specialty cocktails that are definitely on the pricier side, but instead I looked toward the happy hour well specials.  I ordered a whiskey sour which our bartender made with fresh juice, which was very welcomed.  The cocktail was nice and refreshing and had the perfect combination of flavors to provide some relief.  I like the scene at this bar and the mixed style of seating from front to back.  Our bartender was friendly and quick, but was easily distracted while talking to some of the other guys at the bar.  I like that its right next to the train station though so it's easy to get home after a few drinks.  I'll be back for more happy hour soon!  Food: n/a  Service: 8/10  Price: $$  Atmosphere: 8/10

Q_-6GtYQvPyIDJafbnNa4g.review_text: Excellent cocktails, good beer list, and fantastic atmosphere.  I really enjoy coming to Blackbird and bringing out of town friends in for a drink.  It's fun people watching and I don't find it too terribly expensive.  I was a huge fan of their Pimm's Cup over the summer.  This winter, I have been in a beer mood and have found good options on tap and in the bottle.  Good people watching too.

PsnHLCh-E7Gbe_EVifv0dQ.review_text: I just went to the opening this weekend and thought the place looked really, really great! It's got a great decor inside and the color schemes are nice! The bartenders are really nice and the doorman is super cool!  Michael M--you need to cut back on your alcohol, cuz you just reviewed the WRONG bar--the Expansion is a different bar!!!!!  The owner was totally working it too! He's way cool! I'd def be going back more often and the it's a nice touch to the Upper Market Area!

TwVymNZEWbkrTiZ75QEi8w.review_text: Blackbirds usually build their nests in sensible places like hedges and trees, but on occasions they can create their "des res" in the most unusual places.

5TY_Nb_e5criDA0yfhW6TQ.review_text: Clever space, clever place. Having a knowledgeable bartender sure makes for a wonderful experience. Very chill late afternoon crowd, and a great way to stay out of the rain. Trust your barkeep and enjoy!

Tx_KYhIxhQsVU1_xJWXbfw.review_text: In a city where bars are almost as ubiquitous as air, it's refreshing to discover a unique place like Blackbird.   Straddling the line between casual and sophisticated, Blackbird is a place where everyone can feel comfortable. And more importantly, enjoy well-crafted cocktails and microbrew beers.   Much has been said of the specialty cocktails, and with good reason. They are really good! The hand-drawn menu recalls a time of yesteryear, as do some of the exotic ingredients. Who even knew there was such a thing as "tobacco bitters?!" The bartenders are all knowledgeable, friendly, and highly-skilled in the art of mixology.   The daily happy hour is amazing, and a great introduction to the Blackbird scene, though at times incredibly crowded; something to keep in mind if you're looking for a quiet place to relax after work.   Another nice touch is the revolving artwork by local artists, which usually incorporates some sort of San Francisco imagery.   Attractive on multiple levels, Blackbird draws a very mixed crowd, though its proximity to the Castro generally means that the gay crowd is well-represented. But this is almost always balanced by the presence of plenty of other gay-friendly folk, all enjoying the warm, welcoming enclave that is Blackbird.

xEc6S6ZTbFeNekKgWTZP9A.review_text: I'm usually more of a dive bar type of gal, but I did like this place.  The drinks were strong, the cocktails were high quality, the bartenders were really nice (at least to me..hehehe), and the ambiance was nice without being pretentious.  It's a truly mixed crowd - we saw some hipsters, some yuppie types, even an old man with a dog collar (seriously).  I recommend the Dutch Courage - it was my favorite cocktail there.

yJBzJf6y5FM409Zm1RcgjQ.review_text: I've always been intrigued by this bar, only knowing of it from its newspaper ads featuring a top-hatted, Dickensian-looking, large-beaked bird with black, soulless eyes. Though I knew from its Castro location that it would not live up to the standards implied by its logo, Lady Pestlebottom and I happened to be wandering by and decided to stop in for a drink. It's not often we're in the Castro, you know. For good reason - the crushing and overwhelming modernity of it all.   It was not as terribly obnoxious as most Castro watering holes, but I found the decor uninspiring, the patrons bland and without style or character, and the overall atmosphere loud and busy, yet boring. The last time I had patronized this particular space was when it was somewhat of a sports-oriented dive (albeit a clean sort of dive). The place is completely unrecognizable now. It's terribly, horrifyingly "hip," as many here have pointed out.   The beer selection consisted mostly of craft beers which I've never heard of (so hip!), so I decided to be adventurous and try the one named after moving-picture actress Tallulah Bankhead. It was adequate. Lady Pestlebottom ordered some overpriced, fruity libation which she enjoyed, which she now conspires to make at home (just as I did with the delicious and even more overpriced cocktail at the even more nauseatingly hip Bourbon & Branch).   The barmaid was very nice, so that's something. It was an alright place to stop in for one drink, but we do not feel compelled to return.

lnDP_h7cGYS3yzjkoCbtwA.review_text: Despite how crowded it can get on weekends or the fact that they don't take plastic like other 21st century establishments, I LOVE Blackbird! It's my favorite bar in the Castro overall. They do Moscow Mule and Dark & Stormy better than anywhere around!

Gh-g5zvP4i6tQKrMJZzfCw.review_text: Had a really great crafted cocktail yesterday. It was early and I knew the bartender would have time to give my drink love....a gin gimlet with Hendricks Gin - uber yummy - and he indulged my request for a lovely amarena cherry with my lime slice. It got a little busy and we were headed out for a film at the Castro or I would have had another. Thanks for giving us a great cocktail place on Market!

4h6PbbsKjDxEz1sAp8jYog.review_text: This is a great bar that fills a need in SF for classy/trendy-without-pretentious and laid back without completely-hipster/divey. Amazing, delcious cocktails, bloody Marys a must have. Good beer on tap, pool table, comfy couches. Also deserves a shout out for being a bar that refuses to be pigeon holed...being near Castro it's got a good gay scene but there are all sorts of people there as well. Nice to have a place that all of my friends can enjoy and find something they like. I wish there were more bars in SF like Blackbird!

TbtpUxZ8OayCDIMMLMkqlg.review_text: My company hosted our anniversary party here recently and I was really impressed by this bar. The drinks were great, carefully crafted and not overly trendy. The bartenders were approachable and easily recommended drinks that I hadn't tried yet but matched my taste. I'm sure the service was great partly because we bought out the place but the real win here are the cocktails. I must say the Birds & the Bees is the best cocktail I've had in a long time and at $8 each it's worth it for what you get.  Cash only people!

wSwmRXQq9-zfW91NfyQa_g.review_text: here is the breakdown of blackbird's 4 star rating:  -1: stirred, not shaken manhattan. +1: manhattan was surprisingly delicious. +1: cinnamon liqueur braised brandied cherries in my cocktail. +1: actually, that gets two points. they're really good. +2: old overholt whiskey.

8NQ5Uck0qiirJyUNEbaUAw.review_text: Strong drinks amidst sexy professional men. Too bad they're all gay!! Ah well. Get a drink (recommended: the farmers daughter) and have fun people watching!

Hl1f4VO0a9KdGrrRCPMqSA.review_text: Tasty drinks and a very really nice staff.

5keAoLzGQ2D06Zm_VbOwSA.review_text: Over priced drinks and they do not take cards. It's an upscale place that is cash only. Super lame. It took over 20 minutes to get a drink and they were not even that busy. Won't be coming back.

QOb9_9RmdtrpmgaeAbT1Ew.review_text: My second time at this bar, had more than one hour to enjoy their atmosphere. This time there were more than one other couple here. We enjoyed their Pimms cup, had more than two each, our second round, Nathan - amazing bartender by the way, recommended we try a fresh mix of the drink rather than their mix on tap. Amazing idea, he was incredibly attentive and personable. Really great guy honestly. The bar had an amazing atmosphere even though it seemed a darker, more sulkier bar in the Castro it has this sort of close feeling to it. Anyhow, I've loved this bar and will absolutely be coming back to try more of their crazy concoctions!

ksLEtpBAdVGaEramRXYYSQ.review_text: If you are hunting for good drinks and a great location then you should probably head to Blackbird. I've been a few times and each time the place is crowded, but not so much so that you can't move around or get a drink. (And yes, there is something to be said for a bar that attracts a good crowd on a Monday night!). They have speciality cocktails and are downright delicious and constantly rotating so even if you've been its worth coming back to see what they have mixed up this week... Great spot for drinks.

JQGGHtzTA10plLAPIXM5jQ.review_text: Went to Blackbird last night for an after dinner drink, I'd been before and wasn't swayed one way or the other. I ordered a mint julep, and goodness gracious was it amazing. Served over crushed Ice, in a silver mixing tin, topped with confectioner's sugar. My friend, Chris L. ordered an equally amazing cocktail " Where there's heat there's fire" which was the most gorgeous colored cocktail i'd ever seen. The bartender took his time to craft each, and it was well worth the wait.

VJJnE7ZOdnG4Bgg9JpV_XQ.review_text: I give this place a 5 star review for more than just a few reasons! Read below: I was researching nice loungey bars where I could have my birthday gathering. I was looking for something chill enough but with that little swanky touch and came across Blackbird! I had checked out a couple of other bars but the other places didn't quite live up to what I wanted.  First of all, my initial contact with Shawn (general mgr) was great! He called me back right away and let me know that he could reserve a spot for my group and I. This place was perfect because it has a pool table and photo booth in the back which (in my book) is always a plus! The space is narrow but has a lot of seating space for several groups to enjoy their time. The drink menu is tasty and the all around vibe of the place is great! I would absolutely come back to this bar for any sort of gathering or just a night out with a few friends.   It has a very welcoming, fun, dim lit San Francisco vibe!

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: My 2nd time going there will be tonight. 1st time there was nice, crazy crowded but I like the set up, good but expensive drinks. Cool photo booth in the back.

xQa55k6FDGISxZGLWvrxxQ.review_text: One of my biggest hobbies is mixing high end cocktails in my apartment, and I take it very seriously.  Because of that, I'm VERY skeptical of bartenders that fuck up drinks.  This place passes my test with flying colors!  The bartenders both do a GREAT job.  They did the little things right.  Shook the right drinks, stirred the right drinks.  Added ice etc at the right time.  And the bar has all the right glassware for drinks to be in the proper vessel for them.  Some cool cocktails they've made up, and the "gypsy tears" was my favorite.  I'm normally not a big fan of loud bars, but I would go back to this place in a heartbeat!  Well done!

IkifO6OoAguDY5zvImIncQ.review_text: I went here for my friends going away party and I had a great time We went on a sunday and we took up most of the place. The bar itself is really nice. Old newspaper headlines are used as wallpaper, beautiful bar, pool table in the back, and major plus..PHOTO BOOTH!!! Great place to sit and socialize w/friends. bartenders are very nice and make good drinks. However, be ready to spend money cause drinks are pricey. Nine bucks average for a drink

3xrb0LpbaJ24Pkdyd55U8Q.review_text: How have I never been here?? Love love love it! The drinks are delicious and creative, they actually have Pimms Cups (and made very well at that), and the crowd is somewhat eclectic (something that seems oddly difficult to find in SF bars).   I also loved the bar's interior design, but as my gay friend said, "You're in the Castro - if there's one thing we know how to do, it's make a place look good."

_HVQorAvXWMwJ0cxwDp7Zg.review_text: I've been back to this bar lots of times since my first review and it's still a great place to hang out. I usually steer clear on Fri and Sat nights (too crowded for my tastes), but non-happy hour times are still a good bet. The cocktails are delicious as always and the bartenders are a lot less snooty than the ones at Orbit Room down the street. And it's closer than the Alembic. So, automatic win-win situation in my book!

Ki63sCyQGGUSksbFK6SRQQ.review_text: Met a friend for happy hour here the other night.........it was fun. Cheap cocktails for the beginning of an evening. The bartendresses were fantastic - fast, friendly and super-cute. The bar is laid out well - enough space to move freely about the cabin. The bathroom.......definitely not my favorite. I hope they change their minds about the no-lock situation. Unfortunately adults in this situation do not really behave as adults....nuf' said. It's just unnecessarily uncomfortable. I'll be back though.

2m9P3bXwJz6T0IgrNH3lMw.review_text: I went the evening of Memorial Day.  Hands down the best Midori Sour I've had in the city, or anywhere actually.  The bartender didn't use sweet and sour mix and instead used actual lemon and something else.  It was really good, just the right amount of tart.  It was loud in the bar and surprisingly crowded for being a Monday evening but we were able to snag a small table in the very front.

-wE8vpFmsvIwcbD9j-mUrQ.review_text: Here's the trouble with Blackbird: Amazing cocktails here, arguably in my top 5 in the whole Bay. And yet...the most uncomfortable tables and seating ever. So you are drinking these strong, amazing drinks and yet can't wait to leave, because you & your friends are spilling those wonderful drinks on the lame, unevenly-textured slate tables (uneven surfaces on bar tables is a dumb design idea, sorry) and squirming in the horrible chairs. If you haven't already bruised yourself because the tables are knee-height, you can't help but wonder when it's your turn. It makes it REALLY HARD to want to stay for more drinks. Why, Blackbird, why?

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: Blackbird singing in the dead of niiiiight, take these broken wings and learn to fly....  Oh my dear Paul, if you would come and have one Old Fashioned with me at Blackbird, maybe throw in a little serenation, life would be but a dream. And I will dream on, while I sip my drinky.   It was a busy night for a Wednesday so I sheepishly asked the bartender if he would mind making me an Old Fashioned, and he kindly obliged. It was strong as an ox, the presentation was lovely with a giant ice cube and an orange peel. I slurped it down happily as I chatted with my pals. Clean and nicely decorated bar, sweet area, all around a great experience.

5k0AYioQAwUT3K-v7UQZxw.review_text: A good bar for groups and people watching. Has a great drink list, too.

1hVPMnVp3-r1X8Nrv_T3dw.review_text: This place is good for scenery but the drinks are junk. You have to give a place credit for experimenting and they surely do. The last two seasons, the drinks always taste like cherry cough syrup with turpentine or cherry cough syrup and whisky or any other combination. They're gross. At a moderate price, I would like my 9 dollars to get something I enjoy.  Since this is a local watering hole of a crowd I like, I hope things improve when the menu changes next season.  They might be up to your tastes or order a standard cocktail and be treated to "handy" work from the bartender and fresh juices.  Obviously they care and I've got to give a place credit for that.  You can't go wrong with their beer selection.

Ju5QHprf8I-dhbWndmjSkw.review_text: Better make sure it is happy hour.  If not, the prices increase exponentially.  Much too expensive to be on your list of regular bars.   I've seen some complaints about the noise.  I won't knock points off for that.  C'mon, people.  It is a bar.  What do you expect?

1z5LVnZhXrWgsQgMDpIIzw.review_text: I met up with some friends here for a cocktail before heading to the Swedish American Hall and it did not disappoint.    Having gone there when it was the Expansion, I was amazed to see the transformation.  I have nothing against the dive it was before, I love dives, but this new bar was a little lighter, a little bigger (hey must have knocked out a back room or something), and a lot less dreary.    I also find that a bartender can really make or break a place, and the guys here made it.  They were extremely nice, patient and made a mean cocktail (and reasonably priced ones at that).  And the dark wood bar against the light wall was striking.  I also liked that although it was a Saturday night, we all got a seat.  And it had a nice friendly vibe and so close to my house.  I'd definitely go back there again.

HT8kyFqLLDsyHGZ34LMtcw.review_text: Why is it that every time I order a cocktail from a bar I end up with a drink served in a girlie cup? WTF!?!?! At Blackbird I ordered the bitter end. Sounds like a manly drink right? WRONG. It comes in a coupe... google it and tell me you don't think it's for a pinky out kind of drink .  Anyway, it was quite tasty, so I got over my insecurities of holding a girlie cup pretty quick. Happy hour from 5-8? Sold! I'm also intrigued by the awesome beer selection. They have Black Butte on draft which is one of my favs. Come check this place out. It has a great vibe and I can't wait to return.   Now if I could only do something about my predilection to select drinks served in girlie cups...

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: Love this place. Went there for the first time this Saturday. We found a nice area of the bar towards the front but on the side, away from the throngs that come in to order drinks. So we got to watch the mixologists in action. And they are indeed mixologists! They mixed those drinks with such care and artistry. And the drinks we had were soo good! I tried one item from their menu, the Pimms Cup and that was so good! $9.. that's amazing value. And my favorite drink Sidecar was only $8! Usually you pay $10-14 in the city!  Vibe of the place was very laid back, a good mix of people. Young, old, gay straight, men, women. I'm a fan!

EIvZQ5-V4C0oxLDTZievng.review_text: I went in on a Friday minutes before they opened at 3p. My wife and I wanted a quick drink before our next stop. We've been here before and had a great time. But sadly, this last experience makes me wonder what happened.   Strike 1: I ask the man, who we later learn is the bartender, propping open the front door, "Is the bar open?" He responds, "Well, we are now." [Not the best way to welcome your first guests. No smile. No eye contact.]  Strike 2: The same guy hands us a couple of menus. Based on experience at other bars, I ask another question, "Is it OK if I order drinks not on the menu?" He responds, "That's a really bizarre question. Look behind me, this is a bar. You can order whatever you want." [Again, what was with the attitude? We were the only 2 people there.]  Strike 3: He gives us a minute, which gives me a moment to talk with my wife. That's when we notice all of the fruit flies feasting on the garnishes and fruit lining the bar. [Are those yesterday's garnishes? Are they fresh? Did you not notice the fruit fly infestation prior to opening the doors? Sorry, I don't want that in my drink.]  It's ironic that the front window says, "Leave all pretensions at the door," when there was a whole bunch of it behind the bar.  TL;DR - The bartender was very rude, we were grossed out by the flies, we didn't order a drink, and we politely excused ourselves.

qqRAAvogQXrCAf4fOAnOvQ.review_text: Shout out to Shaun (sorry if I misspelled)  and Charlie! thanks for setting the friendly vibes with your smiles and charm despite the rush. Charlie, thanks for helping me select a tasty beer and letting me taste it beforehand. It was a great experience, great work guys!

ZAc5vMMYLgyYqgjHXGce3Q.review_text: Amazing hipster mixologist heaven with excellent cocktails. It was a busy, loud Saturday night when I was there, but we all managed to have a good time. I have no recollection what drinks I had. I think I had a mojito and a variation on a sidecar, and both were great.
