ZEB8s6MEYHma34kWJ9meCg.review_text: My new favorite bar. It looks amazeballs after the remodel. So thank you blackbird for contributing and encouraging my alcoholism.   And it is one of the few bars (shockingly) in sf that might actually be mixed.

Uqv8B3vCJrT0_78HCCeokQ.review_text: Sometimes you just want a bar where you can wear a black wife-beater and tight jeans, grease up your bulging arms (and bulging bulge) and dance your pretty little heart out.   I never want those bars. And this is certainly not one of those bars. And this is why Blackbird and I are about to embark on a beautiful relationship. One where we might occasionally make out after a few drinks (but I won't go any further, I swear!).   This is a great cross between being divey/chill and trendy/fun. It's a very long and narrow bar with lots of seats and tables (made out of bark?) all down the left-hand side. There are some old school red diner booths in the back that sandwich an old pool table. Some of the walls have old school SF Inquirer front pages (and by "old-school," I mean JFK and WWII style). Other walls have paintings and funky lights.   I hear it can get crowded depending on the time of night, so either come here in the early evening or as your final spot.

7nNrdRd0VcEATAljrwafAw.review_text: My favorite bar. Stiff, well-made drinks in a boozily low-lit space. Grown-up and casual. The bartenders know their stuff, and treat people right. I'm always satisfied with my Old Fashioneds. Only downside for me: Cash only.

ANJ-jY5M8k-FKd7kr7x93w.review_text: I came here for the first time last night, and must say I really enjoyed myself when the place wasn't packed to the brim.  I walked in, and loved the rustic, sea breeze warn decor.  The lighting was soft and inviting to the eye.  The petrified wood tables added a nice touch to the seemingly sailor jaunt the place could have been back in the 1800s.  The layout is long and narrow: bar on the right, seating on the left--seemingly reminiscent of similar bars in NYC.  The drinks here are good, especially taking into consideration of the fresh ingredients they have available for the drinks.  I did notice that the bartender was able to make my drinks, and if he didn't know he quickly found out from another bartender (my Kentucky mint julep for example), and learned my shot later, buffalo sweat, was bourbon and Tabasco.  I will say the bartender was rude at one point, and is part of the reason why knocking them a star.  If you start out asking me what I'm ordering, and then immediately turn to the person next to me and flirt with her before coming back and asking me what my drink is again, I'm not going to be a happy camper.  The other point I didn't really care for was when the place got packed.  It was really hard to move throughout the bar, and it took a fair amount of time to get through the crowd to actually get another drink.  The crowd here is mixed, yet is certainly well-balanced from what I could tell.  For this seemingly being a straight/gay bar, it seemed to lean slightly more towards gay scene.  In any regard, a few guys certainly caught my eye.  All-in-all, another great bar to hit up when it isn't packed.  I would certainly check it out even though it is a few blocks away from Castro.

LdeYSL_KsoilCqj7HJsWDQ.review_text: So after I wrote my review, I received a personal note from the owner apologizing for my lackluster experience and requesting that I give this bar another go.  Yesterday, my pal and I revisited.  And, we had a splendid time.  Very nice bartender. Easy to talk to. Offered us samples of the brews we were curious about.  Friendly clientele and comfortable space.  Super clean bathroom.  Good pool table.  A short while before we left, the woman that I had had issue with on my last visit appeared.  I didn't want to jinx the good time we were having so I didn't attempt to order from her.  No matter.  The friendliness of the bartender redeemed this place in my mind and I'm glad that we gave it a second run

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Always a good spot for a good drink.  They open up at 3, but happy hour doesn't start till 5pm, so plan accordingly.

qZmAcUcbp4Q9l7NO4IcGSw.review_text: Blackbird is a chill place to have happy hour.  It's not super crowded, plenty of seating, and perfect for a drink, or two, or three!  Great happy hour pricing.  Draught beer is $1 off, Bud/Bud Light/PBR $2, House Red/White $5/$6, Wells Drinks $4, and Sours $5.

J8_KEdgc9_k9PCLia16DlA.review_text: How can I not have written up Blackbird after all these years? The drinks here are among the best in the country. Period. Blackbird constantly finds new ways to play with, reinvent, surprise and delight with their cocktails. I've had countless wonderful nights of conversation and reunions on my SF visits, not one of which has gone by without a stop here pretty much since they opened.   Now, when you're at the top of your class, you know it. Especially when it's super crowded, certain bartenders have been complete dicks. You can cut them some slack via artist's temperament, but, I just don't think any unprovoked situation warrants assholery, and I'd suggest they restrict entry better if there are too many people for them to handle. Obviously that doesn't dent my feelings about their booze, but I've seen the behavior enough to confirm it happens and I don't like it either.   No need to specify recommendations, since they change anyway - just try everything, or at least stick with your liquor and you won't be disappointed.

Lr7i1zifMpk-fYOiMsju3w.review_text: Hey there castro! All in all a good cocktail. The leatherback book is pretty astounding. Tres chic interior and even a pool table in the back.  not really my crowd, but definitely will stop back by to try other drinks.

S0_FxmbFVahIIbzojRpMSQ.review_text: Really really REALLY tasty drinks!!! A bit priced, but sooo good. The bartenders are also extremely friendly and enthusiastic. Too bad it's nearly impossible for a girl to hustle herself a drink here (unless you bring your ballin' sig fig).

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: Perhaps he says it to everyone, but when the bartender told me that a vodka-soda is supposed to be with lemon, not lime (just the way I like it) and gives me an extra large lemon to garnish my drink, I knew I liked this place.  I fell in love when, after playfully complaining that my second lemon was far smaller than its predecessor, he gave me a large squeeze of fresh lemon juice.  Blackbird is definitely a great "new" bar. The renovation of Metro to Blackbird has transformed the ambiance into a great place to grab a drink post-work or pre-night-out.  The bar does not take credit cards, but should be soon. I think the bar is suffering from "post-remodeling popularity" so the space is loud and full, even on a Tuesday night.

VatYPF-gubOpCy_bRUpNkg.review_text: Their cocktail by the name of "El Guapo" packs a solid alcoholic punch - me likey!   ALSO a great way to tell if your friend or date is drunk... have them order the "El Guapo" and going by how badly they mush up the pronunciation when ordering, you'll know how schnokkered they are!

17dx_x9W_7QBT-3oiQQEQQ.review_text: A lil' bit of everything for everyone:   Pool table? Check. Photo booth? Check. Ample seating in various forms? Check. Historic literature plastered on the walls? Cool artwork to look at? Double check. Great beer? Cocktails? Cordials? Wine? YES.   On the beer side,I love that they have Sudwerk! As a UCDavis grad, that makes me proud.  Booze-wise, they have chartreuse and a nice little drinky called  the Early Bird - really light yet flavorful drink mixed with Elderflower liqueur, Vodka, and soda water.  Good happy hour, great vibe.

7irfSXEb3yPGX2Yz7KplwQ.review_text: Blackbird is my favorite bar in San Francisco. I spent New Year's here with my sister and her boyfriend and trust me, there's no better place to ring in 2013 than in the dimly lit and raucous atmosphere here. It's definitely a good mix of gays and straights here so no one is too left out.   Yes, its cash only, so make sure to plan accordingly. But those cocktails...oof so strong and of such a great quality. I make sure to tip a little more here because you can just tell there's a lot of effort and care put in these drinks that you can't really get anywhere else.

HO35wso-psqx0GF--QSwGA.review_text: very cool/trendy lounge. came here with a couple of friends for HH one afternoon and was definitely impressed. wasnt too crowded and this is a kind of bar/lounge where you can actually sit down and have a conversation (at least for HH, might be diff at night). the HH specials are pretty decent. wine is $5-6 and well drinks are about the same but beer is a bit cheaper. PBR goes for a whopping $2.50 haha. all in all a fun hang out spot in the castro.

dC8WvTTHqBJCh8NjX_Attg.review_text: smack in the heart of castro this is a gem amongst the surrounding competition. the interior decor is humble yet elegant giving off a very intimate vibe. i like the way the seating is arranged. you can get real comfortable in their plush leather couches. the bartender made me a special spicy watermelon margarita during my last visit. i really appreciated the accommodating efforts. great selection of beers and a good variety of happy hour options. great spot to explore delicious cocktails. don't forget to check out the pool table and photo booth in the back!! i played 4 games on that pool table, great times! :D  CASH ONLY! there's an atm in the back.

jCbB2UKfrvSGgWq-6ep7Gw.review_text: Do - Dress well People come here dress to impress. Even the minimalists pull off the fashion so well. I'd say check out 80s Purple for some fashion tips, but overall, be a little adventurous. Best thing I saw? REALLY cool argyle underwear. Hot.  Don't - Dress Marina Go to Trigger for that.  Do - People watch One of the best places in the city for people watching. On a given Friday and Saturday night, hundreds of fashion conscious gay's come through this rectangular joint and take note. Find a good people watching seat with a friend or two and enjoy! The topic of conversation will be noticeably different than other people watching places like Zeitgeist. Here, you'll talk about fashion and hot asses. At Zeitgeist, you'll talk about how weird and drunk people are (equally as amazing though).  Don't - Get too drunk here You'll run into far too many people you know, make an ass of yourself, and not remember what happened. I think I need a tattoo of that statement......  Do - Compliment Sean on the great bar he's help create. He's cute and super cool.  Don't - Think everyone who works here is gay. Let's just say some mistakes have been made on our end with that.  Blackbird DESPERATELY needs a really good jukebox (perhaps with the playlist they have at Phone Booth). It would put it over the top.

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: Best cocktails in the Castro.  The most expensive possibly, but also the best.  There is one of these "hand made" cocktail places in almost every hood now.  Blackbird is the one for the sTro.

dm0bTqbRNWdLa0yR0du3xA.review_text: Gave a 4 star rating since I've been a big fan of Blackbird from the day they opened. But think they're loosing their way with the drink menu. Was a true believer in their original concept of updating traditional cocktails. It's sad when I went by tonight and read a list of eight cocktails and none of the new additions were appealing. Actually tried a couple and wasn't swayed. They struck me as gimmicky. Stick to the classics and don't get caught up in the mixologist frenzy.

afHFsG7A3ZUQs7_sKFmwHA.review_text: I hardly ever get to the Castro, so I'm no expert on the 'hood, but I can't see how Blackbird could possibly be anything but a fantastic addition.   I could not stop looking around--they did such a great job on the interior (I can't figure out what was in this space before. A little help?). My companion commented that it has the "outside, inside" feel, like Blue Bayou restaurant at Disneyland. I cannot affirm or deny this  claim as I've (gasp!) never been, but I nonetheless agree. The suspended ceiling of uneven planks and rough-hewn stone tables make one side of the space feel sort of like being at the beach, while the gorgeous wood bar on the opposite side is evocative of a classy old saloon circa Gold Rush era SF. As DID as that may sound, it all works together really nicely, and comfortably. Oh, and I dug the current paintings, as well.  All I can say about the drinks (as I didn't try any of their signatures), is that their well selection is completely acceptable, and they were served with care. I hear the happy hour is worthwhile, too.   Great place to impress someone and I like the writing on the website. Extra points for that. Cheers!

_pWlNUG-v5Q9QzzSBqGwCA.review_text: Blackbird is aiming to open around 8 PMish on Thursday, July 23. The cocktail menu and beer list look good, and they serve wine by the glass. I'm definitely heading by to check it out tonight - review to be updated accordingly!

qt_tanOTyw9d531vBaJutw.review_text: Went to the bar at around 3:00pm on a Sunday and it was still pretty busy considering the time.  The place was a little hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking for, but i hear they will be putting up a bit more signage to make the place easier to find.    -Decor:  Warm and inviting, I think it strikes a good balance between being friendly and trendy.  Love the artwork, petrified tables, and SF newspaper wallpaper.  -Staff:  I must say nothing like service with a smile.  Never waiting long for my drinks and always willing to accommodate.  -Crowd:  One of the best things about this place is its diverse crowd.  Everyone was friendly and just having a good time.  What more can ask for?  All in all a great bar, amazing job by the staff, you can't go wrong at this local watering hole.

NgapNNErXajBp6Ro5I21Jg.review_text: This watering hole is very laid back and casual. No attitude kind of atmosphere but it gets really crowded on the weekends. Not a dive bar and not really upscale, but somewhere in the middle. I really like the energy of this place. The age of the crowd is 20-ish to 40-ish. Drink specials are listed on a chalk board on the side of the bar. I'm sure they can make you frufru drinks but it looks more like a beer and wine kind of place. Bartenders are very cool, although I left my drink outside to go to the bathroom and when I came back it was cleared away.

OuctLwU6jyhk0-oROtfJsw.review_text: Blackbird: Inconsistent pricing - two different bar tenders charged us different prices for the same drinks. And no it wasn't happy hour!  Over-priced weak drinks - $10 for soda water and ice? Oh yeah there was supposed to vodka in that drink.  Long wait - two bars tenders ain't enough to handle the orders.  Good thing is people are catching on and going elsewhere so the wait time is reduced

ms5cezvfYjEHadbvuHD63w.review_text: I like this bar. It is one of those new bars where it's sort of hipster-classy with that rustic wood interior and very large drink menu that is handwritten onto a huge piece of meat-wrap-type paper, hanging on the wall.   They know their drinks and, unlike other hipster(ish) bars, they have good customer service that is fair to all standing, waiting to order.   As a bourbon drinker, i was pleased that they use Four Roses as their primary bourbon. The variety of drinks is great and it is always appreciated when you get good cocktails sans snobbiness.

pSms5uzIwl_eM6Gi7vVFYQ.review_text: Delicious celery gimlets alone worth the trip. But add in the great bar snacks (tasty and gluten-free friendly, a rare find!), the chill mid-week ambiance and the friendly bartenders and I'm sold. Packing my bags and moving in! P.S. Great photo booth in the back of the bar for all of those who're fans of the classic 4-picture sheets...

1e8mZOLO42C4syKPmt0dIg.review_text: new menu!!! not to say there was anything wrong with the old one. but the new version is crackalackin!!! love their play on traditional drinks ...they have truly found a way to bypass the stupid laws that prohibit liquor infusion , i think this place is the new wave of bars and mixology . try something special when you go: it ll blow ur mind....also very queer friendly , so if your a homophobe dont come here please.

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: Yes, Home Restaurant in SF is closed...sadly, you can no longer drink at home!  As such, if you're looking for a cool neighborhood bar in the area with artisanal drinks...Blackbird is a great place to hang.  Popped in here for a bit this evening and had the nicest time hanging out and exploring their extensive and most unique cocktail menu.  The bartender was so cool...didn't get his name, but I'm sure i will next time.  Had a gin based drink called the Bayonet with brandied cherries and unlike what the name implies, I didn't get skewered or mortally wounded.  LOL...would have stayed longer, but I knew that there were bars to be hit and drinks to be drunk...yes, my dementia father is driving me up the wall and I needed a brief  escape.  As all my good friends on Yelp know, I love birds...how could I not love a place to imbibe with a bird theme called Blackbird? :)  Fantastic place and also just walking distance from Lucky 13 which is within stumbling distance for when you want to explore the darker side of barhopping.  In a crazy way, the two complement each other perfectly.  As always, I am eclectic and refuse to change.

ogyqyw3MBW7_GTvpNiLx6A.review_text: Success! Everything about this place was cool. My brother and I went there and got pretty sloshy off just two of their drinks. My brother knows how he likes his drinks and directed the bartender as such. Our bartender Nancy was amazing. She mixed it perfectly and had a great hand shake. She was patient and chill. And to be very honest, I've never enjoyed a Manhattan more than Nancy's.   Black bird was very enjoyable, because all around me, there was something cool to look at. People were doing their own thing, Tom Edison style bulbs lit the mahogany bar, a simple menu written on parchment, and warm red accents added to an overall encompassing environment. Very nicely done.   Don't taint this place or I'll cut you. Only reason I am dropping down a star is because of the clientele; there were some drunk a holes. Not totally Blackbird's fault but I would have cut them off sooner.  Still, amazing.

OqTpZMgETc4UB30xQPujzQ.review_text: fun place, cool crowd, interesting cocktails!

cpg93yMQpYKTk2pwoB_1aQ.review_text: They know their drinks at Blackbird! There were so many delicious sounding drinks on the menu it was hard to decide which to try! so...I tried many :-)  Poached Pear, Bull Fighter and the good old Pimm's Cup! The beer list is really great too - and only $2 during happy hour.  A super-cute crowd too!!

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: Good drink selection + Chill vibe + No cover *cough*Bruno's*cough* + Places to sit + CLEAN BATHROOMS! + Non-obnoxious people = A good time Saturday night  BUT... All of the above - awful vodka-cran that made me sick the next morning (not hangover sick, but "this is not agreeing with my stomach sick") = A horrible Sunday morning  Good job for the most part, Blackbird.  I'll just steer clear of your vodka next time.

vNxbFoKLJoFjSOWsDBl5Jg.review_text: This place features fantastic cocktails (although a tad pricey), great beers on draft, beautiful people and nice decor. Almost could maybe might be my new favorite bar, but the acoustics are absolutely fucking horrible. Other than that, Blackbird is fantastic.  I had the pleasure of enjoying the cocktail appropriately dubbed 'the leather-bound book', and it definitely lives up to its name. Ron Burgundy would be proud!

QNyyMP4Cu-5PTzjIwZIZ8A.review_text: At 37 I managed to get kicked out a bar. Kind of sad but kind of awesome. In this case for making out-whatever. It was probably my subconcious screaming for an exit from this place. I'm sure its nice but I found it rather sterile and made for more conservative types than myself. Ah well, 3 stars for mediocrity, 1 for kicking my tush out.

da5-C7PMP_FTk5OCgcVY_Q.review_text: "This cocktail is delicious!" "What!?!" "I said, 'This cocktail is delicious!"" "Oh, yes, the decor is very beautiful!" "What!?!" "I agree, this is a beautiful space!" "Are you saying you want to go someplace else!?!" "What did you say!?!" "If you want to stay, that's fine.  The cocktails *are* delicious!" "I can't hear you!" "What!?!" "Never mind;  I'm going to get more pretzels!"

l_mlQJXB2ZNySfIN6istGw.review_text: A whole mess of unique cocktails, painstakingly mixed at the bar. Several nice beers on draught. $3 Happy Hour. Went on an early weeknight.  Nice crowd:  lively but not boisterous.  Good mix all around, with tendency toward younger gay professional.

qwBq50vfZX9xc8oqi-nIhg.review_text: Damn, this place ROCKS.  My friend and I are on a mission to find the best negroni in the city. I'm pretty sure we hit the best right off the bat! The bartender was amazing (man... I wish I wasn't so flighty on names...) and let us know about all the best ingredients. Gin, Campari and vermouth with a little orange zest.... simple right? Not really.... Apparently, he's a fan of the negroni, too so he filled us in on what he thinks makes the best negroni which I found to be very educational. Which led us to trying several different types of negroni to determine which we liked best... and we did find a winner.  Beyond the awesome negroni and bartender, this place is really nicely decorated inside with red leather seats, white walls, and cool art on the walls. I really enjoyed being there. It was open enough (tall ceilings!) that even with a bunch of people, it didn't feel stuffy which is important if you're like me and hate crowds.  On thing I can say is that I will be back to try the Apple Cart (Applejack, rose vermouth, cassis, lemon and lavendar) because that just sounds A-MAZING but didn't sound like it went too well with the negroni feast we were having! Returning is a necessity!

mx-dFZZ75kGi9aQk0vY4Pw.review_text: I've been here 89869018985 times in the past week or so.  It's safe to say that I love Blackbird.  The bartenders are on point and serve up some mean cocktails with a smile.  Love that.  My only requests, and they're small, would be getting Miller Lite available and possibly adding back the jukebox.  I'm a sucker for putting too much money into a jukebox to play a song I've heard a million times.  Otherwise, keep on keeping on you sexy beast.  Xoxoxoxo.

F5LhbsLPALA0B_yUBG2n9A.review_text: Is Blackbird the hot new bar in SF?  I went last night and have to say "yes". The bar was packed by 5:30 pm.  It's location at Church and Market guarantees a hearty bleed of Mission hipsters and sassy gay men.  Lots of specialty cocktails on the menu, including blended Pina Coladas! The bartenders were super cool and nice, the type that wait for you to take the first sip so they can slip you the overflow (of your beverage--get your mind out of the gutter!)  On this occasion we hung out with two Sisters of PI and a candidate for a hairy chest calendar. Pool table, photo booth and big orange booths...what's not to love?

mqspCK5k_EJfXqg-4FR1Lw.review_text: This is one of the best remodels I have ever seen -- really great that they kept the vintage bar! When I was in there it was pretty crowded, and I thing the staff are still getting the hang of how the new digs "flow".   Not the old dive bar that it was, but a nice addition to the Church and Market hood.

QxicE6c4zNxYYJh_aeywlA.review_text: Hot days, and ice cold Watermelon Wheat Beer .......  Nuff said.

xQwp_9V1O71m-ynSgig0nA.review_text: Drinks worth trying here are their tiger's tale, Bayonet, and bloody mary. YUM. The tiger's tale has ginger beer in it so it's definitely sweeter, but the Bayonet is a mixture of sweet, fruity, and bitter. SOOOO good. Super complex. Definitely a quality cocktail. Their bloody mary is spicy and served with a huge stalk of celery, olives, and a pearl onion. It's like eating a savory meal and it's kind of filling like one too.  The first drink I had here was actually the hopscotch, and I didn't care for it. Another MUST try is their leather-bound book which isn't on their menu. I don't know if it is a secret cocktail or what not, but I told the bartender I've only had one good old fashion in my life and so he whipped me up a leatherbound book and sent me off. This drink was super smooth, super balanced, and it will eff you up!

0SdkhGv62nZHScnUrpDndw.review_text: Lovely venue when its empty. The last few times i tried to go here, it was way too packed to even enjoy it and had a hard time getting a drink. Came here during the day so it was empty and quiet.  I tried a mocktail and had the bartender make up something with raspberries and mint, he was super nice and just went with it. It was a great spontaneous non-alcoholic drink. The Pimms Cup was also a good drink that my friend ordered.

rzoKEiJso6LR8zbicuZlGw.review_text: Good cocktails in nice glasses! Dark and stylish interior. Give it a try!

KN8fWphIRRCgiS4Shwk5dQ.review_text: I'll be back.  Came in here for the sole purpose of trying their barrel-aged cocktails--yes, you read that correctly.  Barrel-aged Cocktail: a single serving of a large batch of a pre-mixed cocktail has been aged in a oak barrel for 5-6 weeks.    We ordered both the Vieux Carré (Rye, Cognac, Sweet Vermouth, Benedictine and bitters) and the Rhum Negroni (Rhum JM Agricole, Campari, and Cocchi Americano).  The Vieux was incredibly drinkable, but as a barrel-aged cocktail virgin, the Rhum Negroni was simply eye-opening: silky, rounded,  with a tempered bitterness from the Campari.  Neither really tasted like cocktails as much as they did like delicious and mysterious nectars from the heavens.

8aXz2sYGB342VLr8HZUw4w.review_text: If you are like me it makes you very unhappy to go out and spend $7.50 or more on a well liquor and a sloppy poured terrible tasting drink.  If you feel that way too, this is your solution.  Well crafted and blended cocktails.  Great space and talented bar tenders.  Can get pretty packed and is on the smaller size space wise like many places in SF, but worth the limited space around you for the good cocktails.  I guess people don't know a cocktail can be enjoyable or are out to just get drunk on cheap booze and have terrible pain the next day if they do not look for something better like you will find here!

g-_l8DFskNJRSZI-9XP2AA.review_text: pretty doucey, no real hipsters would be caught dead there.  Lame staff  overall, crappy.  hugz n stuff,  P

kgnoey45lJCNgxAJOnAraw.review_text: Stopped here with my GF after brunching and strolling in the Castro last Sunday. Several friends recommended the place as they have a better than average selection of beers. They were right. I was happy to see Little Sumpin' Ale on tap and was quick to have a few. We were the only people in there for about an hour or so, but the service was impeccable. Guys behind the bar know a thing or two about beer. Though a gay bar (didn't know that when we went LOL), this is the kind of place I could hang out in.

gDnpek-PmWLE-O7uLssgJw.review_text: Hold onto your drinks this is one crowded bar!

hkEmdF3NXVS7H4CzSDlqkw.review_text: I'm a big fan of Churchill around the corner, but thought I should try a new scene, and I'm glad I did! Blackbird was a quiet scene in the early afternoon when I was there, but I could see it easily packed on the weekend. The bartender knew everybody there, it seemed, and gave helpful advice on pairings to anyone he didn't. He recommended the Early Bird, which I was a fan of. I could see it being really easy to lose a whole afternoon in this place!

8l2GpNX3PNJfGCLTRfLrfg.review_text: BIG fan.  This place is a great little spot.  Drinks were really well-crafted and well-priced (great value).  I thought that the bartenters were really friendly and the crowd was a nice, diverse neighborhood mix.  I tried to go back my second night (a Thursday), but it was so damn crowded that you couldn't get to the bar.  So, I left.  Too bad.  I had another couple of drinks that I would love to have tried.

vNxPY34PBSzDu7QENvmaqQ.review_text: Nice owner, creative drinks, pretty crowd.

94Vdm34IzLwC-FK3p6bGsw.review_text: Somewhat douchey hipster crowd. Though it's mixed (straight and gay) so that can be a plus for a bigger group.   Drinks are OK. Biggest beef is on weekends there is nowhere and I mean NOWHERE to sit or even stand without being bumped into repeatedly. It's usually quite hot in here, too. Oh, and two stalls per bathroom means the lines are crazy.  I do like the decor. I find myself reading the vintage newspaper headlines on the walls, mostly because my face is pressed up against them due to all the people crushing past me.

azivU1jkJhPSKS6ASMegQQ.review_text: Color me unimpressed  So you have every fresh herb in the world - but no Diet Coke?  LOl - good luck with all that

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: Love this bar! Nice, spacious, clean, breezy, good drinks, good tenders.

LVcYNLGkb44VfIeQCK9tDQ.review_text: Very spacious bar for San Francisco, good drinks that are reasonably priced. Really packed on the weekends.

Iu1KZwQUE_pTJp_wlY5hpQ.review_text: so, it's almost perfect. they make great mixed drinks (i was impressed with the aviation, i believe) and also have some easy drinking beers, like tecate. the bartenders are also very nice! now i present the orders: me: two tecates they quickly handle it, beaming smile, even though i ordered perhaps the cheapest thing in the house an hour later i return to the bar, bartender: two tecates? me: ha no but awesome that you remember me! bartender: (winning smile) what'll it be? me: old fashion (bartender muddles with pride) ... the crowd is great too. the roberta flack version of killing me softly came on the speakers and half the bar started singing along. you can too: listen.grooveshark.com/#… the only downside! noise. the bar was fairly packed, but i've been in super packed bars and had a better chance of hearing people. i wonder if it's something with the acoustics? anyway, given that this bar must be packed every weekend, it's something worth examining on their part, imo

GodI_diMv1dgOFdg8-CyJw.review_text: Great place for imbibers with adventurous palates.  This bar feels slightly upscale compared to most of  the bars in the Castro.  From its old tyme print of a formally dressed blackbird to a bar design that hearkens back to the last century this bar is calling us back to a time before mixed drinks were simply fruit juice and vodka not that there is anything wrong with that but there is so much more to explore.  The bartenders seasonal drinks are sometimes challenging but they show a willingness to use exotic bitters, spirits and mixing ingredients.  From flips and fizzes to more standard martini like drinks.  The bartenders are very friendly and knowledgable.  It's worth showing up on a slow night to chat mixology with them.  They can continually come up with great concoctions and mix classic cocktails with deftness.  One of my favorite bars in San Francisco, a city lousy with first rate bars.

xuDKBkWCn9dlKTTaeLWR6A.review_text: Ahhh Blackbird.  La creme de la creme when it comes to the SF bar scene.   Hand-crafted cocktails meet down-to-earth vibes in this gorgeous lounge, which was recently updated, making it the perfect place to rendezvous for a drink. Or four. Because their menu is just that delicious.. and penned on a giant scroll.. which they are constantly changing out so you never run out of things to try. But don't worry - they'll happily whip up your old favorite even if you don't see it on the menu. Because, the bartenders are pretty much angels sent from boozy heaven. (I literally have yet to have a bad experience and have been coming here for years.) And wait -- THERE'S MORE -- Blackbird gets some serious extra credit for their pool table & PHOTO BOOTH. Yep. Pretty much everything you could ask for in a lounge! And if you're hungry, my favorite pho place is conveniently next door, pizza is across the street and a delicious burrito spot is around the corner!   So much to love!   Cheers to Blackbird & to many more years of what has become an SF staple.

MjlNTynslY_aLDTfGODuIg.review_text: cool and creative cocktails, cash only

LV04Uyb5pnp36nn9pWgAaQ.review_text: I'm somewhat ambivalent about my experience at Blackbird. My Yelp friends all seem to adore it, so perhaps the evening that I popped in was uncharacteristic of the true Blackibird experience.  We dropped in on a Sunday evening after having dinner at a neighboring restaurant. At the time, Blackbird wasn't very busy; only a handful of patrons were consuming libations at the bar. We took our seats and the female bartender provided us with some menus to peruse.   Immediately, after looking at the menu, Blackbird ushered in memories of Noble Experiment in San Diego. It showcased similar types of unique cocktails that one can find at the forbidden Noble. You know, Noble Experiment, that rather ostentatious hole-in-wall (literally), at Neighborhood, that is overrated? To Blackbird's credit, I didn't sense an ostentatious ambience; rather, the only thing I sensed was a less-than-courteous demanor from the bartender. She seemed consumed with tending to her friend(s) that happened to be customers, and we, as I took it, ended up being nothing but distractions to her social life.   Nevertheless, we each had two cocktails. In all honesty, I wasn't very impressed. I remember ordering The Shakedown, a bourbon-inspired cocktail, and wasn't wowed. I moved on to the Silly Rabbit and was also underwhelmed. I don't know, perhaps ordering these types of specialized drinks are just not my cup of tea. Paying upwards of $10-12 for a cocktail should be memorable in a good way. Sadly, the drinks I had at Blackbird weren't. Maybe I should just stick to those drinks that I know will do my liver right everytime:  a vodka pineapple or margarita.

yC8z3ISBoVLdPMoR8PCJkw.review_text: Great bar. Went to the opening last night and was really impressed. You walk in and you just feel the warmth of a pleasant neighborhood bar. I love their cocktails...Earlybird is my fave (lemon/vodka/st.germaine). The bartenders were nice and were really fast. And I love the fact the women's bathroom never had a line! Hah

olMA-PsdkA9d6bDnlYJz0g.review_text: The cocktails here are very tasty, perhaps relying a little too much on being 'unique', and at $10 each they are a little pricey. I would recommend Blackbird as a good place to stop in for one drink before moving on or heading home. This is in part due to the awful seating available. The low tables are exactly at knee height. This means you have to spread your legs far and wide to be able to lean in across the table - that is if you intend to have a conversation over the loud background noise.

V-2e7wNOpFJyJxxxx_FHOg.review_text: Meh. I'll give 'em credit for trying hard, but it comes off a bit too cool for continuation school. The bar tender was so inattentive I had to talk the bar-back into pouring me a drink...which DID get the bartenders attention for some reason, funny because my pretty face and fist full of cash sure didn't.   2 Stars for having booze.  -3 for not being the Expansion.

OWQKrrv2aepcFLUafoZ9BA.review_text: Blackbird is a great bar for a post-work cocktail with friends.  I've only been on weekdays, when it has been easy to get a drink order filled at the bar and a seat (so I can't comment on how busy it is on the weekends).  The cocktails are unique and well done, the bartenders seem interested in what they're doing and are attentive to the patrons.  The crowd is fun and it is a very easy atmosphere.

ycDypTxzxfner5ZWl3_-cA.review_text: I would rate this place higher except for the fact that their restrooms are foul.  Not visable mess but a smell that blows you over as soon as you open the door.  When I mentioned this to a bartender he blew me off stating the restrooms were clean enough.  WTF!  This is not a cheap bar and I don't think it's too much to ask that they steam clean the restroom once in a while.

3eYeqfC7PLinqoQR-cV6BQ.review_text: I've been here a couple of times... DooOOOODE... and DOOOODettes... jus go.  Bring 2 or more other people with U and enjoy the atmosphere... the good-looking eclectic mix of people, the art on the wall, and some of the best drinks  (try a different one everytime u go) I've had in a GRIP or is it GRIPP (inside joke attempt).  5 stars because the homie who I last met here for some drinks made me reailze I may need a neighborhood bar...  lol... take that as you may folks but... jus sayin!   Enjoy!

qGi0xjK3HM3Lfr6kSwKZdw.review_text: There's going to be a good drunken story to come out of here.  A new venue for the Castro, and truly when they say they are a dive bar - that they are. It's really different from what the Metro was, however, for being a dive--it comes with a great ambiance, style, and a nice retro feel to the place.  The photo booth is a good place to document those drunken stories.  We entered it three times, that night.  It's a nice crowd, some trying too hard--but some, who looked like they'd be well equipped to try a few things... on you.  Blackbird, I will be back.
